loans.name: Fidelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fidelina utilizo el crédito anterior en la compra de materia prima para la venta de tortillas y para reparar la cocina artesanal que utiliza para desarrollar sus actividades, su situación financiera ha mejorado y su familia se mantiene, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito con el cual podrá comprar maíz y leña, considera que con la inversión ahorrara y podrá mantener la continuidad de la venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Fidelina used her previous loan to purchase raw materials to make tortillas and also to repair the artisan stove that she uses for her business. Her financial situation has improved and she is supporting her family. She hasn't had any challenges with her business.

She is requesting another loan, which she will use to purchase corn and firewood. She hopes that the investment will allow her to save more money and continue to sell tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood so that she can save more money and continue to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Subarna's Group

texts.en:
Subarna is a 53-year-old single mother standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Bhadrak, Odisha, India.

Life was very tough for her after her husband left her alone. All the burdens of her family came to her shoulders. But she never broke; she was always rock strong in order to move on and lead a happy life with her only daughter, her only hope.

Subarna is currently engaged in a food stall business and works hard in order to meet the household needs. She is very well known for the tasty dishes she provides to her customers. However, due to a lack of financial resources, Subarna is unable to provide a higher education to her only daughter.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Subarna will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her daughter's ITI course. The loan amount will help her daughter to pursue her higher education smoothly and efficiently.

Subarna is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her daughter's ITI course.

loans.name: Sulochana's Group

texts.en:
Sulochana is a humble lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a family of five consisting of her husband and three children.

Sulochana is a fruit vendor by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and meet the household expenses. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home to safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Erkinoi

texts.ru: Эркиной, 59 лет, замужем, есть сын. Образование у Эркиной средне-техническое. Она очень ответственная, оптимистичная и трудолюбивая. В поиске источника дохода для своей семьи, Эркиной в 2012 году начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеется 3 овцы и кролики. Дополнительно она готовит под заказ на продажу национальные блюда. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 овец и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Эркиной планирует вложить в расширение хозяйства.
texts.en: Erkinoi is 59 years old, married and has one son. She has a secondary-technical education. She is very responsible, optimistic and hardworking. To provide a source of income for her family, Erkinoi got involved in agriculture in 2012. Today, her farm contains 3 sheep and rabbits. Additionally, she cooks national dishes to-order. To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 2 sheep and livestock feed. Erkinoi plans to invest the income from the loan into expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy two sheep and livestock feed in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Satyabhama's Group

texts.en:
Satyabhama is a humble lady standing to the middle in the photograph in a green saree. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a small family consisting of her husband and one child.

Satyabhama is a farmer by profession and works very hard in her paddy field in order to sustain her livelihood. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes in her home to safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a toilet and incorporate water pipes.

loans.name: Sok Neng

texts.en: Sok Neng runs a small restaurant in Kantuot Village, living with her niece. She has to get up early to prepare food ingredients. Running a restaurant, she needs a lot of energy to brighten her place and also to entertain customers with a TV. However, her current power is not reliable. It is money- and time-consuming. Sok Neng has to go to charge the battery every two or three days. After she found out that solar energy is the source she needs, she decided to apply for a KIVA loan to pay for good a quality solar home system. She believes a solar home system can reduce her burden and make her business grow better.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Kantuot Village, Kantuot Commune, Chetr Borei Dist

loans.name: Chamroeurn

texts.en: Chamroeurn, a farmer and also a fisherman, lives in Po Village with wife and three children. Chamroeurn gets up early in the morning to prepare the equipment to do farming. He puts in all his effort in order to make his family live in better conditions. Beside farming, he goes to do fishing during the peak season. He works hard day and night to make his business grow and his family live in better conditions. However, his current power won’t let him achieve his goal. It is money- and time-consuming. Chamroeurn has to go to charge his battery every two or three days. After he found out that solar energy is the source he needs, he decided to apply for a KIVA loan to pay for a good quality solar home system. He believes a solar home system can reduce his burden and make him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Po Village, Bosleave Commune, Chetr Borei District

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Liza is 40 years old and has one child in school.

Ma. Liza has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Liza requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour, etc..

Ma. Liza has been in this business for one year. In the future, Ma. Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, sugar, flour.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 44 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Imelda is requesting to borrow 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Imelda has raised pigs for 19 years and she earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mandodari's Group

texts.en:
Mandodari is a humble lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a family of six consisting of her husband and three children and her parents-in-law.

Mandodari is a tailor by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and earn her living. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is also in danger of insect bites.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses and promote her family's health.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Simarani's Group

texts.en:
Simarani is an enterprising lady standing to the middle in the photograph with her small daughter. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a family of three consisting of her husband and her daughter.

Simarani is a grocer by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all the basic necessities. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella trabaja como empleada domestica desde hace mas de 10 años y con lo que obtiene en su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, Reina quiere mejorar su vivienda cambindo el techo pero con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para comprar laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra y asi tener un vivienda mas segura.
texts.en:
Reina is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has worked as a domestic employee for the past 10 years and is able to move forward with her earnings.

Reina would like to improve her home by replacing the roof, but her earnings are not sufficient to do this. For this reason, she requests a loan to purchase laminate and beams, and to pay laborers so that she can have a more secure home.

loans.use: to purchase laminate and beams, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: Don José Luis cuenta con un taller mecánico de vehículos y junto a su esposa y dos hijos pequeños salieron adelante, en los últimos años don José Luis tuvo la oportunidad de realizar un curso con capacitadores Japoneses acerca de la reparación electrónica de vehículos, puesto que en la ciudad de El Alto no se cuenta con muchos servicios de esta característica, este año también don José Luis formalizo sus actividades consiguiendo la licencia de funcionamiento que le permitió realizar actividades de reparación a empresas, el señor esta solicitando el préstamo para realizar la compra de un monitor de cerebros y empezar con el nuevo emprendimiento mecánico eléctrico puesto que  por el momento solo realiza reparaciones mecánicas. El taller actualmente está bien equipado ya que invirtió todos sus ahorros para este propósito. Tanto Don José Luis como su esposa viven en una casa humilde y tienen el anhelo de algún día completar los requisitos para tener la documentación a su nombre.
texts.en:
José Luis owns a garage. He has been able to get ahead with his wife and their two small children.

In recent years, José Luis seized the opportunity of taking a course in repair service for electronic vehicle components offered by Japanese instructors because this type of service is rarely offered in the city of El Alto. This year he also formalized his business by obtaining his operating licence, which enabled him to offer his repair services to companies.

José Luis is requesting a loan to buy an ECU diagnostic tool (computer diagnostic equipment for checking the car's onboard computer) to start offering mechanical and electrical repair services because, for the moment, he only does mechanical repairs.

Currently, his garage is well equipped because he invested all his savings for this purpose.

José Luis and his wife live in a humble house, and they hope that one day they will be able to fulfill the requirements to have the house deed in their names.

loans.use: to buy an ECU diagnostic tool to offer his customers a complete and competitive service and, in this way, generate more income for his family.

loans.name: Effort Group

texts.en:
Fridelande is the leader of a group located in a rural suburb of Carrefour. She gathered 30 poor people to encourage them in saving a small amount of money and to start small economic activities. Like many Zafen borrowers, Fridelande aims to connect her group with a microfinance institution.

With the loan, Fridelande will purchase baby dinnerwares and china crockery to retail in order to generate profits to support her children. Also, more women in her group will have means to step out of the absolute poverty. Fridelande is pictured with Arnold (left) and Nelson (right) as the committee board.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of baby dinnerware and china crockery to sell.

loans.name: Mirsafo

texts.en:
Mirsafo is a widower and has 2 children. He lives with his children in a rural area of North Tajikistan.

Mirsafo has been busy with farming and animal sales for more than 25 years. He has a land where he grows crops on 1 ha, potatoes on 0,08 ha and apples on 0,05 ha. He sells his products in a local market where he has his own customers.

Mirsafo works hard growing products and feeding cows because his business is the only source of the family income. He sells cows and products in a local market. He manages the business alone.

Mirsafo is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy cows to increase his working capital. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase working capital

loans.name: Everando

texts.en:
Everando has been planting and harvesting his crops for sale. For many years in farming, Everando has supported his children's needs and sustained their living.

In order to increase his farm produce, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy new seedlings and fertilizer. With this loan, he is hopeful for greener plants and more produce to deliver to the market.

In the near future, he wants to save some revenue and be able to improve the farm to gain more for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sasmita's Group

texts.en:
Sasmita is an enterprising lady standing to the extreme right in the photograph with her small son. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a family of three consisting of her husband and her son.

Sasmita is a vegetable vendor by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all the basic necessities. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the unnecessary medical expenses and make savings for her future endeavours.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet in her home.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto con 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y sus 2 menores hijos, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Juan Alberto cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales en su localidad.

Juan Alberto se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de cafeto, con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fitosanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Juan Alberto es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is 34 years old and is in a common law marriage. He lives in his own home that is made of rustic materials with his wife and their two young children in Pucara. Pucara is located in the province of Jaen in the Cajamarca department of Peru. Juan Alberto has many good personal and work references in his area.

Juan Alberto makes a living by growing coffee bushes, which he has been doing for 4 years. He will use the loan in his agricultural work by applying pesticides and fertilizers, and paying laborers for the harvest. This will help him physically, morphologically, and productively with his harvest. He'll be able to have a good harvest, which means that he will have a better production and a higher quality product. This will mean that he will not have problems selling his products.

Juan Alberto is a repeat member of Edpyme Alternativa. He signs with his wife.

loans.use: to prepare his crops, apply pesticides and fertilizers, and pay laborers to harvest crops.

loans.name: Lauama

texts.en:
Lauama is 61 years old and a widow, with two children.

She runs a small business, selling vegetables in her community and she has been doing this for four years.

Lauama has requested a loan to buy seeds, a spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, and a weed sprayer.

She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2010 to gain access to capital.

With her earnings, Lauama will save more for her children's education and she will financially support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, a spade, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, and a weed sprayer.

loans.name: Knight

texts.en:
Knight is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as visionary. She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of milk.

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of milk. She hopes that in the future, she will raise living standards of her family. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a fridge for milk storage.

loans.use: to buy more stock of milk

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 42 years old. She is a live-in woman with three children; one child is in school. Marcelina is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a coconut-wine "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 38 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, bread, coffee, home care products, and other groceries.

Juanita has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, bread, coffee, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 65 years old and married with eight children. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rowena is 51 years old now.

Rowena has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar, rice, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as sugar and rice.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Teresita is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell in the market in her fish vending business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Laxmi's Group

texts.en:
Laxmi is a differently-abled lady standing to the right hand side of the photo. She lost her eyesight in an accident three years back. She lives with her husband and two daughters in a humble household in Bhadrak district of Odisha, India.

She is a woman with tremendous patience and determination for which she has never failed in her life. She owns a business making and selling pottery. Her mother taught her to work with clay as a form of income to survive. She has been engaged in this profession for the past two and a half years. She and her group member are both engaged in the same business.

Laxmi along with her group member is requesting a loan amount of 24,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy raw clay, paint, and other necessary materials so she can work and fill her customers' orders. She hopes to increase her business productivity and have better sales and earnings, which will help her cover family's necessities and pay back her debt.

loans.use: to buy raw clay, paint, and other necessary materials.

loans.name: Sabitri's Group

texts.en:
Sabitri is an enterprising lady standing to the extreme left in the photograph in a green saree. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a big family of seven members.

Sabitri is a tailor by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all the basic necessities in order to support her husband and not be a burdern on him. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and incorporate water pipes to facilitate water supply in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and incorporate water pipes to facilitate water supply.

loans.name: Alfani

texts.en:
Alfani is in his early forties and is married with four children. Two of them are in school and two of them are grown up.

He has been selling chips for eight years now. He works from 08:00 am to 06:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Alfani's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase sacks of Irish potatoes and buckets of cooking oil. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profits to build his house, pay school fees, repay loans, pay rent for the business and cover household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, buckets of cooking oil and charcoal for cooking chips.

He dreams of expanding his business.

Alfani will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, buckets of cooking oil and charcoal for cooking chips.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with six children. She describes herself as hardworking. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She says that her biggest business challenge is changes in weather. Her business goal is to have good cow breeds within five years.

This is Pauline's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feeds.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda is 66 years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Minda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Minda has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Minda would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 42 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Cristina works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

Cristina has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza lives in Atsabe and she is a businesswoman. She got involved in business activities a few years ago with her own working capital, and she does her best with it. She has a very high interest in doing business.

She has a small store and she hopes to open a bigger store, but she does not have enough capital, so she is requesting a loan of $600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She will use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store, including salts, sugar, detergents, cooking oils, soaps, milks, slippers, shampoo, cigarettes, hard drinks, and other things to sell. She is taking this loan because she also wants to improve her management of her business in the future.

This photo was taken when she was still selling in the market, because she has also been selling in the market on market day.

loans.use: to buy salts, sugar, detergents, cooking oils, soaps, milks, slippers, shampoo, cigarettes, hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Champalata's Group

texts.en:
Champalata is a humble lady standing to the middle in the photograph. She hails from an interior village of Bhadrak district, Odisha, India. She has a family of four. Her husband works as a school bus driver in the nearby locality.

Champalata is a farmer by profession who is engaged in a poultry farming business and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses and utilize her savings amount in constructive purposes in the future.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.es:
Luis, se dedica a cocer semilla de marañón para vender, es un oficio que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su abuelo, ya que él también se dedica a dicha actividad, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 5 años, Luis es soltero, vive con su madre, no tiene dependientes, pero apoyo en los gastos familiares.
Con el crédito comprara semilla de marañón al por mayor, abastecerá su inventario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, el objetivo de Luis es incrementar sus ventas y ganancias para tener menos carencias en su hogar.
Los sueños que él tiene son formar una familia y tener patrimonio que sea su respaldo para tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Luis boils and sells cashews for a living, which he learned from his grandfather, who also worked in this business. He has had his business for 5 years. He is single, lives with his mother, and does not have dependents, but he helps with household expenses.

With the loan, he will purchase cashews in bulk in order to stock his inventory to satisfy his customers' demands. Luis's goal is to increase his sales and earnings to that he can have fewer shortages at home. His dreams are to start a family and to have assets that will serve as his foundation for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase cashews in bulk so that his inventory is stocked to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.name: Sumit

texts.en:
Extra efforts, all-nighters, and sacrifices are always worth it when it come to studies because studies are the only sure way to improve one’s quality of life. Sumit is well aware of this, because he has always counted his goal as becoming a good banker and financial adviser. Now he has reached the last step in completing his degree and entering the working era that any professional lives in.

Sumit is asking for a loan of 65,000 INR to pay off his PGDBM (Post graduate diploma in banking management) course fees and accomplish his dream. He also hopes to specialize in banking and finance, and in the long run, to establish a financial advisory services business. This enthusiastic young man of only 20 years urges young people to make an effort reaching for their dreams because, just like him, they can get ahead.

He has future plans to take his parents on a world tour after he becomes a successful banker and gains name and fame in this industry.

loans.use: to pay off his PGDBM (Post graduate diploma in banking management) course fees and accomplish his dream.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Fatimah, who is a 35-year-old married woman with one son and daughter. Fatimah is a housewife and her husband has been a driver for ten years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation in their home so as to improve access to sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Fatimah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a sanitation unit in her home to improve access to sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Sebati's Group

texts.en:
Sebati is a 50-year-old widow standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Bhadrak, Odisha, India.

Life was indeed very tough for her after her husband passed away leaving her alone. All the burdens of her family came to her shoulders. But she never broke; she was always rock strong in order to move on and lead a happy life with her only son and make him a successful person one day.

Sebati is currently engaged in vegetable farming and works hard in order to meet the household needs and expenses. However, due to a lack of financial resources, Sebati is unable to provide a higher education to her only son.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Sebati will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course. The loan amount will help her son to pursue his higher education smoothly and efficiently and get a good job with a handsome package.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 50 years old and has eight children, three of whom are still in school. Gemma is married.

Gemma is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Gemma has been in this business for six years now, and she has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her cattle.

loans.name: Petronilah

texts.en:
Petronilah is a Kiva borrower with 6 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells maize, beans, fruits and has been involved in this business for 20 years.She also does farming. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of maize, beans. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize, beans

loans.name: Maria Isadora

texts.en:
Ma. Isadora was able to sustain her store through the untiring support of Kiva and its lenders. This has encouraged her to be more diligent in growing her business and is forever thankful for your help. Today she has started a small eatery by her store. 

To meet her canteen's requirements and sustain her store once again she is requesting for funds in the amount of Php 19000 to pay for like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles to sell at her store. Part of the loan she needs to buy ingredients such as fresh meat, veggies, seasonings to prepare meals to serve at her small eatery. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income which sustained her family's basic needs. She is hopeful for your positive response.

She aims to save money to expand her canteen by adding more dishes to serve. She desires for her children to finish their studies to improve their quality of life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be responsible. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a vehicle within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a restaurant and has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a hotel within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand to a hotel.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Delia is 63 years old now.

Delia has a home care products business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like soap, etc.

Delia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Delia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 63 years old. She is married and has six children. Daisy works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like biscuits, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Daisy has been in this business for 32 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ruzan

texts.en:
Ruzan and her two sons live in Yerevan. She has been involved in clothing sales business for many years. The main factors of running successful business are, by Ruzan, hard and tireless work and right decisions to make.

Ruzan has her loyal client base to whom she sells the products. The requested loan will greatly help her to purchase new stock of clothing supplies to resell to her customers and gather income for the family. Her two sons help Ruzan a lot and she does her best to tackle financial hardships and improve family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing supplies  to resell to her  customers and gather income for the family

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 25 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Aiza is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Aiza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aiza has been in this business for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Aiza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sudoba

texts.en:
Sudoba lives with her family in a rural area. She has a large family, with 2 little children. She is a very hardworking young woman and she tries to offer a good living standard for her children. Sudoba is the main feed keeper of her family because her husband is ill.

Sudoba has been busy with farming business more than 3 year. She grows potatoes and sells them in a local market. Sudoba works hard from early morning every day. She is going to make new sowing of potatoes but she has no money to buy seed potatoes. Sudoba is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy seed potatoes. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds for the new season.

loans.name: Blanca Sonia

texts.es: Blanca de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal ubicado en su lugar de residencia el cual inicio con capital propio y gracias a sus ventas es como ella ha podido salir adelante con los gastos, Blanca esta solicitando un credito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos y tener junto a su esposo un mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Blanca, 41, lives in her own house with her husband.

For the past nine years, she has been earning a living by selling personal products from her home. She used her own money to start this business, and it is through her sales that she has been able to cover the household expenses.

Blanca is requesting a loan to buy personal products wholesale such as perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, and the like. With this purchase, she will be able to continue with her business, generate a better income, and, together with her husband, have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy personal products wholesale such as perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, and the like.

loans.name: Gavina

texts.en: Gavina is a cattle raiser in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, widow with 3 adult age children. She is doing well with this business and she wants to buy additional head of cattle so she asked for a loan from Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to buy additional head of cattle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 44 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Evangeline works very hard to provide for them.

Evangeline runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Evangeline has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is married woman with 6 children living in Hoima, Uganda.After realizing that her husband's meager salary could hardly meet all the family needs she decided to venture into selling clothes.She got her initial capital from the little money that she would save whenever her husband would leave money for buying basics at home.With the proceeds she has been able to build rental houses where she earns extra income and her business has now grown.

Ever changing customer preferences and inflation hinder her business growth but none the less she says the clothing business is very lucrative and now that the festive season is fast approaching she is hopeful that she will reap a lot of profits. Faith is seeking for a loan facility to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ngangi Byansi Group

texts.en: Jerom is a hardworking and married man with children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He is 43 years old and deals in charcoal selling and crop farming in order to support his family, since the sole responsibility rests on him.  He has been in this business for three years and it is very lucrative given the need for energy in the country.  However, he is very conscious of the effects of his business and ensures that he plants new trees in his garden but also tries to encourage those he buys from to plant more trees. His dream is to educate his children and also venture into alternative sources of energy, such as a solar business despite challenges of limited capital.  His group members are proud of him and they do not hesitate to guarantee him in accessing this loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irene is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Irene has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

Irene has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Irene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teuta

texts.en: Teuta's dough mixer that she was using until now, has broken down and thus she must replace it quickly, because she has been preparing the dough manually lately and it has been a lot of work for her. At the same time the demand for breads have gone up as well, thus, she needs to add more pans.

loans.use: to buy a dough mixer and 30 bread pans

loans.name: Uganda Martyrs Kyondo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Tom. He is the Director of Uganda Martyrs Kyondo School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kasese with 400 students. Uganda Martyrs Kyondo School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Uganda Martyrs Kyondo School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Tom ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases. It will also increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Lamiah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Lamiah,  who is a 25-year-old married with two daughters. Lamiah is a housewife and her husband has been selling coconut at traditional market for four years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family.  Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Lamiah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria continua con sus estudios en el profesorado que esta estudiando, pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus cuotas, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta sus cuotas, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gloria is continuing with her studies for the degree that she is pursuing. She does her best to be able to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

She remarks that she used her previous loan to pay tuition, and it was very helpful to her.

She is requesting this new loan to be able to pay her tuition again. This will be of great help to her with improving her situation through her studies.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Khuông

texts.en:
Mrs Khuông is 44 years old and she is married. She has had a manufacturing business sewing clothes for more than 10 years.Khuông lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
This is Khuông first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Khuông hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Godelio

texts.en:
Godelio, a forty-three-year old  man who earns a living through buying and selling of fresh shrimp.  His  work is done around the main streets of his town.  He has four children. His oldest child is 21 while the youngest is 9. 
He has been in this buy and sell business for 13 years.  Godelio wants to have additional capital to boost his daily earnings. This is why he is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of fresh shrimp. With these, he could cope with the demands and also slowly help augment his income. Thus, he could provide the basic needs of his family including quality education.

With  his previous loan, Godelio managed to invest in  shrimps to sell, for which he is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fresh shrimp

loans.name: Atmije

texts.en: Atmije, a widowed Egyptian Albanian retiree and mother of three, needs this loan to buy fabric to stitch draperies for some clients that have already put in the order, yet haven't paid any money up front.  With the rest of the money she needs to buy some little things for the home.

loans.use: to buy fabric to stitch draperies to sell and buy some other things needed at home

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 26 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Jinky works very hard to provide for them.

Jinky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuit, noodles, junk foods, etc..

Jinky has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Jinky would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, biscuit, noodles, junk foods, etc.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 42 year-old lady and a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running his own sports business for past two years. Rehana's husband needs to purchase different types of accessories, e.g., bats, balls, and wickets, etc. for his business. But, due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. To fulfill the need of her husband, Rehana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for the business. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase different items for her husband's sports business.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 61 years old and has one child in school.

Jovita has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Jovita has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more contianers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Jesus German

texts.es:
Germán, de 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos que están estudiando en la escuela, su esposa es ama de casa. 

Germán, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra granos básicos como maíz, frijol y arroz, toda su vida se ha dedicado a ese trabajo.- El aprendió el oficio desde que era muy joven, su padre fue quien le enseño a trabajar y gracias a eso ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. 

Germán, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para la siembra de granos básicos. 

Los sueños de Germán, son poder obtener una buena cosecha este año.- Pero también quiere ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y que tengan exitos en el futuro.
texts.en:
German, who is 46 years old, lives with his wife and their two children who are currently studying in school. His spouse is a housewife.

German dedicates himself to agriculture; specifically, he sows basic grains such as corn, beans and rice. All his life he has done this work. He learned these skills when he was very young. His father taught him farming. Thanks to this experience, he has been able to help his family get ahead.

German needs the loan to purchase agricultural inputs for sowing basic grains.

German's dreams are to be able to obtain a good harvest this year. And, also, he wants to see his children converted into professionals, and he hopes that they enjoy success in the future.

loans.use: purchase agricultural inputs for sowing basic grains.

loans.name: Mini's Group

texts.en: Mini is an inhabitant of a small village of Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. The lady standing on the right in the photo is Mini. She is 35 years old and resides with her father and only son. She is a divorcee. The main source of income for Mini is tailoring. Mini does the tailoring job, and her father helps in marketing. Mini has been doing this tailoring for the last eight years, and the amount she earns is just hand-to-mouth for her family. Mini's family's income is about 8,000 INR per month. So, to overcome this situation, she, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase a pico sewing machine, cloth, colorful ribbons and thread. This loan will definitely bring in more income for her. Mini hopes to construct a house and provide a better education to her only son and see him become a successful person.

loans.use: to purchase a picot (sewing) machine, cloth, colorful ribbons and thread.

loans.name: Balinka

texts.en:
Balinka is 30 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. She is a very hardworking and honest lady. She has to do a lot of hard work to run her household expenses. Her children go to school in the morning and tuition in the evening. It is a challenge for them to afford the school and tuition fee, so that they both are doing a lot of hard work to run a setup in their house. She owns a small beauty parlor at home and her husband is doing a small job in a firm. Both contribute their full income for household expenses. With the passage of time her beauty products are going to be used up and this time she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon.

Balinka requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will buy cosmetics products such as facial cream, hair coloring, scissors, and scissors and comb for her salon. She hopes that through this amount she will be able to enhance her businesses.

Balinka is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy such items as facial cream, hair coloring, scissors, scissor and comb and cosmetics products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Batalika Tulibamu Group

texts.en:
Anosiata is a member of Batalika Tulibamu group which has approached Hofokam to access credit to improve on their various businesses.They have a mutual understanding to guarantee each other to access money and they have been fully trained by a staff of Hofokam to effectively monitor and evaluate each other so as to minmise risks of default or one of them misappropriating the loan.

Anosiata is a forty-four year married woman living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She is a very hardworking lady and a leader of a group which has helped her access funds to improve her status. She buys and sells second hand clothes of all categories and she is a good farmer of seasonal crops like white potatoes, beans and groundnuts for increased income. Her personal business dream is to expand her business and to be economically well-off despite unpredictable weather changes and unstable prices of commodities. Anosiata is requesting for a loan to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a poultry business where he sells chickens. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are regular.

He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more poultry. He hopes that in the future, he will raise living standards of his family. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza con 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, en casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su amyoría al cultivo de arroz, frutales, comercio y ganadería.

Maritza se dedica al comercio de aves como gallinas, patos, pavos, las compras los realiza en su mismo caserío y en caseríos aledaños, las ventas las realiza tanto vivos como pelados en los restaurantes. Maritza cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro, además su cónyuge trabaja como caporal de chacra, donde obtiene ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el crédito sin ningún problema.El destino del crédito sera para invertir en su negocio en compra de mayor cantidad de animales con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Maritza es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa, firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in the rustic home they own in the district of Pucará, Jaén Province, Cajamarca Department, in the country of Peru. The people who live in this town mostly grow rice and fruit trees, or work in commerce and livestock.

Maritza raises birds, such as chickens, ducks, and turkeys. She does her buying in the town where she lives and in neighboring towns. She sells both alive and butchered to restaurants. Maritza has 10 years of experience in this profession and her husband works as a farm foreman, which generates additional income that will allow them to repay their loan with no problem. This loan will be used to invest in her business by buying a larger quantity of animals. This will generate more income and improve their quality of life. In this business there is no better competition in the area and she gets the best prices.

Maritza is a returning member to our institution, Edpyme Alternativa, and she will sign with her husband.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying a larger quantity of animals, which will generate better income for her and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Calistus

texts.en:
Calistus is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be storage space.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. His business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Twaha

texts.en:
Twaha, aged twenty seven is in a need of loan to buy more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He is a hardworking man living in Kyenjojo-Uganda dealing in the sale of spare parts for motorcycles. He did not go far as education is concerned due to failure by his parents to pay his school fees but struggles to ensure that he attains a better future.

High cost of doing business in terms of license and rent affect his profits while his desire is to open up a big garage in town and also offer apprenticeship to up coming mechanics. Twaha is in need of a loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine aged forty one with six children lives in the town of Masindi in the north western part of Uganda. After separating from her husband, she had to assume the full responsibility of her family and this called for innovativeness. She sells fresh foods and has been in business since 2001, with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children and provide them with other basics.

She also does framing on a small scale and sometimes gets the food to sell from her garden. Her dreams are to educate her children up to the university level and to expand her business to other markets despite facing a challenge of high perish ability of the fresh foods. She is a very inspiring woman and her commitment can only leave you in awe. Christine is requesting for a loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is an agricultural produce trader aged 35 and married with children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He buys and sells produce like maize, beans and ground nuts depending on seasons and supplements his income by growing banana and selling them to different markets. He dreams of exploring all the available markets but only limited by small capital base and impassable roads during the rainy season.

His dreams are to set up a food store that can act as a relief supply in times of food scarcity and to buy a lorry to help him transport his produce from villages. He is a hardworking and honest client with more than three years experience who wants to boost his business. Francis is seeking for a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Antonia Argentina

texts.es:
Antonia, de 43 años de edad, está casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos, de los cuales algunos ya tienen sus propias familias, pero viven cerca de su casa.- Ella y su esposo son felices compartiendo con ellos y viendo a sus nietos crecer. 

Antonia, se dedica a la venta de pan francés y pan dulce por las mañanas; ella se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para ir a la panadería donde compra el pan recién horneado, para después ir a venderlo. 

Antonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar más pan y hacer una inversión con el fin de obtener mejores ganancias y así ahorrar para poner su propia panadería. 

Los sueños de Antonia, son poder colocar su propia panadería.
texts.en:
Antonia is 43 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their five children, some of whom have their own families but live close to her home. She and her husband are happy to share with them and see their grandchildren grow.

Antonia sells French bread and sweet bread in the morning. She gets up at 4:00 a.m. to go to the bakery where she buys freshly baked bread that she then goes out and sells.

Antonia needs this loan to buy more bread and to make an investment so she can make better income and save up to start her own bakery.

Antonia's dream is to start her own bakery.

loans.use: to buy more bread.

loans.name: Zhaneta

texts.en: Zhaneta wants to dig a well to water her land. Almost every households in this rural has their own well for plantations, because in some villages the water supply is scare. Her family's income relies strictly on livestock/agriculture and the disability income of her son.

loans.use: to pay for digging a water well so she can irrigate her farm land.

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en: Arceli has been operating  her business for over eight years and has been able to sustain the business. She supported her family and bought some home improvements for comfortable living. She repaid her previous loan used for the business successfully. She is now aiming for an increase in sales, and with this goal in mind, she took out a new loan to buy more ingredients so that she can increase her volume of ice candy making. She hopes to cater for the needs of her customers and increase her income as well.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make ice candy for sale.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y comenta que su sueño es poder tener su propia empresa, y de esa manera poder aplicar todos los conocimientos que adquirió.
Él es una persona que se esfuerza mucho para poder mejorar su vida, y la de su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gabriel is from the city of Paraguarí. He goes to school and works at the same time. He is studying the Business Administration major and comments that his dream is to be able to have his own business and in that way, be able to apply all the knowledge he acquired.

He is a person who exerts himself a lot to be able to improve his life and that of his family. He is asking for this loan to be able to pay his university career fees and that way, be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Rasaolimamonjiarisoa

texts.fr:
Rasaolimamonjiarisoa a 47 ans et veuve. Elle a cinq enfants ; l’aîné est déjà marié, le second qui  a 22 ans travaille mais ne vit plus chez elle ; le troisième (20 ans) est à l’université. Les deux autres ( 18 ans et 15 ans) sont en classe de terminale et de troisième. 
Elle dispose 15 années d’expérience dans la livraison de légumes auprès des foyers des familles vivant dans différents quartiers voisins ( notamment les étrangers). Avant (quand elle vivait encore avec son mari), ses principales activités sont l’élevage et l’agriculture en milieu rural. Mais depuis qu’elle a divorcé, elle a quitté le milieu rural. Pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, elle accompagnait sa cousine dans la livraison de légumes. Suite à une maladie, sa cousine a abandonné l’activité lui a été reprise.
Son objectif est de constituer une épargne qui servira de fonds de roulement , en effet, elle envisage de devenir grossiste pour l’approvisionnement en produits locaux des revendeurs de la capitale. Son rêve est de préparer sa retraite : construction d’une maison en milieu rural.
texts.en:
Rasaolimamonjiarisoa is 47 years old and a widow. She has five children of whom the oldest is already married. The second, at 22, works and no longer lives with her. The third, 20 years old, is at the university. The two youngest, aged 18 and 15, are in the last class of secondary school and ninth grade, respectively.

Rasaolimamonjiarisoa has 15 years old experience delivering vegetables to households in different neighborhoods (notably to foreigners). When she was still living with her husband, her principal activities were livestock-raising and rural agriculture. When she divorced, she left the countryside and to support her children, she accompanied her cousin who delivered vegetables.

When her cousin fell ill and left off, Rasaolimamonjiarisoa took over the business. Her goal is to put aside enough savings for working capital, in fact, she plans to become a wholesaler to supply local produce to retailers in the capital. Her dream is to prepare for her retirement--to build a house in the countryside.

loans.use: to buy vegetables: tomatoes, carrots, green beans, beets, green peppers, peas, and beans.

loans.name: Zare

texts.en: Zare's reason for this loan is again to pay for her son's treatment and other medical expenses. Not only Erion who is in the photograph was not doing well after some setback with his schooling, but he got in a car accident as well, thing that made it worse financially and otherwise for him and his family also.

loans.use: to pay for her son's treatment and other medical expenses

loans.name: Lastri

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Lastri, who is 26-year-old, married with two sons. Her husband is a greengrocer. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet and water sources but Lastri will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Zeyqam

texts.en:
Zeyqam is 26 years old. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is living in Bilasuvar refugee settlement. He is married, has 1 son and his wife is expecting a child. Zeyqam is a farmer. He has been involved in this field for over 10 years and her wife who is life-loving person is heartily helping her husband.

Zeyqam is growing fruits and vegetables. He takes his natural products to local bazaar to sell daily. Currently he is planning to grow his business, in order to improve the living conditions. He want to buy a new piece of land and seeds for fruits and vegetables. For this he needs funds. He hopes that Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy a new piece of land and seeds for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is a single man in his late 20s. He has two children who attend school. He has run a transportation business for two years and works from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily to make a good monthly income.

He used the previous loans to pay for motorcycle maintenance and has successfully repaid the loans. He used the profit to expand his business, pay school fees, and cover household expenses. He is pleased with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support.

He will use this loan to increase his business. He dreams of being successful in his business. Mathias will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his motorcycle transportation business.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita has a banana farm in Calamba. This is her primary source of income for her family. 
Carmelita makes it a point to have good land preparation, in order to have maximum yield. This means she will have a good income. 
Recently, she needed an amount to pay for labor on irrigation to soften tillage pans (hard irrigation ridges). She loaned this from Paglaum MPC. 

Carmelita wishes to sustain her business and to be able to supply bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor on irrigation to soften tillage pans (hard irrigation ridges)

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is forty year old woman with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells clothes in order to raise money for her family and has been in business since 2008. She envisions all her children graduating with masters degrees. Her customers are so fond of her and she is gifted with good customer care skills.

The ever changing trend preferences, coupled with inadequate capital, affect her business while her dream is to own a modern boutique in town. Judith intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a very enterprising married man charged with the task of taking care of 3 children and all attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into produce buying and selling of maize, beans among other items. This is supplemented by incomes from operating a butcher mainly selling goat’s meat and beef.

He desires to expand and develop his business however price fluctuation and in adequate capital poses a strong threat to his business.Charles is seeking for credit to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is 62 years old, married with 4 adult age children. He is known in Tudela, Misamis Occidental area as wholesaler of drinking sodas. Hie business activity is supported by his loan from Paglaum MPC. This time that he needs to increase his supplies of products that he asks for a loan to buy bulk supplies of drinking soda for wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bulk supplies of drinking sodas for wholesale distribution.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is 47 years old lady and a responsible mother of 4 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own men's caps business for past 25 years. Rehana's husband needs to purchase different varieties and types of caps for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these caps.

To fulfill the need of her husband Rehana has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy these caps for business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs
Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more men's caps for her husband's business.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Rosa de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de especies y chocolate desde hace 40 años e inicio su trabajo por la necesidad de llevarle a sus hijos el sustento diario, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes ya que su prodcuto tiene mucha demanda, Doña Rosa esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas especies y chocolate todo por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and lives in her own house with her family group. She makes a living in the sales of spices and chocolate and has for 40 years. She started her work due to the necessity of bringing her children the daily sustenance.

Her business is located in the municipal market and she has many customers since her product is high in demand. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy more spices and chocolate, all wholesale, in order to continue with her sales and with that have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more spices and chocolate, all wholesale.

loans.name: Riffat's Group

texts.en:
Riffat is a 38-year-old married woman and lives with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has run a beauty parlor for about four years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials.

Due to her great service, she has become very well known on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. Because she has a low amount of cash, she contacted BRAC Pakistan and applied for a loan. She wants to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

Riffat is hopeful that in time she can cater to more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings due to her loan, and she plans to spend a part of her profits on her family. She will thank Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, and bleaching and whitening creams for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Nyakisi Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Rose joined Nyakisi Tweimukye group which loosely translated means lets "join hands and develop our selves". She is a teacher aged twenty seven, married with two children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She has been a teacher for eight years and is very passionate about her profession.

After realizing that the meager salary from the government, which is also irregular, can hardly meet her needs and that of her family ,she decided to venture into farming where she earns extra income. Good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children up to university and also have a decent house to live in. She is currently constructing her residential house and is soon completing it. She is an active member of the group and her group members describe her as an honest and hardworking woman with quality leadership skills. Rose is in need of a loan to buy more materials to construct her house.

loans.use: to improve on her house.

loans.name: Verda

texts.en:
Verda is married and a mother of two. She makes boxes at home, for use in packaging meerschaum products. She has used loans two times before. With the help of the loans, she bought materials and fabrics in bulk to make boxes, sold them, gained money and expanded her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Verda hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Verda hanım evde kutu üretimi yapıyor. Kutular bulunduğu yörede lületaşı için kullanılıyor ve satın alıyorlar. İki kez mikro kredi kullandı. Aldığı mikro kredi ile kutu yapımında kullanmak üzere karton ve kumaş toptan alarak ve üreterek para kazandı işlerini geliştirdi.

loans.use: to buy materials and fabrics for her home box production business

loans.name: Safaqat

texts.en:
Safaqat is 44 years old, married and has 1 son and 1 daughter. She is IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in Bilesuvar region. Her husband is showing his best support to her.

She is a farmer. Safaqat is very diligent and responsible person and has been working in this field for over 12 years. Safaqat need some money because she will use the money to buy a water tank for irrigating her farm and she would develop her business. Nusaba hopes Kiva Lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for irrigating her farm.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a businesswoman from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, widow and has the expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Susana is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied a loan to restock store with basic commodities and other consumable items.
