Susana continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the ardent passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Shem

texts.en:
Shem is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a retail business where he sells agrovet products. He has been involved in this business for 4 years.

His business is located in a productive place and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of agrovet products.

His business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock .

loans.use: to buy more stock of Agrovet products to have a stable business.

loans.name: Felipe, Jr.

texts.en: Felipe, Jr. is engaged in vegetable farming and growing in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. He grows squash, bitter gourd (ampalaya); bottle gourd (upo); eggplant; tomatoe; stringbeans; and others as his primary produce. His farming activity is supported by his loan under the integrated farming system financial grants of Paglaum MPC. This time that he prepares for the next planting season that he asks for a loan to buy high quality seeds for vegetable farming.

loans.use: to buy high quality seeds for vegetable farming

loans.name: Kuruhe School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Augustine. He is the Head teacher of Kuruhe High School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kasese with 800 students. Kuruhe School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kuruhe School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Augustine ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Zaib-Un-Nisa

texts.en:
Zaib-un-nisa is 60 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 4 children. Her husband has been running his own business as a supplier of different items whole seller for the past 10 years.

Zaib-un-nisa's husband needs to buy different items in supply and other commodities for reselling purpose, but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these commodities. Therefore Zaib-un-nisa has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will assist her husband to buy these commodities for reselling purpose to earn maximum profitable income, this profitable income will also help him to make savings to meet the needs of family and business.
Zaib-un-nisa is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wants to increase his wholesale supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fuel to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Felicidad Y Optimismo Group

texts.es: Grupo Solidario Felicidad y Optimismo: este grupo esta conformado por la señora Aura Rosmery de 41 años de edad, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral, como pollos,cerdos, tiene ya varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad a luchado por sacar adelante a su hijo, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales para la crianza. cerdos y pollos, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
The Solidario Felicidad y Optimismo group includes Aura Rosemery who is 41 years old. She makes a living breeding and selling barnyard animals like chickens and pigs. She has made a living at this occupation for several year now. She has struggled to get her son ahead.

At this time she is requesting this loan to buy animals to breed like pigs and chickens. She is hoping you can help with the loan requested.

loans.use: to breed pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Merigilda

texts.en:
Merigilda is 46 years old, with two children.

Merigilda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Merigilda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Merigilda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is 41 years old and married with six children.

Lerma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Lerma has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lerma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa or "Hope' in English needs your help again, but this time she must do some repairs/installations to the old house, where the roof is leaking.

In the agricultural land her family owns, she plants onions, potatoes and wheat and while she sells the potatoes and onions, she doesn't do the same with wheat because is just enough for the family. In the background of the photograph, are the strings of the onions she has produced and ready to sell.

"About nine months ago I started working in a village bakery. Our money was not enough for our family and having children to raise it becomes far more difficult," said Shpresa to the loan officer.

loans.use: to make some basic repairs to their home that is so very cold inside and has a leaking roof.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a 23-year-old, single man from Khanyounis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Abdalla has a stall for selling fruit and vegetables in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict.

Abdalla took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of fruit and vegetables to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Vergilyn

texts.en: Vergilyn is a married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is a mother of four children ages 18, 16, 11 and six years old. To earn a living, Vergilyn and her husband are engaged in fishing business. They have been doing this for 15 years. Vergilyn is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and gasoline for their fishing boat. Perhaps the money she is requesting may help them enhance their livelihood. In the future, she wishes to send all her children to school and finish their studies to have a better life someday.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and gasoline for her and her husband's fishing boat

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 55 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child still in school.

Carmela is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Carmela has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Carmela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 37 and living with his big family of 10. He lives with his wife, parents, two kids, brother, sister-in-law and three nephews in Tsiatsan village of Armavir region. This family's basic source of income is agriculture. Each member of the family has his own tasks and duties on the farm. They keep three cows, and two calves, as well as cultivate potatoes, cabbage and cucumbers in the arable land near their house.

Artur asks for this loan to invest in their family farm and prepare it for the coming winter season. He needs the loan to purchase potato seeds for land cultivation and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse. The cover for the greenhouse is very important for the family to cultivate a larger variety of vegetables and increase income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds for land cultivation and polyethylene cover for the greenhouse to prepare the farm for the coming winter season.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their family. Parveen is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She needs different kinds of goods like needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business purpose; but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable her to purchase the above-mentioned accessories and will also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Hanifan has successfully built her business selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She works very hard to provide for her family. With the expansion of her business she would be able to bear her household expenditures efficiently. Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 60,000. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to sell in the market. Hanifan has gained great confidence in the business since she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to sell in the market.

loans.name: Dúo Bendición De San Miguel Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bendición de San Miguel
Este dúo está formado por doña Cindy Johanna, ella tiene  28 años de edad y se dedica a la agricultura en el área de San Miguel Milpas Altas de donde es originaria y se dedica a la siembra de ejote, arveja, suchini, zanahoria, en sus parcelas de la localidad, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de semilla de zuquini, compra de abono Map y abono triple 15 así como compra de pita para sostener su arveja, su mayor deseo es aprovechar la humedad y sobre todo confía en Dios en que sus cultivos saldrán bien, porque su mayor anhelo es cosechar siempre buen producto para poder entregarlo en exportación,espera que la puedan seguir ayudando para que siga adelante con el cultivo de verduras.
texts.en:
Cindy Johanna, 28, is one of the members of this group who works in agriculture in the area of San Miguel Milpas Atlas, where she is from. She grows corn, peas, zucchini and carrots on her patch of land. The loan she is requesting is to buy zucchini seeds, "Map" fertilizer and Triple 15 manure, as well as supports for the peas.

Her goal is to take advantage of the humidity. She prays for a successful crop to export so she can continue receiving help with her vegetable growing activity.

loans.use: to grow vegetables to sell.

loans.name: I Will Survive - N01Mbằng08Nngạn Group

texts.en: Mrs Huyền is 53 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling flowers in the market for many years. Huyền lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village, where the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not high enough for her to cover her life costs and save money. The main hardship that Huyền faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more types of flowers to resell. In 2011, Huyền joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huyền has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of "I will survive - N01MBằng08NNgạn Group", which consists of seven members. In the future, Huyền hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase more types of flowers to resell

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
Las temperaturas elevadas que se perciben durante todo año en cierta comunidad de Veracruz llevaron a los poetas locales a nombrarla como “la novia del sol”. Misma localidad donde el ferrocarril jugó un papel fundamental para el crecimiento de una otrora villa hasta convertirla en una pequeña ciudad.  Como testimonio de esto se encuentra la “prieta linda” como conocen a la primera locomotora de vapor que recorrió las vías de la región. 
   En una de sus colonias se integró un grupo el cual lleva por nombre “Emanuel” debido a la fe que profesan sus miembros y cuyo significado es: "Dios está con todos nosotros". Dichos miembros son: Francisca quien vende flores artificiales; Elba, jarciería, cosméticos y bisutería; Joaquín, accesorios para celular; Magali e Itzayana, calzado; Miriam, repostería; Eugenia, bisutería; Argelia, perfumes; Nancy, calzado y ropa y Mauro quien maneja un taxi.
   Doña Francisca es una gran mujer que no obstante su edad continua tan fuerte como un roble. La situación económica que vivieron sus padres no les permitió brindarle estudios, pese a ello su espíritu emprendedor la motivó para iniciar con su actividad. Vende flores artificiales, naturaleza muerta, fibras y esponjas para lavar los trastes. Al principio doña Fran, como le conocen de cariño, y su esposo se encargaban de recorrer las calles de “la novia del sol” y de comunidades vecinas para ofrecer su mercancía; después de algunos años dejaron se establecieron en un local fijo a un costado del mercado. En dicho local se han mantenido durante 18 años siempre ofreciendo a sus clientes la mejor calidad y variedad en productos.  “Para lograr tener éxito Dios debe estar en nosotros” expresa mientras sonríe.
   Los préstamos que ha recibido han reforzado su estabilidad como comerciante, este nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de flores, naturaleza muerta, hojas y alambre por mayoreo. Con  las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y cumple en tiempo y forma con cada uno de los pagos correspondientes al préstamo.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de doña Fran quien viste blusa y falda blanca, la niña que se observa es hija de doña Magali.
texts.en:
The high temperatures perceived throughout the year in a certain community of Veracruz led the local poets to name it as "the bride of the Sun", the same town where the railroad played a fundamental role in the growth of a former village until it turned it into a small town. As testimony to this is the "pretty black one", as the first steam locomotive is known which traveled the roads of the region.

In one of the colonies, a group got together which is called "Emanuel" because of the faith their members profess and whose meaning is, "God is with all of us." These members are Francisca, who sells artificial flowers; Elba, household products, cosmetics, and jewelry; Joaquín, cell phone accessories; Magali and Itzayana, footwear; Miriam, pastries; Eugenia, jewelry; Algeria, perfumes; Nancy, footwear and clothing, and Mauro, who drives a taxi.

Francisca is a great woman who despite her age continues as strong as an oak. The economic situation that her parents lived didn't allow them to provide her with studies. Nevertheless, her enterprising spirit motivated her to start her business. She sells ​​artificial flowers, still life, fibers, and sponges for washing dishes. At first, Fran, as she is affectionately known, and her husband were walking the streets and neighboring communities of "the bride of the Sun" to offer her goods. After some years, they left this and settled in a fixed location next to the market. In such premises they have remained for 18 years, always offering her customers the best quality and variety of products. "In order to succeed, God must be with us," she says as she smiles.

The loans she has received have reinforced her stability as a trader. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of flowers, still life, leaves, and wire wholesale. With the proceeds obtained, she supports her husband with the household expenses and complies in a timely manner with each of the payments for the loan.

*The photograph was taken in the business place of Fran, who is wearing white blouse and skirt. The girl seen is Magali's daughter.

loans.use: to buy flowers, still life, leaves, and wire.

loans.name: Baltaraza

texts.en:
Baltaraza owns a small eatery business. She cooks and sells home-made dishes for the people in her place. This has been her business for five years now. In addition to this, she also accepts hair-cutting services.

Baltaraza works hard so she can help her husband, who barely earns a living through carpentry work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more kitchen utensils like food containers, a frying pan and vegetables to cook.

Baltaraza hopes that with her hard work, she can continue to send her two children to school so they will become professionals.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils like food containers, a frying pan and vegetables.

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en:
Villamor is a resident of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. He is a rice farmer and a habal-habal (motorcycle transport) driver. This is how he supports his family, from the income of these livelihoods.

Villamor is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings and pay for farm labor. Villamor is also happy that in his humble way, he can help his fellow farmers whom he hired for the farming work.

He dreams of seeing his two children, ages 8 and 13, finish their schooling. In the future, he hopes to expand his business for better sustainability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings and pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is a 47-year-old woman from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married, and her husband works as a construction worker. They have three children, one of whom is still a dependent aged 13.

Criselda has been selling silver and fancy jewelries for 18 years now. She is also selling clothing like shorts, T-shirts and pants. This is something that she learned best and found some good customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stock of the silver items, wires and semi-precious stones that she herself can make to sell in a form of bangles and necklaces. She hopes that with the additional capital, she can expand her business and eventually increase its profitability to support her family.

loans.use: to buy silver items, wires and semi-precious stones.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 56 years old and a mother to a 19-year-old son. Her family lives in Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is used to farming, having done this for 30 years. As supplemental income, she also raises pigs. This has been their source of livelihood.

She requested a loan to be used in buying fertilizer, feed and pesticides. The extra income that she can get from this will be used for her family’s daily consumption and savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed and pesticides

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en: Macaria and her husband earn a living by doing the rice farming business. They are requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to enhance the growth of their rice farm. They wish for an abundant harvest to be able to increase their earnings. Thus, they dream of having better means of living and plan to buy a vehicle or car in the future that can help in their farming. In addition, Macaria is a 57-year-old woman and a mother of seven children. One of these is a school aged child, aged 19 years old. She and her family live in the town of Trinidad, Bohol.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Guadalupe Victoria Group

texts.es:
En marzo un pueblo oaxaqueño se viste de colores para celebrar a su santo patrono, durante la fiesta se realiza un pequeño desfile por las principales calles del municipio; al finalizar el recorrido de las comparsas todos se dan cita en la feria hasta esperar el inicio del baile. De igual forma, durante la elección para la reina del carnaval cada aspirante representa a una de las etnias con vestuario y trajes típicos destacando siempre el folclor de la región.
   En uno de dichos barrios se formó un grupo el cual lleva por nombre Guadalupe Victoria como el célebre personaje de la independencia. Actualmente el grupo está integrado por: Abelina y Rosa quienes se dedican a vender calzado; Imelda y Silvestra, comida típica; Georgina y Lucelly, abarrotes; Victoria, tortillas; Ismael, fumigantes; Yesenia y Yolzin, cosméticos y, finalmente, Mariano quien da servicio de sastrería. 
   Doña Georgina  es una mujer muy alegre quien ha formado una familia muy unida junto a su esposo Roque y sus tres hijas quienes a su vez tienen unas pequeñas.  En su barrio todos le conocen como Geo y decidió iniciar con una tienda de abarrotes desde casa ya que, anteriormente, los habitantes tenían que acudir hasta el centro del municipio si querían comprar cualquier producto. En un principio exhibía la mercancía sobre una mesa y los refrescos los guardaba en su refrigerador; transcurrido un tiempo amplió el espacio y ahora exhibe la mercancía en anaqueles y sobre una gran mesa coloca dulces, huevos, la báscula, etc.
    Cabe mencionar que los préstamos que VF México le ha otorgado le han sido de utilidad pues hoy en día satisface a sus clientes con base en la calidad y variedad de productos introducidos en su negocio. Con este préstamo podrá comprar leche, azúcar, galletas, arroz, sopa, frijol, maíz, aceite, queso, jamón, huevos, jitomate, chile, cebolla, cilantro, col, zanahorias, limón, chayote, continuando con su extenso surtido. Contenta comenta, “estoy feliz por la familia que Dios me dio, por mi actividad y por el gran grupo que hemos conformado”.
 *La fotografía se tomó en la tienda de doña Geo, ella es quien viste blusa negra y pantalón beige.
texts.en:
In March an Oaxacan town dresses colorfully to celebrate their patron saint.  During the festival, they have a small parade through the main streets of the town.  At the end of the tour of the town, everyone gathers at the carnival to wait for the dance to begin.  In the same way, during the election of the queen of the carnival, each candidate represents one of the ethnic groups wearing typical clothing emphasizing the folklore of each region.

In one of these neighbors is the group that goes by the name Guadalupe Victoria, who is a celebrated character of the independence.  The group is made up of the following members: Abelina and Rosa who work selling footwear; Imelda and Sivestra, typical food; Georgina and Lucelly, groceries; Victoria, tortillas; Ismael, fumigants; Yesenia and Yolzin, cosmetics; and finally, Mariano who does tailoring.

Doña Geogine is a very happy woman who has formed a very united family together with her husband Roque and their three daughters, who also have young daughters of their own.  In her neighborhood, every knows her as Geo, and she decided to start a grocery store from her home; since, previously, the inhabitants had to go to the downtown of the city if they wanted to buy any products.  In the beginning she displayed the merchandise on a table and the soft drinks in her refrigerator.  As time passed, she increased her space and now she displays the merchandise on shelves and on a big table full of candies, eggs, scales, etc.  

One should note that the loans that VF México has granted to her have been useful to her.  Currently, she satisfies her customers with the quality and variety of the products she introduced into her business.  With this loan she would be able to buy milk, sugar, crackers, rice, soup, beans, corn, oil, cheese, eggs, tomatoes, chilies, onion, cilantro, cabbage, carrots, lemon, and squash, continuing to expand her stock.  She says that, "I am happy for the family that God has given me, for my job, and for the great group that we have made."

* The photograph was taken in doña Geo's store.  She is dressed in the black sweater and the beige pants.

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, crackers, rice, soup, beans, corn, oil, cheese, ham, eggs, tomatoes, chilies, onion, cilantro, cabbage, carrots, lemon, and squash.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 53 years old now.

Nida has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

Nida has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 56 years old, and married with seven children - one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Nenita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 16,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

Nenita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and has a child. Her husband works in a factory as a laborer. Her husband's salary is not enough for the family, so Fatma has to work. She is selling cosmetics and cleaning products through a network system.

She has used a loan for three times. With the help of the loans she bought bulks of products, sold them, and gained money. With the help of the new loan she is planning to buy bulks of products, sell them, gain money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:

Fatma hanım evli bir çocuk annesi. Eşi bir fabrikada işçi olarak çalışıyor. Eşinin parası yeterli olmadığı için Fatma hanım netwörk sistemi ile kozmetik ve temizlik ürünleri satıyor. Üç kez kredi kullandı aldığı kredi ile toptan kozmetik ve temizlik malzemeleri alarak satarak para kazandı. Yeni aldığı mikro kredi ile de toptan temizlik ve kozmetik ürünleri alarak ve satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning materials.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is a 56-year-old widow, living with her son in Griboyedov village of Ejmiatsin region. Following her family tradition, Marine has been running a farming business for many years. She cultivates cucumbers, peppers and greens in the greenhouse, which is currently damaged and needs to be improved.

She asks for this loan to purchase a polyethylene cover, wires for the greenhouse, and fertilizer for land cultivation. This will help her to enlarge and sustain her farming business. Marine greatly hopes to receive lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover, wires for the greenhouse, and fertilizer for land cultivation to enlarge and sustain the farm.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 30 year old married woman with 2 children and a resident of Hoima Uganda.

After realizing that her husband's meager income could not sustain the family, she decided to put her passion for fashion into reality and started offering tailoring services. With the income she earns, she has been able to provide the basics for her children and her desire is to educate them to attain degrees as a minimum qualification. She also grows food crops and sells the surplus to earn extra income.

Juliet's business dream is to own a fashion house in the next ten years. She is seeking a loan to buy sewing materials such as cloth and thread to help her in her tailoring work.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as cloth and thread to help her in her tailoring work.

loans.name: St. Jude High School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Moses. He is the Director of St. Jude High School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kasese with 500 students. St. Jude High School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Jude High School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Moses ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Seemaab

texts.en:
Seemaab is an energetic young girl with an ambition to take her low cost private school forward. The school was founded more than a decade ago by her father who dreamed of providing quality education to females in marginalized communities.
He dedicated his own home to providing education and build a school within.

Currently there are 149 girls studying in the school. Seemaab is in need of Rs 200,000 to purchase computers and establish a mini computer lab in the school. Awareness of information technology in this fast paced world is integral to the success of both male and female. "Slowly and gradually I will contribute to making the females of our society more aware of the world around them" says Seemaab.

loans.use: to purchase computers and establish a mini computer lab in her low cost girl's school. .

loans.name: Irimiya

texts.en:
Irimiya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Irimiya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Irimiya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Irimiya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Irimiya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Irimiya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra estudia y también trabaja en una Financiera, estudia la carrera de contaduría y auditoria, y por medio de sus conocimientos quiere poder seguir creciendo en su ámbito laboral y crecer de esa manera.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, ya que quiere cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alejandra studies and also works at a finance company. She studies the major of accounting and auditing. Through her knowledge, she wants to be able to continue growing in her work environment and to progress in that way.

She requests this loan to be able to cover her degree expenses, because she wants to cover this expense that she has. She is thankful for the opportunity that she receives by finishing her studies.

loans.use: to pay for degree expenses.

loans.name: Abdl-Ghani

texts.en:
Abdl-Ghani is a 21-year-old single young man from Yabad, a small village near Jenin city.
His father works as a smith and gets a low and unstable income. His income barely covers all the family needs.

Abdl-Ghani is a student in the university where he studies electrical engineering. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job in the future to support his family.

Abdl-Ghani took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university fees for the first semester. By taking this loan, Abdl-Ghani will be able to register in the university and pay part of the urgent expenses he has.

Abdl-Ghani appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Girasol De Monimbó Group

texts.es: Conformado por grandes mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras .Poniendo todos sus esfuerzos para seguir luchando y progresando para el bienestar familiar de sus seres amados. Coordinado por doña Rosa Argentina, de 40 años de edad, casada y con un hijo de 3 anitos quien en su motor de vida. Dedicada a la venta de gaseosa, helados y venta de ropa nueva para tener mayores ingreso. Ahora el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosa, helados, blumers, boxers, tobilleras y talladores. Las demás integrantes son Rosa, de 54 dedicada a la elaboración de carteras, Cándida de 37 venta ropa nueva, Josefa a la venta de ropa y calzado y María de 48 años a la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The group is comprised of great hard-struggling and hard-working women, putting all of their efforts to keep fighting and making progress for the well-being of their loved ones. The group is coordinated by Rosa Argentina, 40 years old, who is married with a 3-year-old child who is the driving force in her life.

She works selling soda, ice cream, and new clothing to make better income.

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of soda, ice cream, panties, boxers, ankle bracelets and bras.

The other group members are Rosa, 54, who makes wallets, Cándida, 37, who sells new clothing, Josefa, who sells clothing and shoes, and María, 48, who sells used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase soda, ice cream, panties, boxers, ankle bracelets, and bras.

loans.name: Lorly

texts.en:
Lorly is a single woman who lives a simple life with her family in Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 48 years old and does “bobo” (is a kind of fish trap, that is used to catch a fish) fishing to earn a living. She also works hard to earn for the future. Thus, she is asking for a bigger amount of loan to finance her “bobo” fishing business.

Out from the money she is requesting she will buy fishing net, fishing knot (is used as the baseline of the fishing net) and bamboo (used in making “bobo”). She will also buy gasoline and pay laborers. In the future, Lorly wants to uplift her livelihood to have better means of living.

loans.use: to fishing net, fishing knot and bamboo

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Eunice will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Osir

texts.en:
Osir is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells steel wool, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years.

His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of steel wool and soap. He hopes that in the future, he will have increased income. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of steel wool and soap to sell.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and a mother of two. She is making a contribution to the family budget by selling cosmetics and cleaning products through a network system.

She has used loan for three times. With the help of the loans she bought bulks of products, sold them, and gained money. With the help of this new loan she is planning to buy bulks of products, sell them and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:

Fatma hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Netwörk sistemi ile kozmetik ve temizlik ürünleri satışı yaparak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı. Aldığı mikro kredi ile kozmetik ve temizlik malzemelerini toptan olarak aldı ve satarak para kazandı. Yeni aldığı mikro kredi ile de kozmetik ve temizlik malzemelerini toptan olarak alacak ve satarak işlerini geliştirmeyi planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning materials.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Mary Rose is 36 years old and has five children. She is married and has five children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines.

Mary Rose requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies. She has been in this business for one year now. In the future, Mary Rose would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Non Group

texts.en:
Bounpheang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

He and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Bounpheang and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within these two years, filter users, like Bounpheang’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a businesswoman and she has a small kiosk, but she is very highly interested in doing business, so she is requesting a loan of $1500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as cooking oil, slippers, biscuits, candies, toothpaste, hard drinks and other things to sell. Isabel started to open her kiosk a few years ago with her own working capital of $100. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. She will use this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, slippers, biscuits, candies, toothpaste, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Elxan

texts.en:
Elxan is 42 years old, married, and is an IDP (internally displaced person). He has 2 sons and a daughter. He loves his family.

For supporting the family he has been involved in farming over 10 years. He grows some vegetables. He knows that people like fresh, healthy vegetables. So he grows them and takes them to the local bazaar.

The time has arrived in his family for sending his son to university. In order to support him, Elxan is planning to expand his business. He will buy new seeds for planting fruits.

For this KIVA lenders should support him.

loans.use: to buy new seeds for planting fruits.

loans.name: Norlaine

texts.en:
Norlaine is 36 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Norlaine works very hard to provide for them.

Norlaine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Norlaine has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Norlaine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cristian Alexander

texts.es:
Cristian, de 24 años de edad, tiene un nivel académico de bachillerato general, vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de, se dedica a la producción de granos básicos y a la  peluquería.

Cristian, trabaja como peluquero desde hace 2 años y lo aprendió de un compañero de estudio, quien lo indujo a conocer dicho servicio y luego se independizo. 

Cristian, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar sillas, espejos y equipo para brindar una mejor atención en su local.

Cristian, sueña con tener un negocio estable, que le permita la sostenibilidad de sus clientes y por ende los ingresos económicos de su familia.
texts.en:
Cristian, 24 years old, has a high school diploma. He lives with his wife and his two daughters. He works in the production of staple foods and as a barber.

Cristian has worked as a barber since 2 years ago. He learned the skill from a classmate, who prompted him to get to know the service, and later became independent. 

Cristian is requesting the loan to buy chairs, mirrors, and equipment to provide better service in his shop.

Cristian dreams of having a stable business that affords him the sustainability of clients, and as a result, the economic income of his family.

loans.use: to buy chairs, mirrors, and equipment to provide better service in his shop.

loans.name: Bigyani's Group

texts.en:
Bigyani, 34, standing to the extreme right in the photograph, is a charismatic and hardworking lady from Balugaon, Odisha, India. She has a family of four and is a blessed mother of two daughters who are currently in school.

Bigyani hails from a low-income household and has access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to toilet, she faces a lot of problems as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself. She no longer finds it feasible enough to depend on an open field for defecation, and she is vulnerable to the risk of crime and molestation.

Therefore, Bigyani, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode in it. Access to basic sanitation will consequently result in safety, improved health, medical savings, and increased productivity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode in it.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Faisal is a 30-year-old single man and lives in Toubas in Nablus city. Faisal has a small stockade in front of his house. His main business is trading in livestock such as goats, sheep, ewes, etc.

Faisal needs the loan to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and then sell them to make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits his ability to expand his project, and the other challenge is the seasonality of the livestock trade.

For the future, Faisal hopes to expand his project by increasing the number of livestock to raise. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and ewes in order to raise them and then sell them to make some profits.

loans.name: Xayal

texts.en:
Xayal is 23 years old and married. He is an IDP (internally displaced person). He is a farmer. He loves his job because he is doing this together with his wife. They plant some vegetables and fruits and take them to the local bazaar for selling.

Currently Xayal has become a little less motivated, because his income is low. But unlike other people, he doesn't want to leave his native place for an urban-area prospective job. So he is planning to expand his activities. With applying for this loan, he will use the funds.

Xayal is hoping that Kiva lenders will support him.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: José de 47 años de edades madre soltera y vive con su hijo de 11 años de edad, él es un hombre muy trabajador  amable y responsable cualidades por las cuales se caracteriza entre los habitantes de su pequeño municipio, él se esfuerza mucho a diario en su trabajo para llevarle el sustento diario a su hijo que se queda al cuido de los vecinos mientras él trabaja. Él presta sus habilidades de conducir a la empresa de transporte, que hace ruta de su municipio hacia afuera de este arriesgándose por la actual violencia en la zona. Él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: alambre, poliducto, caja térmica, conectores, y y pago de instalación de energía eléctrica. Espera la aprobación del crédito para invertir de inmediato, y así su hijo este en un mejor lugar donde vivir y ya no temer por su seguridad por las noches.
texts.en:
Jose, 47 years old, is a single father and lives with his 11 year old son. He is a very hard worker, friendly, and responsible, qualities that characterize him among the inhabitants of his small town. 

He pushes himself a lot everyday at work to bring daily sustenance to his son, who stays under the care of neighbors while he works. He lends his driving abilities to the transportation company, which makes a route from his town towards the outside, putting himself at risk to the ongoing violence in the area.

He requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in: wire, flexible conduits, breaker boxes, connectors, and installation fees for electrical energy. He hopes for the approval of the loan so he can invest immediately, and this way his son is in a better place where he can live and no longer fear for his safety at night.

loans.use: to invest in: wire, flexible conduits, breaker boxes, connectors, and fees to install electrical energy.

loans.name: Neziha

texts.en:
Neziha is married and a mother of two. She sells Ersağ, and makes handicrafts and and sells them, so she makes a contribution to the family budget. Her handicrafts were preferred by the neighbours.

Besides the handicraft business, she started selling via a network business. Although there had been ups and downs in this business, she still continues.

With the help of the loan from Maya, she increased her sales in the networking business. Her dream is to open a millinery shop on her own.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Neziha hanım evli ve 2 çocuk annesi. Elişi yaparak ve ersağ satarak ailesinin geçimine katkı sağlıyor. Ördükleri beğenilince çevresindekilere satmaya başlıyor. Elişinin yanı sıra network işine giriyor. Ama bu sektörde bazı dönemler duraklamalar yaşamış ama hala devam ediyor. Maya’dan aldığı kredi ile network işinde yüzdesini artırdı. En büyük hayali tuhafiye açmak.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products.

loans.name: Zoila Lorena

texts.es: Zoila de 34 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 9 años de edad, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza mucho por ayudar a su compañero de vida con el sustento diario de su hogar y la educación de su hijo, ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios de mantenimientos, en una empresa que queda un poco lejana de su lugar de residencia es así como ella ayuda a la economía de su hogar. Zoila está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en: ladrillo, cemento, hierro, grava, arena, etc., para construir un cuarto dormitorio para su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Zoila, 34 years old, lives with her life partner and her 9 year old son. She is a very hardworking woman who tries hard to help her life partner with the daily household sustenance and her son's education.

She provides her cleaning services in a company that is located a little far from her residence. It is in this way that she helps the the household economy. 

Zoila is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: bricks, cement, iron, gravel, sand, etc., to construct a bedroom for her young son.

loans.use: to invest in: bricks, cement, iron, gravel, sand, etc., to construct a bedroom.

loans.name: Hubert

texts.es:
Hubert con 59 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos, en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Hubert cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Hubert se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes,desde hace más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería, como arroz, azúcar entre otros. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Hubert es socio recurrente para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. A manejado 07 créditos,el último fue de S/.1,000.00 y lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Hubert is 59 years old, married, and lives with his spouse and children in their own home. They live in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, in the country of Perú. Hubert has very good personal references and employment history from inhabitants in the area. The people in this town make a living in agriculture, shops that sell merchandise, and livestock.

Hubert has been engaged in selling groceries for more than 5 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, etc. In this way he can increase his business, obtain more income, and improve his quality of life.

Hubert is a recurring member of the institution "Edpyme Alternativa". He has taken 7 loans. The last was for 1,000 soles and was paid off on time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Two years ago, Ashraf started a school in his area because he wanted to provide quality education to local children, and today he educates 161 students.

He has requested a loan of PKR 120,000 for building a door, some windows, benches, and desks for the students, and to finish construction. By undertaking these improvements, he is closer to his aim of creating a good school environment and increasing enrollment.

loans.use: to build a door, some windows, benches, and desks for the students, and to finish construction.

loans.name: Suhaela

texts.en:
Suhaela is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives in a house that she owns.

She has had a beauty salon in her home for one year. Suhaela has many customers, as she does a very good job. With the profits, Suhaela is able to move forward with her family.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy products for her beauty salon such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hair pins, and other things that she needs. With these items, Suhaela can earn higher profits, thus giving her greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy products such as creams, shampoo, scissors, hair pins, and other things that she needs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.pt:
A Senhora Joaquina é divorciada, vive na casa da prima junto com seus dois filhos e a sua mãe. É professora com o presente empréstimo pretende adquirir material de construção nomeadamente (cimento, pedra, ferro, areia) para dar continuidade com a sua obra. Tem como sonho ter um aviário, um salão de cabeleireiro e falar fluentemente a língua inglesa.
Ela tem algumas dificuldades financeiras para poder continuar com a sua obra pelo que irá pagar o emprestimo sem entrar em mora de forma a se beneficiar de outros financiamentos
texts.en:
Joaquina is divorced. She owns the house where she lives with her two children and her mother.

She is a teacher, and is planning to use this loan to buy construction materials such as cement, stones, iron, and sand, to continue with her construction works.

She dreams of having a poultry house and a beauty salon, and speaking English fluently. She has had some financial difficulties to continue with her construction works, but she will pay off the loan without defaulting, in order to be able to apply for more loans.

loans.use: to buy cement, stones, iron, and sand.

loans.name: Union Y Desarrollo 6 Group

texts.en:
Narda is one of the members of Union y Desarrollo 6. This group is located in the city of Hato Mayor, which is one the most rural cities in the country and whose economy is dependent on agriculture. These five business women are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community.

Narda, a Dominican mother living in the rural are of Dominican Republic, makes her home in a simple structure with one of her long term partner. They have 4 children and they are no longer living with their parents. She is excited to be taking out her 6th loan with Esperanza. She sells miscellaneous products like used clothes and cosmetic (specially from Catalogs).

This loan is intended to increase her inventory, by buying some packets full of used clothes, which she sells for pieces and different products to resend them.

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to help her partner with expenses. She thanks you all for your support

loans.use: to buy used clothes and cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof of her house

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 34-year-old, married man from Khanyounis city, located in the Gaza Strip, which has an economic blockade imposed by the Israeli authorities since 2007. He is a father of one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Akram also has a grocery store where he sells basic grocery products.

Akram took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store. With this loan, Akram can buy more cold soft drinks for his store to resell, which are popular because Gaza can get very hot. Akram appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his grocery store.

loans.name: Lorena Aracely

texts.es: Lorena de 24  años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida quien le ayuda con la economía del hogar. Ella es una persona muy entusiasta y trabajadora que en busca obtener los ingresos económicos para los gastos de su vivienda, se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa de venta de productos varios que se encuentra en su comunidad, en la cual lleva 7 años laborando. Lorena en busca de mejorar su condición de vida, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y pago de mano de obra para reparar la fosa séptica, debido a que se ha dañado y desprende malos olores, es por ello que buscando la manera de mantener un ambiente saludable para su familia y evitar posibles enfermedades se solicita dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Lorena is 24 years old and lives with her husband who helps with the household expenses. She is very enthusiastic and hard-working, seeking income to pay her household expenses. She works selling various products that she finds in her community, something she has done for 7 years.

Lorena seeks to improve her living conditions. She seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and pay for labor to repair the septic tank, as it is damaged and giving off bad odors. Therefore she is seeking a way to provide a healthy environment for her family and avoid possible infirmities by seeking this loan.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, brick, and pay for labor to repair the septic tank.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a resident of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 54 years old and a mother of two adult children and one school-age child who is 13 years old. Her husband works hard as a farmer to provide their daily needs.

Jenelyn sells dried fish and fresh fish to help her husband. She has been doing this for six years. Jenelyn is asking a loan of PHP 8,000. She will use money to buy more dried and fresh fish to sell. In the future, she wishes to improve her business to enhance their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy dried and fresh fish.

loans.name: Oportunidad Group

texts.es:
Entre colinas, desde donde se puede observar la entrada del municipio, en medio de la planta hidroeléctrica y la extensión de agua, se ubica el grupo llamado “Oportunidad”. Los integrantes eligieron el nombre ya que los préstamos de VFMéxico significan una oportunidad de crecimiento en sus actividades: Emelia invierte en su tienda de abarrotes; Ramón, en tortillas; Rita y Soledad, en refrescos; Hortencia, en la venta de mojarra; Cleofas y Verónica, en dulces; Brigida, en antojitos; Guadalupe, en pollo y Manuela, en su estética.
Doña Emelia tiene 51 años de edad, está casada con el señor Cesáreo y son padres de 6 hijos quienes les han dado nietos que brindan alegría a la casa. Doña Emi, como le conocen, ha dedicado 20 años de su vida a la venta de abarrotes, su pequeña tienda está ubicada en casa en un pequeño cuarto donde exhibe la mercancía en anaqueles de fierro. Sobre la barra que tiene como mostrador tiene un contenedor de plástico y una báscula ya que las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido iniciar con la venta de pollo, así como la elaboración y venta de pasta de mole. Al levantar la tapa del contenedor, el aroma es agradable y se antojan unas enmoladas.
La tienda de doña Emi ofrece servicio desde hace 20 años a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana y hasta las 8:00 de la noche de lunes a domingo, cuando ella sale sus hijas se hacen cargo del negocio. Dos veces por semana, entre las 5 elaboran y venden tamales de elote, bollitos, chancletas y tamales rancheros que también ponen a la venta.
“Soy una mujer plena y feliz, agradezco a dios por la gran familia que me dio y permitirme formar un gran equipo con ella” expresa Emi con emoción. Las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, dar educación a sus hijos, iniciar otras actividades, solventar sus gastos personales, cambiar su estufa, refrigerador, televisión y comprar una lavadora. Además, Emi comenta que la tienda es el patrimonio que formó para sus hijas y espera que el negocio pueda continuar de generación en generación. 
El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en arroz, frijol, azúcar, leche, café, refresco, galletas y botanas para continuar con  su actividad como hasta el día de hoy.
“Gracias por cada oportunidad brindado con un nuevo préstamo, dios los bendiga” expresa el grupo como muestra de gratitud.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la pequeña tienda de doña Emi quien viste blusa amarilla y muestra la pasta de mole en una cacerola.
texts.en:
Among the hills, from which one can see the entrance to the municipality, between the hydroelectric plant and the expanse of water, a group called Oportunidad is located. The members chose the name since the VFMéxico loans mean an opportunity for growth in their businesses: Emelia to invest in her grocery store, Ramón in tortillas; Rita and Soledad in soft drinks; Hortencia in selling mojarra fish; Cleofas and Verónica in sweets; Brigida in snacks; Guadalupe in chicken; and Manuela in her cosmetology business.

Emelia is 51 years old, married to Cesáreo and they are parents of 6 children who have given them grandchildren who bring joy to the house. Emi, as she is known, has dedicated 20 years of her life to selling groceries. Her small store is located in her house, in a small room where she shows her merchandise on iron shelves. On the bar they have as a counter, she has a plastic container and a scale since the earnings she has gotten have allowed her to begin to sell chicken, as well as making and selling mole sauce. Upon opening the cover of the container, the smell is pleasant and one gets a craving for chicken mole enchiladas.

Emi's store has been in service for 20 years from 7:00 in the morning to 8:00 at night from Monday to Sunday. When she goes out, her daughters take over the business. Two times a week, among the 5 of them, they make and sell corn tamales, rolls, chancletas [stuffed chayote squash] and tamales rancheros which they also sell.

"I am a full and happy woman, I thank God for the great family He has given me and for allowing me to form a great team with it," Emi says emotionally. The earnings she gets have allowed her to support her husband with the household expenses, to provide her children with an education, begin other work, cover her personal expenses, replace her stove, refrigerator and television and purchase a washing machine. In addition, Emi says that the store is the legacy that she created for her daughters and she hopes that the business can continue from generation to generation.

The new loan will be invested in rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, soft drinks, cookies, and snacks to continue with her work as she has been doing to date.

"Thank you for each offered opportunity with a new loan, God bless you," the group says in an expression of gratitude.

*The photo was taken in the small store owned by Emi, who is wearing a yellow blouse and shows her mole sauce in a pot.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, milk, coffee, soft drinks, cookies, and chips.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as dependable. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big cereals shop within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single woman, 24 years old, with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jane has a buy and sell copra (dried coconut meat) business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Jane requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more copras and other materials for her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more copras and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Janita

texts.en:
Janita is 47 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Janita works very hard to provide for them.

Janita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Janita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, juice, etc.

In the future, Janita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, juice, etc.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra is 44 years old, single and has one child.

Isidra is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Isidra requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

In the future, Isidra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Türkan

texts.en:
Türkan is married and a mother of three. She is running a meerschaum store with her husband. She has used loans for four times. She bought bulks of raw meerschaum and made jewelry, necklaces, rings and paternosters. She sold them and gained money.

With the help of her new loan she is planning to buy bulks of raw meerschaum, make her jewelry, sell them, make money, and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:

Türkan hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Lületaşı dükkanı işletiyor. Bu işi eşi ile beraber yapıyor. Dört kez mikro kredi kullandı. Lületaşını işlenmemiş alarak işledi takı, kolye, yüzük, tesbih yaparak sattı ve para kazandı. Aldığı yeni mikro kredi ile lületaşını işlenmemiş alarak takılar yapacak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy meerschaum, to make pipes and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a farmer married with 4 children. He cultivates mainly tomatoes. He is doing very well and is always able to meet his family needs without exhausting his capital. However, it is  now a rainy season, which makes his tomatoes vulnerable to pests and diseases. Richard lacks enough money to overcome this problem, since he has just paid his workers. He requests for money to buy pesticides and fertilizers to improve his products so that his income levels are not affected.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, and fertilizers to improve his products.

loans.name: Nilgün

texts.en:
Nilgün, a young entrepreneur, is 33 years old. She has been selling Farmasi cosmetics for two years. Before selling, she used to use these products. She was satisfied with them and she ordered them constantly. When her friends and neighbours heard about these products they started to order from her so she started selling the products. After two years, she has permanent customers. With the help of her fourth loan from MAYA, she bought products in bulk, increased her profit percentage and became a leader.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nilgün hanım 33 yaşında bekâr genç bir girişimci. Nilgün hanım 2 yıl önce tanıştığı Farmasi marka kozmetik ürünlerini satıyor. Bu ürünleri satmadan önce kendisi kullanmaya başlıyor. Ürünlerden memnun kalınca sürekli sipariş vermeye başlıyor. Bu ürünleri duyan yakın çevresi de sipariş vermeye başlayınca Nilgün hanım ürünlerin satışına başlıyor. 2 yılda bu ürünleri kullanan sürekli müşterileri oluşuyor. Maya'dan 4. kredisini kullanarak toptan ürün çekerek primini artırdı ve liderlik seviyesine ulaştı.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Ntungamo Girls School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Justus. He is the head teacher of Ntungamo Girls High School, a girls school in the Rural area of Ntungamo with 450 students. Ntungamo Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Ntungamo Girls School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Justus ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Famille Sasita Group

texts.fr: Avec le crédit précédent, Habimana a entretenu son champ. Les revenus générés l'ont permis à scolariser ses enfants, assurer l'alimentation de sa famille et l'agrandissement de son activité. Durant ce crédit, le seul obstacle a été un cas de maladie qui a nécessité les soins dans un milieu autre que dans sa localité, ce qui lui a coûté beaucoup d'argent. Avec le second crédit, il compte entretenir son champ.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Habimana managed his field. The generated income allowed him to educate his children, to ensure food for his family and the growth of his business. During this loan, the only obstacle was a case of illness, which required care in a milieu outside of his locale and it cost him a lot of money.
With the second loan, he plans to manage his field.

loans.use: to manage his coffee field.

loans.name: Rudy Antonio

texts.es:
Rudy, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos pequeños que están estudiando en la escuela y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Rudy, trabaja como albañil construyendo casas en la comunidad, este oficio se lo enseño un tío que vive a su lado; pero también se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas como siembra de maíz y jícama y actualmente tiene dos hectáreas de jícama y maíz sembradas.

Rudy, anteriormente había solicitado un crédito para realizar sus trabajos agrícolas, en dicha actividad le fue muy bien, pues logro obtener una excelente cosecha, pago su crédito y tiene una parte de granos guardada.- Ahora, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto, pues considera que es un buen negocio y quiere aprovecharlo.

Su sueño sigue siendo el mismo, el cual consiste en construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Rudy is 36 years old and completed 5th grade. He is married and has two small children who are studying in school and his wife takes care of the home. Rudy works as a brick layer building houses in the community. An uncle who lives nearby taught him this work. He also farms, growing corn and jicama. Today he has two hectares of jicama and corn planted.

Previously Rudy sought a loan for his farming. That activity went very well, he obtained a good harvest, paid his loan, and has some of his grain stored.

Today he seeks a new loan to buy steer as he considers this a good business and he wants to take advantage of it. His dream is still the same, to build his own home.

loans.use: to buy steer.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 25-year-old, single man from Rafah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family’s standard of living and help them live more comfortably.

Khalid took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Khalid will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.

Khalid appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica desde hace 4 años a la venta de ropa de segunda mano su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vive en casa propia con su madre quien le ayuda con el negocio y su esposo, con el credito anterior pudo aumentar de mercaderias y asi aumentar sus ingresos, la joven está solicitando nuevamenten un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar mas fardos de ropa y seguir con sus ventas, para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: The young woman with the pixelated face is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. She has been selling used clothing for 4 years. Her business is located in her home. She lives in her own home with her mother, who helps her with the business, and her husband.  With the previous loan she was able to increase her merchandise and thus her income. The young woman seeks a new loan from INTEGRAL in order to be able to buy more bundles of clothing and continue with her sales in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos de 44 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a sus padres y su hija de 5 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida gracias al cultivo del maíz, frijol y jícama, negocio con el cual genera sus ingresos económicos con los que esta brindado el estudio y todo lo necesario a su hija así como también cumple con los gastos en el hogar. Carlos desea invertir en mejore calidad de productos para que sus cosechas produzcan mejores productos con los que pueda generar mejores ingresos económicos con los cuales brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: semillas, abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas y sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Carlos is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his parents and 5 year old daughter. He is a hard-working man who earns a living thanks to his farming of corn, beans, and jicama. This business generates income with which he provides schooling for his daughter and everything she needs, and also supports the household expenses.

Carlos wishes to improve the quality of his products so that his harvest produces better products resulting in greater income in order to provide a better quality of life for his family. Therefore he seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in seeds, manure, and fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops and income.

loans.use: to invest in seeds, manure, and fertilizers to improve the quality of his crops and income.

loans.name: Huriye

texts.en:
Huriye is married and a mother of two. Her husband is a teacher, and she started looking for a job in order to support her husband financially.

She bought a spice store, which her friend turned over to her, and started selling spices. With the help of her fourth, loan she bought seasonal spices in bulk and increased her sales.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Huriye hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Eşi öğretmen olan Huriye Hanım evin giderlerine destek olmak için iş aramaya başlamış. Arkadaşının devir ettiği baharat dükkanını o alarak baharat satışı yapmaya başlamış. Maya’dan 4. kredisini kullanan Huriye hanım mevsimine göre toptan baharat alımı yaptı. Toptan ve mevsimine uygun aldığı baharatlar sayesinde satışlarını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy weight loss spices.

loans.name: Tuğba

texts.en:
Tuğba is married and a mother of two. In order to make a contribution to the family budget, she started selling glassware once a week in the local bazaar.

Then she expanded her business and started selling every day. Being a young entrepreneur and an employer, she has two workers.

With the help of the loan from Maya, she bought products in bulk and increased her profit.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Tuğba Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Tuğba Hanım eşine destek olmak için önce hafta da bir gün semt pazarına giderek zücaciye satışı yapmaya başlamış. Daha sonraki dönemlerde işini geliştirmiş ve haftanın her günü pazarlar da satış yapmaya başlamış. Hem genç bir girişimci hem de bir işveren olan Tuğba Hanım yanında iki kişi çalıştırıyor. Maya’dan aldığı krediler Pazardaki tezgâhlarına toptan ürün aldı ve kar oranını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products to resell.

loans.name: Sundar Ramesh And Group

texts.en:
Sundar is a 42-year-old woman who stays with her husband and her three school-going children in the Jhabua district of Madhya Pradesh. Sundar works hard to make life comfortable for her family. But she has realized that the income from her husband’s work does not suffice to sustain her entire family. With the household expenses rising as her children grow, she is finding it hard to make ends meet.

Sundar has decided to start a sewing business of her own so that the income from her business can supplement the income from her husband’s work. She plans to stitch frocks, Punjabi dresses, etc. She is confident that her new business will help her increase her household income. She expects her monthly income to increase by Rs. 2,000. The only thing that comes in the way of her executing this plan is the lack of funds. She needs a loan to kickstart her sewing business. Sundar is joined by four other women who have come together to apply for a group loan of Rs. 60,000. The loan will help these women provide better for their respective families. They are grateful to their lenders for believing in them and helping them out financially.

loans.use: to start her sewing business and stitch frocks, Punjabi dresses, etc.

loans.name: Percy

texts.en:
Percy is a 30-year-old father of two boys. His wife is unemployed, thus making him the family's only breadwinner. He collects bottles for recycling and has worked hard to develop a stable business with good returns. He supplies these bottles to a recycling plant.

He is now expanding his business and has approached specific scrap yards that will sell bottles to him in bulk. "Returnable bottles have very good margins. The more you deliver, the higher your profit," he says. Therefore, he is requesting a Kiva loan to buy a container of returnable bottles.

His dream is to become a productive businessman. "I want to be a positive example to my family and to the society," says a confident Percy.

loans.use: to buy a container of returnable bottles.

loans.name: Thongyai Group

texts.en:
Khamvone’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Khamvone and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which she can now shift to other pursuits.

Khamvone and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budget.
