The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Khamvone’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es: Felipe es habitante de la capital del país, Bogotá y en ella reside en compañía de su familia, a quienes gracias a su entrega y dedicación ha logrado ofrecer bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida. Por tradición familiar cuenta con conocimientos de construcción de inmuebles y redes eléctricas,  labor a la que se dedica alterno a su actividad principal como empleado del sector público, él maneja muy bien su tiempo para logar responder a sus clientes, de este modo cuenta con veinte años ofreciendo de sus servicios en construcción. Su vivienda fue levantada por sus propias manos y poco a poco continúa realizando adecuaciones para mejorar sus condiciones de habitabilidad. En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adecuar en su vivienda unos parqueaderos que le permitan suministrar el servicio y tener un nuevo ingreso que a futuro le permita lograr su meta de construir la segunda planta de su casa lote.
texts.en:
Felipe lives in the capital, Bogota, with his family. Thanks to his support and dedication he has been able to support his family and provide a good quality of life. Through his family's traditional work he is knowledgeable about building furniture and electrical networks, work that he does in addition to his primary job as an employee in the public sector. He manages his time well in order to be able to respond to his customers, and has over 20 years providing construction services. He built his own home with his hands, little by little, and continues making renovations to improve its living conditions.

Today he seeks a loan, his first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to create some parking spaces at his home which will permit him to provide service and have a new income in the future, allowing him to meet his goal of building a second floor on his home.

loans.use: to create some parking spaces at his home.

loans.name: Bouaviengkham Group

texts.en:
Chan is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan. Chan and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years. The water filter Chan and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.

Chan and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Chan and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phonthong Group

texts.en:
Ohnsa’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Ohnsa and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits. Ohnsa and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Ohnsa’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush, 41, is from Gugarq village where she lives with her 4-year-old daughter. Her husband currently works as a migrant worker, their elder son serves in the army, and a younger son is a student living and studying in a different city. Both Haykanush and her husband, work hard to manage the increasing costs of the family. Haykanush is involved in agribusiness, besides her main profession as an accountant.

She keeps only 3 oxen and 16 hens. Because Haykanush's husband is a butcher, she is currently asking for this loan to purchase two more oxen and to feed them, so her husband is able to come back and get involved in meat selling. She also plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and greatly hopes that lenders will support her goals to sustain her farm.

loans.use: to pay for two oxen and forage for feeding the livestock to restart a meat selling business and enlarge family's living income.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 58 years old and opened her school five years ago with the intent to ensure a standard of education was provided to the children in her village. Currently, there are 117 students and Kalsoom wants to grow.

She has taken a loan of PKR 120,000 in order to maintain the structure of the school and to create new rooms with the hope of expanding to teach high school classes as well.

loans.use: to maintain the structure of the school, and to create new rooms with the hope of expanding to teach high school classes as well.

loans.name: Natoom Group

texts.en:
Ohn’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. Ohn and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Ohn and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their families’ budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users like Ohn’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so she can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Bouaviengkhamtai Group

texts.en:
Chone understands the difference a water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Chone knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Chone purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal and decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Chone is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe de 57 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su padre. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se gana la vida como comerciante ya que posee un negocio de ventas de manteles con el que ha logrado numerosos clientes que la buscan y recomiendan por ser una persona amable, además de ser su fuente de ingresos económicos con los que brinda todo lo necesario para su padre y el hogar. Guadalupe desea invertir en la compra de más variedad de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes mayores opciones de compra por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: delantales, carteras, etc., para surtir su negocio con nuevos productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 57, lives in her own home with her father. She's a hard-working woman who makes a living in commerce. She has a business selling tablecloths and has found many clients who go to her and recommend her because she is a kind person; it's the source of income that allows her to provide all the necessities for her father and her home.

Guadalupe hopes to invest in a larger variety of products to offer her clients more buying options; this is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in aprons, purses, etc., in order to stock up on new products to offer her clients.

loans.use: invest in aprons, purses, etc., to stock up her business with new products to offer her clients.

loans.name: Namita's Group

texts.en:
Namita is an enterprising and humble lady standing in the middle in the photograph with her small son. She hails from an interior village in Balugaon district, Odisha, India. She has a family of three consisting of her husband and her only son. Namita is an artisan by profession and works very hard in order to sustain her livelihood and fulfill all the basic necessities. The major problem that concerns her is that she does not have an appropriate toilet in her house and has to depend upon the open field to attend to nature's call. This makes her more vulnerable to crime and molestation. She is a very concerned lady and does not find it safe to walk long distances and depend upon isolated places for defecation.

So in order to restore her privacy and increase her safety and hygiene, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet in her home and safeguard her family's health so as to reduce the medical expenses.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet.

loans.name: Phalavaek Group

texts.en: Nengthao understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Nengthao knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Nengthao purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost of foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.  Nengthao is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Homthad Group

texts.en: Herthor is excited that the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Herthor and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.  The water filter Herthor and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Herthor and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Herthor and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Gerson Stanle

texts.es:
Gerson, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, dejó de estudiar porque a su madre le es muy difícil financiar sus estudios; por eso se incorporó a una capacitación de apicultores y eso le ayudó a encontrar trabajo cuidando colmenas con el ingeniero que les dio la capacitación gracias a su desempeño en proyecto, él vive con su madre y una hermana, por las cuales él trabaja para darles lo necesario. 

Gerson, se dedica a la apicultura desde los 14 años de edad, tiene a su cargo 300 colmenas y tiene 65 que son propias de él, de las cuales obtiene 6 barriles de miel cada año, de los cuales ha comprado su propio vehículo y por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su madre y a su hermana e invierte en las colmenas para reproducirlas. 

Gerson, necesita el préstamo para comprar 8 colmenas más porque en esta época se cosecha, esto con el fin de ampliar más su negocio y aumentar más sus ingresos.

Gerson, sueña con construir su propia vivienda, para casarse con una buena mujer y tener un hijo y darles lo mejor.- Desea comprar madera para reproducir el próximo año sus colmenas.
texts.en:
Gerson, 21, studied up to grade 9 and then quit school because his mother found it difficult to finance his studies. That's why he took an apiculturist training course which then helped him find work taking care of bee hives with the engineer who trained him, thanks to his performance in the project.

He lives with his mother and a sister and he works to give them all they need.

Gerson has worked as an apiculturist from the age of 14. He is in charge of 300 hives, 65 of which are his own and from which he obtains 6 barrels of honey every year. From these barrels, he has been able to buy a vehicle and through is work can help his mother and his sister. He's also invested in his hives to reproduce them.

Gerson is requesting this loan to buy 8 more hives because it is harvest time, with the intention of expanding his business and increasing his earnings.

Gerson dreams of building his own home so he can marry a good woman, have children and give them all the best. He'd like to buy wood to reproduce his hives next year.

loans.use: to buy 8 more hives because it's harvest time.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es: Ruth de 29 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 5 y 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora  que se gana la vida vendiendo productos de belleza por catálogo y gracias a su amabilidad ha logrado un gran número de clientes que la conocen, es así como ella genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos brindándole todo lo necesario para su desarrollo, también proporcionando los insumos del hogar, además recibe el apoyo de su compañero de vida con algunos de los gastos de los servicios básicos. Ruth desea invertir en nuevos productos por catálogos para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad de opciones de compra, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: perfumería para dama y caballeros, para mejorar la variedad de productos e incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ruth, 29, lives in her own home with her life partner and her two children aged 5 and 12. She's an enterprising woman who makes a living selling beauty products by catalog and thanks to her friendliness has found a large number of clients. Her business has generated the income with which she has moved her children forward, offering all they need for their development, as well as providing the household groceries. She also receives support from her life partner for some of the expenses of the basic household services.

Ruth would like to invest in new products by catalog to offer her clients a greater variety of options for sale; that's why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in perfume for men and women, improve the variety of products she sells and increase her earnings.

loans.use: invest in perfume for men and women, improve the variety of products she sells and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Luis Oswaldo

texts.es: Luis de 46 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que desde muy joven aprendió a cultivar la tierra, oficio que le permite salir adelante, pero además mostrando sus deseos de superación en época seca presta sus servicios de albañil independiente, gracias a lo cual logra sostener la economía de su vivienda. Luis logro hace muchos años adquirir su humilde vivienda en la que vive muy feliz. Luis desea invertir en productos para mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: fertilizantes, abono, semillas de maicillo, semillas de jícamas, etc., y poder así mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas para así poder ofrecerles un mejor producto a sus clientes y generar más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Luis, 46 years old, is a hardworking man that learned how to cultivate land since he was young. It is this profession that has helped him get ahead. In addition, showing his personal drive, in the dry season he offers his services as an independent builder, thanks to which he is able to support his domestic economy. Years ago, Luis was able to purchase his humble home in which he lives happily.

Luis wants to invest in products to better the quality of his crops. For this reason, he asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in fertilizers, compost, sorghum seeds, yam seeds, etc. In this way, he will better the quality of his crops in oder to offer a better product to his clients as well as to generate more economic income.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizers, compost, sorghum seeds, yam seeds, etc. and, thus, better the quality of his crop.

loans.name: Noelia Idania

texts.es: Noelia de 38 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, sus hijas de 15 y 11 años de edad y un hijo de 4 meses. Ella en busca de mantener la economía del hogar y poder ofrecerle todo lo necesario a sus hijos, se dedica a administrar una tienda que ha instalado en su vivienda. Gracias a esto puede satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos, así también gracias al aporte que realiza su compañero de vida. Noelia en busca de mejorar su condición de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, madera y pago de mano de obra para construir un cuarto para cocina y de esta manera tener más espacio y comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Noelia, 38 years old, lives along with her life partner, their 15- and 11-year-old daughters, and one 4-month-old son. In search of supporting her home economically and to be able to offer everything necessary to her children, she makes a living managing a store that she has set up in her home. Thanks to this, she can satisfy the basic needs of her children, as well as thanks to the contributions that her life partner makes.

Noelia, looking to improve her living conditions, is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, and wood, and to pay labor costs to construct a kitchen and so have more space and comfort in her home.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, and wood, and to pay for labor to construct a kitchen.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es: Narciso de 39 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios como carpintero siendo de esta manera como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que está brindando todo lo necesario para el desarrollo de sus hijos, así como llevar el alimento y el pago de los servicios básicos del hogar, recibiendo el apoyo con algunos insumos de parte de su esposa. Narciso desea adquirir herramientas para iniciar su propio negocio es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maquina pulidora, cierra, cincel, lápiz de carpintero, martillo, taladro, etc., para poder iniciar su propio negocio de carpintería y ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Narciso, 39, lives in his own home along with his wife and two children, ages 11 and 3. He is a hardworking man who makes a living offering his services as a carpenter. This is how he generates income to provide for the development of his children, as well as food and home utilities, receiving support from his wife with some supplies.

Narciso wants to acquire tools in order to start his own business. He is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in a sander, saw, chisel, carpenter pencil, hammer, drill, etc., in order to start his own carpentry business and offer his products to his customers.

loans.use: to invest in a sander, saw, chisel, carpenter pencil, hammer, and drill, in order to start his own carpentry business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de 44 años de edad, no posee ningún tipo de nivel académico, actualmente vive junto a su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno de ellos vive junto a él, porque los otros dos ya son personas independientes y tiene sus propias familias.

Manuel, desde muy joven se empeñó en trabaja, a él le gustaba mucho lo que su padre hacia que era trabajar la agricultura, específicamente siembra maíz y frijol; actualmente trabaja dos hectáreas de maíz, las cuales están a una distancia de 1 kilómetro de su casa.

Manuel, necesita el préstamo para comprar plaguicidas y fertilizantes, porque su cultivo de maíz tiene plaga y necesita combatirla para tener buenos resultados de su cosecha.

Su sueño principal es tener una buena cosecha, la cual le sirva para pagar su crédito, dejar granos para su consumo y también comprar ganado para pastar.
texts.en:
Manuel, 44 years old, does not possess any level of education. Currently, he lives with his spouse with whom he has three children, of which only one lives with him because the other two are already independent and have their own families.

From a very young age, Manuel insisted on working. He very much liked what his father did, which was work in agriculture, specifically planting corn and beans. Currently, he works two hectares of corn, which are at a distance of 1 kilometer from his home.

Manuel needs the loan to purchase pesticides and fertilizers because his corn crop has an infestation and he needs to combat it to have good results from his harvest.

His main dream is to have a good harvest, which will serve to pay his loan, leave grain to eat, and also to purchase livestock to put to pasture.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Leyla Carmen

texts.es: Leyda de 20 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en los alrededores de su comunidad, siendo así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que está sacando adelante a sus hijos brindando les  todo lo necesario para su desarrollo y llevando los insumos necesarios para su familia, además de recibir el apoyo de su compañero de vida con algunos gastos del hogar. Leyda desea compra de más variedad de productos para suplir la demanda de sus clientes es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, para mejorar la variedad de ropa que ofrece a sus clientes y generar más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Leyda lives in her own home with her life partner and her one- and three-year-old children. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living selling clothes as a street vendor in the areas surrounding her community. This, in addition to her life partner's support with some household expenses, is how she generates the income with which she is getting ahead, providing her children with everything necessary for their development, and bringing in necessary goods for her family.

Leyda wants to buy more variety of products in order to supply her clients' demands. Because of this, she requests a FUSAI loan in order to invest in: skirts, pants, and underwear to improve the variety of clothing she offers her clients and to generate more income.

loans.use: to invest in: skirts, pants, and underwear, in order to improve the variety of clothing she offers her clients and to generate more income.

loans.name: Somphuan Group

texts.en:
Khamman understands the difference a water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. He knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Khamman purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Khamman is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Burmakan

texts.ru: Бурмакан, 53 года, замужем, есть 2 детей. Образование у нее среднее. В качестве дохода для своей семьи Бурмакан занимается сельским хозяйством. У Бурмакан есть 4 коровы, 10 овец. На 2,25 Га земли она выращивает ячмень. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 17,000 сом (KGS). По характеру Бурмакан человек очень ответственный, жизнерадостный и пунктуальный. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Бурмакан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от бизнеса Бурмакан собирается направить на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Burmakan is 53, married, and the mother of two children.  She has a secondary education.  To provide a source of income for her family, she works in agriculture; she has four cows, 10 sheep, and she also grows barley on 2.25 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 17,000 som (KGS).

By nature, Burmakan is a responsible, happy, and punctual person.  Eager to further grow her business, she has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum bank, and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS).  This loan will allow her to buy two steers for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase two steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Claveles De Haciendita Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge “Claveles de Haciendita”, with its 12 members, is located in Chiantla, Huehuetenango - a city of about 207 square miles and 6,500 feet above sea level. The area is known for its mining activities, but there are also lush green forests and acres of land under cultivation for produce.  

Olga is 33-years-old and a member of the “Claveles de Haciendita". Olga, along with her husband, is a farmer. They grow a large quantity of different vegetables.  Besides helping her husband to farm, Olga also has a small pharmacy that she opened just 10 months ago. It has seen a great deal of success in her community. She joined “Claveles de Haciendita” in order to get a loan to buy more medicine to fill her pharmacy. Her goal is to generate a large enough income that will support her children’s education.  

Two of Olga’s three children are already attending school, but in Guatemala a child’s education is financed by the parents. In the primary grades, parents need to buy all the supplies, from books to paper etc. Then, in middle school, they must pay a portion of their child’s education plus their school supplies.    

The women of “Claveles de Haciendita” are very grateful for the trust that KIVA investors around the world have given them by providing funds for their loans. The funds have helped them develop their businesses, create stronger families, and provide an education for their children. This has improved the quality of their lives and made their futures brighter through the successes of their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to fill her pharmacy

loans.name: Efrain Armando

texts.es: Efraín de 21 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañera de vida, su hijo de 2 años de edad y demás integrantes de la familia. Buscando la manera de mantener la economía del hogar y hacer todo lo posible porque no les falte nada, Efraín lucha por conseguir su sustento diario. Esto lo logra gracias a un pequeño negocio que posee de venta de sandalias, el cual lo administra desde hace 4 años. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Efraín solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano de obra para construir un muro al frente de su vivienda y así ofrecerle mayor seguridad a su hijo y esposa.
texts.en:
Efraín is 21 years old. He lives with his life companion his two year old son and the other members of his family. Searching for the way to support the household economy and do all he can so they lack nothing, Efraín fights to obtain his daily sustenance. He has managed to do this thanks to a small business that he has selling sandals, which he has administered for four years.

Looking to improve his quality of living Efraín is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cinder blocks, sand, cement, re-bar and pay for labor to build a wall in front of his house and doing so offer greater security for his son and wife.

loans.use: to invest in cider blocks, sand, cement, re-bar and pay for labor to construct a wall in front of his house.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en: Albina started her business a few years ago with her own working capital. Her business is selling rice. Her first effort was stalls, but in her neighborhood many people opened a stall, so now she changed her business, and she just sells rice. But she had a lot of difficulties because she did not have good management to run her business. So she has one idea of requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management, because she said with borrowed money she could count the income and expenditure in one day. She is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more rice to keep in her place, so that people who need to buy any rice can come to her home. She has been busy with her business and she is happy to do that.

loans.use: To buy rice.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Аличон опытный строитель на районе. Он строить дом и ремонтирует. У него 10 летный опыт работы. Аличон родился в семье дехкана. У него есть семья. Он живет вместе с женой и троими детьми на районе Бохтар. Детям 17, 13 и 5 лет. Его жена на районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Жене в работе помогает дети. Аличон себе построил дом, и хочет отремонтировать построенный дом. Ему не хватает денежных средств для купли цемент, алебастр, краски и другие стройматериалы. Аличон решил взять кредит и закончить ремонт.
texts.en:
Alijon is an experienced builder who builds and renovates houses.  He has been in this field of work for 10 years.  Born in a farmer's family, he is now a husband and a father. He lives with his wife and three children (ages 17, 13 and 5) in the Bohtar district of Tajikistan.  His wife works in agriculture.  The children help her with the farmwork.

Alijon has built a house for his family but he still needs to finish it.  However, he doesn't have enough money to buy cement, alabaster, paints, and other construction supplies.  For this reason, he has decided to take a loan to finish his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, alabaster, paints, and other construction supplies.

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en: Mutua is a married man and he has six children. He operates a retail business where he sells livestock. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more goats.

loans.use: to buy more goats.

loans.name: Muhammadjon

texts.ru: Мухаммадчон из города Конибодом. Ему 45 лет. Он женат и отец троих детей. Дети учатся в средней школе. Жена находится на заработках загранице. Она загранице занимается торговлей деятельности. Сам Мухаммадчон занимается оператором. Он снимает мероприятия, свадьбы и день рождения. Мухаммадчон работает один и все сделает сам.  После съемки он делает монтаж записи. 20 лет Мухаммадчон занимается оператором. Он хорошо справляется со своей работой. На данный момент Мухаммадчон не продвигает сою работу, по причине, что он болеет.  Ему нужно сделать операцию, чтобы вылечить. Он еще молод, и его жизнь впереди. Для операции у него нет денежных средств. Поэтому Мухаммадчон просит кредит. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему сохранить здоровье и жизнь. Мухаммадчон верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Muhammadjon is from the city of Konibodom in Tajikistan.  He is 45 years old, married, and the father of three children who all attend secondary school.  His wife is currently working abroad; she is involved in retail business.  Muhammadjon himself works as a video operator, filming events, weddings and birthdays.  He works alone and handles all aspects of his job by himself, from shooting his videos to the final montage.  He has been involved in this activity for 20 years and he does an excellent job.

At the moment, Muhammadjon is not working.  He is sick and needs to have surgery to get better.  He is a young man still, with many years of his life ahead of him.  He doesn't have enough money to pay for his own surgery.  For this reason, he is taking a loan which will help him to get his health and his life back.  Muhammadjon is confident that he will receive your support.

loans.use: to pay for his own surgery and get better.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 28-year-old, single guy who lives with his family in Salheye. He has his own business ‎repairing cars and works all day long as the main source of income for his family. He has a lot ‎of customers, which helps him to be able to earn a good salary to provide for his family.

Hasan is an example of the ambitious youth and now he is asking for a loan in order to ‎renovate his repair workshop for the wet and cold winter season. He hopes that this ‎loan will help him to be able to continue his work and wants to thank all of the lenders.‎

loans.use: to ‎renovate his repair workshop for the wet and cold winter season.

loans.name: Suna

texts.en:
Suna Hanım is married and a mother of two. She designs scarfs and jewellery at home, which she sell at stands. With the help of her third loan from Maya, she bought jewellery in bulk, with materials, beads and fabric. She aims to open her own jewellery design workshop.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Suna Hanım evli ve iki çocuk annesi. Evinde takı ve fular tasarımı yapıyor. Bu ürünlerinin satışını stantlarda yapıyor. Kendine ait tasarımları olan Suna Hanım Maya’dan 3. kredisini kullanıyor. Kredilerini takı malzemesi, boncuk ve kumaş alarak değerlendirdi. Suna Hanımın hedefi takı tasarım atölyesi açmak

loans.use: to buy jewellery materials, beads and fabric

loans.name: Amanvi  M.

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Amanvi est une femme âgée de 34 ans résidant à Adidogomè. Amanvi est une marchande de produits d’alimentations générales qui s’approvisionne de ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile. Amanvi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des paquets de sachets en plastiques en vue de bien revendre puis avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et aux charges quotidiennes éprouvées.
texts.en: Amanvi is married and the mother of four children.  She is 34 years old and she lives in Adidogomè.  She sells staple food products.  She stocks up at the market three times per month and then resells her goods in her own shop, at home.  She is taking this loan to buy boxes of plastic bags.  Her goal is to increase her sales and stock of goods.  She also wants to maximize her profits so that she can help her husband take care of the children's education and the day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy 15 boxes of plastic bags.

loans.name: Rubindi Parents & Ibanda Preparatory Schools

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Frank. He is the Director of Rubindi Parents Primary & Ibanda Preparatory Primary Schools, two mixed schools in the rural area of Ibanda with 650 students each. Rubindi Parents & Ibanda Preparatory Schools have each requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the schools to purchase a UV water treatment system with 750-liter tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

The schools will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Frank ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Rwentobo  School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Vincent. He is the Head Teacher of Rwentobo High School, a mixed school in the rural area of Ntungamo with 1,000 students. Rwentobo School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Rwentobo School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Vincent ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance, by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 38-year-old, woman with four children. She owns and operates a small business, making and selling clothespins to earn a living.
‎
Malak has requested a loan to buy the materials, paint colors, and clippers and what she needs ‎to help her produce more products. She will expand her business using her profits.

loans.use: to buy the materials, paint colors, and clippers.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Sra. María Elizabeth casada con tres hijos pequeños se dedica a la venta de agua de coco con su carrito,  ambula  por diferentes lugares de la ciudad ofreciendo este producto que tiene buena aceptación en la población, ya que ella explica que tiene muchas propiedades nutritivas y medicinales, a raíz de la enfermedad de su marido que tenía problemas hepáticos  que lo dejo postrado en cama sin poder hacer nada, la Sra. María Elizabeth se dedicó a trabajar sola para mantener a su familia, conto su dilema a unas amistades que le comentaron del agua de coco y que intentara con el mismo para ayudar a su esposo, así lo hizo y ha visto la mejoría de su esposo gracias al cuidado y al agua de coco, de ahí que comenzó su venta, si le ayudo a ella porque no ayudar a otras personas dice la Sra. María. 
La señora Maria Elizabeth requiere el préstamo para la compra de otro carrito y compra de insumos para la venta de tal manera mejorar su ventas e ingresos para su familia
texts.en:
Maria Elizabeth, married with three young children, works in the sale of coconut water. With her cart, she walks through different parts in the city, offering this product that has great approval among the population, because she explains that it has many nutricional and medicinal properties. 

Due to her husband's illness, who had liver problems that left him bedridden without being able to do anything, Maria Elizabeth dedicated herself to working alone to provide for her family. She related her dilemma to a few friends, who mentioned coconut water and that she should try it to help her husband. That's what she did and she has seen the improvement of her husband thanks to the care and the coconut water. Thus, she began her sales. If it helped her, why should it not help other people, says Maria.

Maria Elizabeth needs the loan to buy another cart and to buy supplies to improve her sales and income for her family.

loans.use: to buy another car and to buy supplies to sell coconut juice to improve her income for her family.

loans.name: Mustapher

texts.en:
Mustapher is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as being honest. Mustapher operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, cooking fat and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as being inadequate working capital. 

Mustapher will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, salt and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have improved living standards. 

This is Mustapher's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. Mustapher will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking fat, salt and other items to sell

loans.name: Laith

texts.en:
Laith is a 23-year-old single man from Jarash city. He tried to work along side his studies, but he ‎could not find a suitable job. Currently he is a student in university majoring accounting, and he ‎wants to complete his studies and find good job.‎

Laith is a member of a big family, which causes his family financial strain, and his father ‎cannot cover the education fees on top of the household expenses. Therefore Laith applied for an education loan to help him pay the university fees for this ‎semester, and which will also help him to buy the books that he needs.‎

loans.use: to cover his university fees.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is 23 years old and is studying for a degree in business administration. She lives in ‎Ajloun with her family, including her 5 siblings. She is working really hard to get ‎ahead and to grow. In addition to getting her education, she is working to pay for her daily expenses and ‎help her family in their household expenses.

She has requested this loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue her ‎education, and achieve her dreams.‎

loans.use: To pay for her university fees

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Linet will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to expand business and have more employees within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Rabea

texts.en:
Rabea is a single man living in a sector in Jordan called Salheye. He is studying to get his ‎bachelor degree in special education, and he is now in his second year.

The income that ‎comes from his father’s job is income for his family that consists of five members. ‎Recently, his father is facing some problems that lead Rabea to apply for an educational ‎loan to help him cover his semester fees. Rabea's future plan is to work in the same field.‎

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Buli's Group

texts.en:
Buli, 35, standing on the extreme left-hand side in the photograph, is a charismatic, enterprising and hardworking lady from Balugaon, Odisha, India. She has a family of four. Buli's husband is a truck driver by profession and is the only breadwinner in the family.

Buli hails from a low-income household and has access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to a toilet, she faces a lot of problems, as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself. She no more finds it feasible enough to depend on an open field for defecation and urination.

Therefore, Buli, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet, incorporate water pipes and install a commode in it. Access to basic sanitation will consequently result in safety, improved health, medical savings, and increased productivity.

Buli is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet, incorporate water pipes and install a commode in it.

loans.name: Rubaare School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Jeninah. She is the head teacher of Rubaare Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Ntungamo with 800 students.

Rubaare School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Rubaare School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jeninah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 22-year-old university student. He is a third-year student studying accounting and ‎business law. He lives in Mafraq with his family that consists of seven members, including his ‎parents. His father is retired, and he appears with Khaled in the photo.
‎
Khaled is hardworking and always spends his free time looking for a good job. He would like ‎to request a loan because he does not have enough finances to pay his university fees.

This ‎loan will help him to cover his university fees and graduate successfully. After graduation, ‎Khaled hopes to have a proper job, and then he will be able to save enough money to help ‎his big family.‎

loans.use: To pay for his university fees

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a smart man. He is not married and lives with his parents. Yousef is a third-year ‎student majoring in computer information system. He reads a lot of books and usually goes to ‎the library.

His parents are proud of him because he is clever and a hardworking man. His aim ‎is to be a high quality specialist and to work in the same field to get experience; perhaps he ‎will be a scientist someday.‎
‎
Yousef now needs your financial support because his parents do not have money to pay for ‎his fees; therefore, he asked for a loan to pay his education fees.‎

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
His name is Gil. He is 45 years old, single, and from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He has his own grocery store that also sells school supplies. Having a close-knit family, he also assists his grand nieces/nephews in their schooling.

He trusts you could lend him an amount of PHP 50,000 to pay for more grocery items such as bread, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries, pad papers, bond papers, cartolinas, pencils, ink, etc., to sell at retail prices at his store.

He is thankful that there is Kiva and its lenders who support small businessmen like him. His earnings cover his daily sustenance.

He aims to expand his store so he could help support his grand nieces and nephews in their studies. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for school supplies and grocery items to sell at his store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Foday. He is married and has two children, aged 7 and 4 years.

In 2011, Foday established his household furniture business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his livelihood to take good care of his family and parents.

His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are the general public. Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Foday requires a loan in order to buy more TV stands, plasma stands, bedroom sets and flower vases for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him to maximize profit and to cater to more customers.

In the future, Foday plans to make huge savings during his monthly payment so as to enable him to do much more business. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy more TV stands, plasma stands, bedroom sets and flower vases for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cartons of milk, sugar, baby milk, and Ovaltine.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 28 years old and single. In 2012, Mohamed established his food market. He began his business because he wanted to improve himself. Working seven days a week, for 13 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL a month.

Mohamed is requesting a loan for 5,000,000 SLL, which he will use to buy more drinks, provisions, water, sugar, etc. to sell. In the future, he plans to build a bigger shop and to become an international businessman. His family livelihood has improved greatly with the help of his last loan.

Mohamed extends his sincere thanks and appreciation to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks, provisions, water, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Saidu. He is married with two children, who are 15 and 10 years old.

In 1994, Saidu established his business selling various goods and foods, including pure water, biscuits, lunch meat, sardines, and milk. He started his business because he was trained as a businessman. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he is able to earn approximately 1,500,000 SLL every month.

He is now seeking a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Saidu would like this loan in order to purchase more inventory for resale, and would use any remaining money on transportation needs. The loan has helped Saidu a lot by supporting his children’s education and he provided more meals for the home. In the future, Saidu would still like to expand his business and to ensure that his children are educated. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory (e.g. water, biscuits, lunch meat, sardines, and milk) for his business.

loans.name: Kampala Model School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Addy. He is the head teacher of Kampala Model Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kyebando in Kampala with 400 students.

Kampala Model School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kampala Model School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Addy ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Abubakarr

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Abubakarr. He is married and has two children, aged 13 and 9. In 1999, Abubakarr established his soft drinks, beer, and pure water business. He began his business because he wanted to improve his living standards and take care of his family. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Abubakarr requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, beer, and pure drinking water for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL.

In the future, Abubakarr plans to buy a plot of land to build a store for his business, and educate his children up to college level.

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, beer, and pure drinking water for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as energetic. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, bread, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

Alice will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice and other items. She hopes that in the future she will have better living conditions. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice and other items

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is married and has ten children. He lives in Nairobi’s Kiambiu area where he runs his rental units business.

He recently saw Fresh Life toilets at his home area in Kiambiu and was interested by the cleanliness since he is a chairperson of a political movement in the area. His family and tenants use a pit latrine that is poorly maintained.

Francis is determined to join the Fresh Life movement to provide a clean sanitary toilet option for his tenants, family, and the people in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: Maria Benedicta

texts.en:
“With the grace of God, we will be able to put up a big piggery, a profitable grocery store, and a viable water refilling station. We will finish our dream house and our children will live a better life.”

Maria Benedicta, 50, from Bacolod City in Negros Occidental, speaks this phrase with faith as she shares her aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She has been a dedicated member of the organization for many years, where she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and sharing of life experiences.

Maria Benedicta is married to Wenefredo, a driver, and they have five children. The youngest of them is still studying in college while the older ones are already working or starting their own families, relieving the couple of their huge educational expenses. Maria Benedicta is now working towards the full progress of her business. She raises hogs at the back of their house, operates a variety store, and distributes mineral water in their community.

At present, she needs to buy additional piglets and feed, which is why she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will also add supplies to her store inventory and buy more gallons of mineral water. With these, she can increase her income and boost her savings. She would really appreciate it if you could extend your kind support to her. She prays that more blessings will come your way.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed, and to add supplies to her store's inventory.

loans.name: Black Hall Road Group

texts.en:
Kaprr is a member of Black Hall Road solidarity group (he is standing in the middle of the group photo). Kaprr has been selling clothing for the past five years. He uses the proceeds of his business to pay for his children’s education and to provide a livelihood for his family. He has been able to buy a piece of land from the savings he made from his business.

Kaprr and the other group members of Black Hall Road solidarity group are requesting their first loan. Kaprr and his group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Kaprr will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL which he will use to purchase more jeans, ladies dresses, etc. for his business.

Kaprr is thirty-nine years, married and has three children aged 9, 7 and 2. He hopes that his business will continue to exist so that he can save enough money to build a dwelling house and educate his children well.

Kaprr and his group members thank you for financing their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more jeans, ladies dresses, etc

loans.name: Yeimy Beatriz

texts.es: Yeimy de 25 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en donde ha vivido desde que nació. Vive al lado de sus padres y hermanos. Ella en busca de ayudar con la economía de su hogar, presta sus servicios domésticos en una vivienda que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad, además tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de leche, esto lo realiza con el objetivo de mejorar su condición de vida. Su vivienda es humilde y ha sido construida con láminas y madera que con el paso del tiempo se han deteriorado y lo que les dificulta tener tranquilidad en su hogar, más que todo por las lluvias tan fuertes que caen. Es por esto que Yeimy solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos, madera y pago de mano de obra para cambiar el techo de su vivienda. Y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y poder tener una vida mejor y más tranquila.
texts.en:
25-year-old Yeimy lives in her own home. She has lived there since she was born. She lives with her parents and siblings. Wanting to contribute to the household economy, she does domestic work in a home located near her community. She also has a small business that consists of selling milk. She does this work with the goal of improving her quality of life.

Her home is not fancy; it has been built with metal sheets and wood, which have deteriorated over time. This makes it difficult for them to live in peace, especially because of the heavy rain. For this reason, Yeimy is requesting a loan from FUSAI in order to buy building materials (metal sheets, nails, and wood) and pay workers to change the roof of her home, thereby improving her quality of life and enabling her to have a better and more peaceful life.

loans.use: to pay workers and buy metal sheets, nails, and wood to change the roof of her home

loans.name: Kolatick Family Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu is a fifty-four-year old businesswoman. She is a member of Kolatick Family Solidarity Group, which has eight members. In the group picture, Kadiatu is in the middle. Kadiatu was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people.

Kadiatu has been in the cooked-food business for the past 33 years. She opens her business six days a week from 8am to 6pm.

Kadiatu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profit she gets from the business.

Kadiatu and her group members need a total of 12,000,000 SLL of which Kadaitu is entitled to 1,500,000 SLL, which she will use to buy 1 additional bag of rice, cooking oil, palm oil, etc., for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Kaditu is married and has four children age 29, 24, 19 and 1 years; three are school aged.

In the future, Kadiatu plans to generate more money to provide for her children's university education. She believes educating her children at university will better the lives of her family.
Kadiatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 1 additional bag of rice, cooking oil, palm oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business by hiring more employees, purchasing more equipment, and increasing advertising and marketing.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants à charge. Agée de 24 ans, Akouvi est une femme dynamique et courageuse  qui vend des habits pour enfants en circulant les quartiers environnant afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Akouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines des habits pour enfants afin de financer son commerce et trouver un bon rendement pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire des enfants dès cette rentrée.
texts.en:
Akouvi is twenty-four years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and is dynamic and courageous. She earns a good living selling children's clothing on foot in her local area. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market.

Akouvi is requesting this loan to increase her working capital and buy dozens of outfits for children to improve her profits. This will provide for her day-to-day needs and help her husband pay school fees for the children for this academic year.

loans.use: to buy 2 dozen clothing outfits for children.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Rosario de 41 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de 20 años, sus hijas de 4 y 14 años de edad y su compañero de vida. Ella maneja un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, el cual administra en su vivienda, además se dedica a vender leche y gracias a ello puede obtener los ingresos económicos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos, así también su compañero de vida le ayuda a mantener la economía del hogar. Rosario habita en casa propia la cual ha sido construida con láminas y madera, en ella ha vivido prácticamente toda su vida y con el paso del tiempo se ha deteriorado y necesita reparaciones. Pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, clavos, madera y pago de mano de obra para reparar el techo de su hogar y de esta manera poder estar más tranquilos y así poder ofrecerles una mayor seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en: 41-year-old Rosario lives with her 20-year-old son, her 14-year-old daughter, her 4-year-old daughter, and her partner. She manages a small business that sells tortillas. She runs this business in her home. She also sells milk, which enables her to obtain the necessary income to meet the basic needs of her children. Her partner also helps her with the household finances. Rosario lives in her own house, which is made out of metal sheets and wood. She has lived there for nearly her whole life. It has deteriorated over the course of time and needs repairs; however, she does not have the money she needs for this, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy building supplies (metal sheets, nails, and wood) and pay workers to repair the roof of her home. In this way, she and her family can live in peace and her children will be safer.

loans.use: to buy building materials (metal sheets, nails, and wood) and pay workers to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: Hamulton Lane Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Rugiatu is a 33-year-old business woman. She is a member of Hamulton Lane solidarity group, which has five members. (Rugiatu is in the middle of the group photo).

Six years ago, Rugiatu established her slippers business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys study materials, and provides food for her children. She opens her business six days in a week from 8am to 6pm.

Hamulton Lane group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Rugiatu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy two cartons of slippers to add to her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Rugiatu is married with two children aged seven and four, and both are school going children. In the future, she plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes that educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Rugiatu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of slippers to add to her business.

loans.name: Odilon

texts.en:
The photo above shows Odilon selling snack items such as bread, rice cake, and coffee in his food stall located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. He also has a small table in front where he displays some used clothes for sale. He embarked on this business as an additional income-generating venture for his family. Similarly, his wife, Armina, makes a living through direct selling of personal and home care products.

The profit derived from Odilon’s business is quite limited due to his small capital. He yearns to sell more snack items such as hot noodles, varieties of bread, cookies, chips, and beverages. He prays for PHP 8,000 supplementary capital to buy these items plus bundles of used clothes for sale. His anticipated profit combined with his wife’s income will ease their daily expenditures, monthly billings for utilities, and their youngest child’s college expenses. They have successfully sustained the schooling of their eldest who is already working as of now.

Odilon prays for good health, better living conditions and a happy life for his whole family. He is an inspiration to his co-fellowship members at CCT who regularly meet every week to reflect on God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase cup noodles, varieties of bread, cookies, chips, and beverages along with bundles of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Affiavi  Lucie

texts.fr: Affiavi est une femme mariée âgée de 44 ans résidante à Adidogomé. Mère de trois enfants, Affivi prépare du riz au gras qu’elle revend à  la devanture de son domicile. Affiavi s’approvisionne du nécessaire trois fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz et des tas de condiments. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Affiavi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Affiavi is forty-four years old, married and mother to three children. She lives in Adidogomé and prepares and sells rice dishes from the front of her house. She buys her supplies three times a month from the market.

Affiavi is requesting this loan to buy sacks of rice and food ingredients. She will use her earnings to improve her business, provide a better standard of living for her children and pay for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of rice and 2 loads of food ingredients.

loans.name: Top Care School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Charles. He is the Head Teacher of Top Care Junior School, a mixed school with 850 students in the urban area of Bujjuko in Wakiso. Top Care School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Top Care School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Charles ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, and will increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Abra   Essenam

texts.fr: Agée de 25 ans, Abra est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge à Adidogomè. Abra prépare de la bouillie faite à base du mil pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Abra s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Abra demande ce prêt pour commander des sacs de mil en vue de mieux revendre puis gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Abra is twenty-five years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and prepares and sells millet porridge. Her customers are very happy with the quality of her dishes. She buys her supplies three times a month from the market and sells her porridge from a small shack in front of her house.

Abra is requesting this loan to buy sacks of millet to increase her sales and improve her profits. This will pay for the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of millet.

loans.name: Sarah Ladies Group

texts.en:
Aminata is a 23-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of “Sara Ladies” Solidarity Group, which includes four women. (See the group picture; Aminata is on the left). Aminata was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of her wealth of experience in managing people.

Aminata has been in the slippers business for the past six years. She opens her business six days a week from 8am to 7pm.

Aminata established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from the business.

Aminata and her group members need a total of 4,800,000 SLL, of which Aminata is entitled to Le 1,200,000 SLL, which she will use to buy additional cartons of slippers etc. for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Aminata is married and has two children who are 10 and 7 years old and are school-going children.

In the future, Aminata plans to generate more money to provide for her children's university education. She believes educating her children to university will better the lives of her family.

Aminata and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional cartons of slippers, etc.

loans.name: Afi Ahonkonba

texts.fr: Avec quatre enfants à sa charge, Afi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé pour exercer ses activités. Agée de 37 ans, Afi est une marchande de friperies. Afi s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et les revendent en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Afi demande ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de pantalons pour dames en vue de bien revendre afin de gagner une marge bénéficiaire assez élevée pour pouvoir couvrir les charges quotidiennes dont elle éprouve et veiller à ce que ses enfants soient dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Afi is thirty-seven years old, married and has four children in her care. She lives and works in Adidogomé, and sells second-hand clothing. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and then sells them on foot in her local area.

Afi is requesting this loan to buy dozens of pairs of trousers for women to improve her sales. Her aim is to increase her profits enough to cover her day-to-day needs and ensure a better standard of living for her children.

loans.use: to buy 8 dozen pairs of trousers for women.

loans.name: Independent Day Group

texts.en:
Adama is a member of Independent Day. She is married with one child who is 12 years old and is a school-going child. (See the group picture; Adama is in the middle).

Fifteen years ago, Adama established her provisions business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells 6 days per week from 10am to 6pm.

Adama plans to use the loan to buy two cartons of milk, three bags of sugar, cocoa etc. for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account, which will be used in paying her children school fees.

Adama and her group members need a loan totaling 6,000,000 SLL of which Adama is entitled to 1,200,000 SLL
.
Adama plans to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life. Adama and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of milk, three bags of sugar, cocoa etc.

loans.name: Sodoga  Adjoavi

texts.fr: Sodoga est âgée de 37 ans et est une femme mariée. Sodoga vit avec ses quatre enfants à charge à Tokoin où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du maïs pour ses consommateurs qui en trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Sodoga s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs en vue de mieux revendre puis de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire et ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et bien réorganiser son commerce.
texts.en:
Sodoga is thirty-seven years old, married and has four children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and sells maize porridge to customers who are very happy with the quality of her food. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market.

Sodoga is requesting this loan to buy many bowls of maize to increase her sales. Her improved profits will allow her to provide for the education of her children and reorganise her business.

loans.use: to buy 60 bowls of maize.

loans.name: Essi   Elise

texts.fr: Essi est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Avec un enfant à charge, Essi est une revendeuse d’ignames frit qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Essi sollicite ce prêt pour commander la calebasse d’ignames et des litres d’huile. Essi désire gagner  plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide à son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées dans son foyer.
texts.en:
Essi is forty-two years old, married and has one child in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and sells fried yam from the front of her home. She buys her supplies three times a month from the market.

Essi is requesting this loan to buy yams and litres of oil. She would like to increase her earnings so she can help her husband provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy 1 load of yams and 8 litres of oil.

loans.name: Dénise  Afi

texts.fr: Dénise est une femme mariée âgée de 26 ans qui vit avec deux enfants à charge. Dénise est une revendeuse de condiments  habitant à Tokoin. Dénise achète ses marchandises trois fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers. Dénise sollicite l’octroi de ce prêt pour commander des tas de piment en vue de bien revendre et avoir un bénéfice pour aider son mari à bien organiser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Dénise is twenty-six years old, married and has two children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and sells food ingredients. She buys her supplies three times a month from the market and sells them on foot in her local area.

Dénise is requesting this loan to buy chillies to increase her sales. Her profits will help her husband pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy 1 quantity of chillies.

loans.name: Ameyo  Mawuyanya

texts.fr: Mariée et  âgée de 51 ans, Ameyo est une femme qui vit à Tokoin avec trois enfants à charge. Ameyo est une revendeuse des oignons qui s’approvisionnent deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Vue les besoins de sa clientèle, Ameyo sollicite ce crédit pour commander des paniers d’oignons en vue de bien revendre puis de satisfaire aux demandes de ses clients et gagner plus de profit; ce qui pourra l’aider à mieux épargner et aider son mari dans les dépenses du foyer et soutenir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ameyo is fifty-one years old, married and has three children in her care. She lives in Tokoin and sells onions. She buys her supplies twice a month from the market and then sells them from her home and in the local area.

Ameyo is requesting this loan to meet the demands of her customers and buy baskets of onions to increase her sales. Her improved profits will help her husband with the expenses of their household and will pay school fees for their children. She will also be able to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy baskets of onions.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La socia  Jacqueline se sigue dedicando al trabajo como docente de un colegio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la sociao por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un colegio. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar una cocina para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jacquelina continues to work as a teacher at a school. She works from 8am to 2pm and, through this work, she wants to move forward.

Jacquelina's dream is to own her own school. Jacquelina is applying for this loan in order to buy a cooker for her house.

Jacquelina is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a cooker for her house.

loans.name: Carlos Claudio

texts.es:
