Carlos es un hombre de 39 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 9 años y una hija de 4 años, y su negocio es la carpintería.
Él es buen padre, constante y muy emprendedor. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘alto lima’ considerado,  uno de los barrios más poblados, donde diariamente se encuentran los idiomas Aymará, quechua y castellano.
Carlos es de tez morena, cabello negro corto y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa de ladrillo propiedad de la familia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la carpintería, él fabrica muebles de dormitorio como, camas, mesas de noche, sillas y otros, “aprendí el oficio de mi padre, luego me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con la experiencia en el rubro, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para la compra de madera. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio, él desea comprar madera por mayor para fabricar muebles. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Carlos solicita un préstamo para comprar madera para fabricar muebles.
texts.en:
Carlos is 39 years old, married and has a nine-year-old son and a four-year-old daughter. He has a carpentry business.

Carlos is a good father; he is persevering and enterprising. His business is in the Alto Lima area, considered to be one of the most populated barrios. Here Aymara, Quechua and Spanish are all spoken.

Carlos has dark skin, and short black hair. He is thin. His native language is Aymara but he also speaks Spanish. Carlos shares his life with his wife, who works at the same business as he does, and his children, who attend school. The family lives in a brick house, which they own, and which has basic services.

Carlos has a carpentry workshop. He produces bedroom furniture such as beds, bedside tables, chairs and more.

He says, "I learned the trade from my father and then went independent".

One strong-point of Carlos' business is that he has experience in the field. What is not so good is that Carlos lacks the capital to buy wood.

Carlos' dream is stabilise his business. He wants to buy wood in bulk in order to build furniture. This is Carlos' first loan with the organisation in the five years that he has had his business.

For the above reasons, Carlos is applying for a loan to buy wood in bulk in order to build furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood in bulk in order to build furniture.

loans.name: Balvina Elias

texts.es: La señora Balvina de 56 años de edad, ella es originaria de San Martin, desde hace varios años ella se ha dedica a la crianza de animales de corral, como pollos patos y cerdos, ella ya a obtenido varios creditos en Kiva y su negocio a prosperado gracias a los créditos obtenidos, en esta oportunida ella solicita nuevamente otro crédito para comprar mas animales para la crianza ya que la epoca de fin de año se acerca y nececita invertir para satisfacer las nececidades de sus clientes, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
Balvina, 56, is from San Martin and for several years has been raising barnyard animals such as chickens, ducks and pigs. She has taken out several Kiva loans and her business is prospering because of them.

The new loan she is requesting is to buy more animals to raise because the year end holiday season is approaching and she needs to satisfy customer needs, so she hopes to receive the loan.

loans.use: to buy barnyard animals to raise.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es: Mirna de 41 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 16 años de edad y demás integrantes de su familia. Mirna es madre soltera, es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Desde hace varios años se dedica a la administración de una tienda en su localidad, además se dedica a la venta de leche y es así como mantiene la economía de su hogar. Mirna solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena y cerámica para mejorar el piso de su vivienda y de esta manera mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna, 41, lives in her own house with her 16-year-old daughter and other members of her family. She is a single, hard-working mom who is dedicated to the family. For several years she has been working as an accountant for a store in her town. She also sells milk to earn extra income for the household.

Mirna is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy cement, sand and tile to improve the floor of her house and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and tile to improve the floor of her house.

loans.name: Alnibal

texts.es:
Alnibal con 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Callacyuc,provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Alnibal se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, con experiencia en el rubro hace 10 años. Solicita préstamo para compra de abonos y para invertir en el mantenimiento de su finca. De esta manera obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Alnibal es socio recurrente para nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa. A manejado créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Alnibal, 37, lives with his common-law wife and children in the district of Callacyuc, province of Cutervo in the department of Cajamara, Peru. The locals here work mainly in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.

Alnibal works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, and has been in the trade for ten years. He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for maintenance of his plantation. This is to increase his profit.

Alnibal is a returning customer of the Edpyme Alternativa financial institution. He has taken out previous loans that he has paid back in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and provide maintenance for his plantation.

loans.name: Glandy Inaseth

texts.es:
Glandy, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer innovadora, no logró estudiar porque desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura, está acompañada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, viven juntos con dos de sus hijos, de los cuales el menor está estudiando y el mayor trabaja como empleado en una quesera cercana de su casa.

Glandy, se dedica al oficio de destazar, ella compra cerdos los destaza en el patio de su casa y posteriormente se dedica a vender su carne con sus vecinos, tiene un año dedicándose a dicha actividad; quien la motivó fue una vecina que cría cerdos, porque le dijo que entre sus vecinos no había ninguno que se dedicará a ello y por lo tanto sería una buena oportunidad para triunfar.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una partida de cerdos que le venden y a un buen precio, no quiere dejar ir esta oportunidad.

Glandy, sueña con mejorar su casa y contruir un pequeño corredor que le de más vistosidad a su casa.
texts.en:
Glandy, 36, is an innovative woman who was unable to get an education because she worked in agriculture with her parents. Her husband is a farmer and they live with their two children. The youngest attends school and the eldest works at a cheese factory near the home.

Glandy works as a butcher and raises pigs in her backyard. She sells meat to her neighbors and has been in business for a year after being encouraged by a neighbor who raises pigs that said there was no butcher in the neighborhood so it would be a good opportunity for success.

The loan will be used to buy a batch of pigs she has been offered at a good price. She does not want to pass up the opportunity.

Glandy dreams of improving her house by building a small porch to make it more attractive.

loans.use: to buy a batch of pigs she is being offered at a good price.

loans.name: Remedio

texts.en:
Remedio is 43 years old and married with 3 children aged 20, 19 and 10 years. He is a hardworking entrepreneur.

Remedio is an ambulant plasticware vendor. He started this business when he got laid-off due to recession. To provide for his family he decided to sell plasticware by being an ambulant vendor in his community. At first, he stocked just a few items like pails, plastic basins, plastic dippers and hangers. He decided to continue the business because the sales were better than if he was to put up a stall and wait for the customers to buy. He also added more items to further increase his income.

Today Remedio still ambulates plasticware and through his business he is able to support the education of his children and provide for the needs of his family. One of his children has already graduated and is now working in a company. Furthermore he has also purchased a motorcycle and customised it to be used in his ambulating business.

Remedio still has 2 more children to support and still needs to provide for his family.

Remedio is requesting a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to buy plastic dippers, laundry baskets, pails, tubs, shoe racks and hangers to sell to his customers.

Remedio is hopeful that with the additional loan he can add additional items to increase his income as he caters to the demand of his customers.

Remedio's dream is to see all his children finish their education and to provide a better future for them.

loans.use: to buy plastic dippers, laundry baskets, pails, tubs, shoe racks and hangers to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena con 57 años, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Lorena se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos,pollos, cuyes y cerdos, desde hace varios años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y comida para estos, lo cuál le facilitará seguir trabajando y de esa manera seguir obteniendo sus propios ingresos.

Lorena no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio nuevo para nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Lorena, 57 years old, lives with her partner in the Nueva Arica district of the Chiclayo province in Peru. The residents there mostly work in agriculture and ranching.

Lorena has worked for several years in raising and selling small animals such as ducks, chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She is applying for this loan to buy animals and food for the animals, which will allow her to continue to work and generate her own income.

This is Lorena's first loan. She is a new member of our financial institution Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy animals and food for the animals.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, pero su pareja ya no trabaja porque le han detectado problemas en un riñón desde hace 2 años y con él no tiene hijos; y los que tuvo fue con un matrimonio anterior, el cual no resultó bien.

Leonor, desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en la agricultura en los campos de algodón, realizando todas las labores correspondientes; sin embargo también se han dedicado al engorde de cerdos en el patio de su casa, esta actividad las viene realizando desde hace 28 años, tiene un buen número de cerditos y a la vez tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, la cual aprovecha para vender “golosinas” a los empleados de una quesera contiguo a su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar cerdos, para una pequeña granja y para surtir con mercadería su pequeña tienda, para así satisfacer la demanda de clientes que cada día crece más.

Leonor, sueña con llegar a tener una granja más grande de cerdos.
texts.en:
Leonor, aged 57, is a very hard-working woman. She studied up to fourth grade and has a partner, but her partner has not worked since the discovery of a kidney problem two years ago. She has no children with him and had children from a previous marriage that did not work out.

Since she was young, Leonor's parents taught her to do agricultural work in the cotton fields, carrying out all corresponding tasks; however, she has also been working at raising pigs in the courtyard of her house. She has been doing this for 28 years, has a good number of piglets and also runs a small shop from her house, which she uses to sell sweets to the employees of the neighbouring cheese-maker.

The loan will be used to buy pigs for a small farm and to supply her small shop with merchandise, in order to meet customer demand, which is growing every day.

Leonor dreams of having a larger pig farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs for a small farm and to supply her small shop with merchandise.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 48-year-old man. He is happily married to a loving wife with whom he has a son. This son is now a grown man who lives on his own. Daniel is proud of his son and the way he has been moving ahead on his life. Daniel claims that his son is his (and his wife's) biggest achievement. 

Daniel gets some money from his son who likes to contribute to his parents income, but Daniel has a huge dream, and he works hard every day to achieve it. He drives his taxi around the city for more than 12 hours per day. He makes a living out of it and saves some money for his dream which is to move out of the city and live in a town close to the beach in the southern part of the country.

Daniel is always motivated to work, but lately he has been struggling to work because he needs to improve his taxi. He needs to change some parts of it, to avoid as much pollution as possible and buy a new taximeter that the city government requires. To solve these issues he is applying for a 5,264 MXN loan at Kiva through Kubo, a financial institution and Kiva's field partner.

According to people who know Daniel who were interviewed by Kubo, he is an honest, really dedicated person, who is very responsible and loves what he does.

loans.use: to improve his taxi.

loans.name: Malu

texts.en: Malu is 30 years old and single. She runs and operates a convenience store in her village to earn a living. Malu requested for a loan to buy to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage and plastic bags to assist her in running her business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, a box of chicken, a sack of flour, a sack of rice, a box of tinned fish, a box of vegetable oil, a box of milk, a box of sausage and plastic bags.

loans.name: Aliitasi

texts.en: Aliitasi is a 28-year-old mother with 8 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Aliitasi requested for a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake and a shovel to help her run her business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake and a shovel.

loans.name: Vaoa

texts.en: Vaoa is a 40-year-old mother with 2 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Vaoa requested for a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake and a shovel to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake and a shovel.

loans.name: Heta

texts.en: Heta is a 25-year-old mother with 4 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Heta requested for a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel and chemicals, to help her run her business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en: Tofu is a Samoan citizen. She is 33 years old with 3 children. She runs a business of providing transportation services to people. She hopes to gain more profit to buy another taxi, but in order to do this, Tofu has requested for a loan to buy new windows, new wheels and an air conditioner in order to maintain provision of good services. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy new windows, new wheels and an air conditioner.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en: Akenese is a 22-year-old mother of 2 children. She runs a small business of selling taro in her village to earn a living. Akenese requested for a loan to buy taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer, to help her run her business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, chemicals and a backpack sprayer.

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a 30-year-old mother of 2 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Litia requested for a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, taro root seedlings and banana tube seedlings, to help her run her business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, chemicals, taro root seedlings and banana tube seedlings.

loans.name: Rasela

texts.en: Rasela is a Samoan citizen. She is a 30-year-old mother of 2 children. She runs a business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Rasela requested for a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel and chemicals, to help her run her business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel and chemicals.

loans.name: Taranaki

texts.en: Taranaki is a 22-year-old mother of one child. She runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Taranaki requested for a loan to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake and a shovel, to help her run her business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro root seedlings, banana tube seedlings, a wheelbarrow, a rake and a shovel.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is a 51-year-old mother of 5 children. She runs a business of selling tuna and toasted sandwiches in her community to earn a living. Ana requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers and butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. Ana became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, a box of canned fish (tuna), plastic bags, containers and butter.

loans.name: Mauai

texts.en: Mauai is a 31-year-old mother of 5 children. She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbages, eggplant, cucumbers) in her community to earn a living. Mauai requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots, to assist her to run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a water tank, a rake, a shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Jose Domingo

texts.es: Jose de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos y a buen precios por esa razon posee mucha clientela, se dedica a esa actividad desde hace 15 años y es asi como ha logrado salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y asi surtir su tienda con mas prodcutos y poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Jose is 46 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his partner.

Jose has a small shop in his home, where he sells a variety of products at good prices and has many customers. He has running this shop for 15 years and it allows him to move forward.

Jose is applying for a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, and more. He can thus stock up his shop with more goods and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, sweet breads, and more.

loans.name: Dúo Maranatha De Chimaltenango Group

texts.es: Dúo Maranatha de Chimaltenango, este grupo esta conformado por la señora Dorcas de 35 años de edad, ella se dedica a el alquiler de sillas mesas para ocaciones especiales como cumpleaños quinceaños bodas etc, gracias a su negocio ella a podido ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas sillas y mesas para agrandar mas su negocio esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The "Maranatha de Chimaltenango" Duo

One member of this group is 35-years-old Dorcas. She makes a living renting out chairs and tables for special occasions, such as birthday parties, birthdays for 15-year-olds (important in many Latin American countries), weddings and more.

Thanks to this business, Dorcas has been able to help her children with their education.

On this occasion Dorcas is applying for a loan in order to buy chairs and tables to rent out and expand her business.

Dorcas hopes that you can help with this loan.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables to rent out.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando is married and he is a businessman. He has a very high interest in doing business. He has been involving in business activities since a few years ago with his own working capital, and he did his best with it. He is earning good money but he still wants to improve the management of his business, and so he is taking a loan of 700 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional items to keep in his store including detergents, noodles, sardines, candies, milk, water, cigarettes, tea, biscuits, hand and body lotion, hair oils, soft drinks and other things to sell. He is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for him to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy detergents, noodles, sardines, candies, milk, water, cigarettes, tea, biscuits, hand and body lotion, hair oils, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Azucena Beatriz

texts.es:
Azucena, de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una zapatería, vive junto con él y sus dos hijos, de los cuales solo uno está yendo al kinder.

Azucena, desde que se graduó de bachillerato ha sido empleada en diferentes lugares, primero trabajó en la biblioteca de la escuela, posteriormente trabajó en algunas tiendas e incluso fue niñera también; en el primer trabajo formal que tuvo fue en una empresa de venta de celulares, ahí fue donde conoció al que es su esposo actual.- Posteriormente, tuvo que dejar el empleo porque no podían estar en la misma empresa, con el tiempo un señor la contrató para que vendiera productos lácteos, en un puesto cercano a su lugar de vivienda, lo cual ha venido desempeñando por 6 meses.

El préstamo que está solicitado es porque el señor dueño del negocio se va ir del lugar y ella quiere el préstamo para comprar el negocio de lácteos y para comprar crema, queso, quesillo y otros.

Azucena, sueña con llegar a crecer en su negocio de lácteos, de tal manera que pueda abrir más establecimientos y otra gente trabaje para ella.
texts.en:
Azucena is 24 years old and completed high school. She is married; her husband works in a shoe shop. Azucena lives with her husband and two children, one of whom attends nursery school.

Since completing high school, Azucena has worked in a number of places. First she worked in a school library before later working in a number of shops. She also worked as a nanny.

Her first formal job was selling mobile phones, and it was there that she met her husband. Later, Azucena had to leave her job as the couple could not work at the same business. After some, a man started to employ Azucena to sell dairy products at a stall near her home. She has been doing this work for six months.

Azucena is applying for this loan as the owner of the dairy business is leaving town and she wants to buy the business and buy cream, cheese, cottage cheese and other products.

Azucena dreams of expanding her dairy business so that she can open more shops and have other people working for her.

loans.use: to buy a dairy business and buy cream, cheese, cottage cheese, and more.

loans.name: Erdenesuvd

texts.en:
Erdenesuvd, 32 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a grocery store since 2013 and before this, she worked as a sales representative at a private firm. Her husband is security officer and during his day off renders taxi service for extra income. Their elder son goes to high school while their younger son stays at his grandma's home.

She is requesting a loan of 1750 USD to pay tuition fee as she is currently studying Business Administration at university. When she successfully graduates from her university, she can secure a high paying job and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees, where she is studying Business Administration

loans.name: Dana

texts.en:
Dana was somewhat of a dreamer when she was in her mid teens. She originally thought she would be a nurse, but in 1992, reality steered her life in a different direction.

She was obligated to go to a women’s training class. She spent two years learning how to sew women’s clothes. Afterwards, she sewed pieces for neighbors at home until she opened her shop in 2003. She started with only $70 worth of fabric and one machine.

In 2009, she moved to a new building to showcase more. However, the shop was looted after the earthquake and she was in a deep financial plight. Dana met with a Zafen agent, and she obtained a first loan that she fully repaid.

Now, she needs to seize the occasion to buy fabrics and sew for many clients she has.

loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of fabric to sew dresses and uniforms.

loans.name: Exilia

texts.en:
Thanks to the loan, Exilia has been able to generate profits to pay the school costs for her two children. Her business has grown of about 15%.

Exilia thanks her lenders and would like to renew the experience with them with a new loan. She will buy soft drinks and expand the food products array for more sales. Exilia also has hired one person to purchase and sell to customers.

loans.use: to purchase racks of beverages and food products.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nelida dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Saint-Felix

texts.en:
Saint-Felix has skills in grass planting, exterior design and detergent manufacturing. Last year, he designed one of the best known private universities in Port-au-Prince.

After losing his garden of tomatoes in the hurricane of 2007, Saint-Felix received training in June 2009 on biological fertilizers, ecological techniques, insect control and detergent manufacturing. As Haiti has only one plant of detergent manufacturing, the Haitian population, regardless of social class, consumes detergent coming from DR for the most part. Saint-Felix would like to reverse this trend and have the population consume homemade detergent.

Saint-Felix's strength relies on the laundry and household cleaning detergents he produces. Actually, he has started to make a difference in the suburb of Petionville where he sells his products. If Saint-Felix finds more capital, he will increase his detergent production by 60% and also sell natural flowers. Moreover, Saint-Felix plans to hire three young people he trained in the field. Therefore, a loan is requested through Zafen to support him.

loans.use: to increase his detergent production and purchase 150 natural flowers to resell.

loans.name: Magdalyn

texts.en:
Magdalyn, 33, is a single woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Magdalyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Magdalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 41 years old and married. She has five children.

Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. Marissa has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan.

Marissa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Meminda

texts.en:
Meminda works hard to support her family. Meminda is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Meminda has been in this business for six years now.

Meminda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Meminda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a very industrious woman living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods.

She is a 30-year old married woman with three young children. Her husband has a job and can help defray the family's daily expenses.

She would like to seek ways to improve her way of life. She would like to earn other income to be able to provide her family with proper nutrition and better living conditions.

Rosalie has requested a loan to buy assorted stocks for the store and purchase a piglet for a hog-raising start-up. This will enable her to maintain the inventory and attract potential customers to shop as well as start to raise quality hogs to improve her income.

In the future, she is determined to manage both sources of living for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store and purchase a piglet for a hog-raising start-up.

loans.name: Seira

texts.en:
Seira is a 43-year-old mother with four children.

She runs a small business selling pancakes, buns and pork cakes in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than two years.

Seira requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags to enable her to run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, a sack of sugar, yeast, a fry pan, a wooden spoon, a bottle of vegetable oil, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza es una habitante del municipio de Bogotá, ejemplo de superación para muchas mujeres responsables del sustento de su familia, ella es madre de dos hijos y enviudó, tras el fallecimiento de su cónyuge y en medio de esta difícil situación de la vida,  encontró en el comercio de prendas de vestir una oportunidad para emprender nuevos horizontes para continuar solventando las necesidades de sus hijos.  Esperanza cuenta con treinta años de sus 58 años de edad dedicada a esta actividad y sus ventas las ejerce generalmente los fines de semana realizándoles visitas a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son empleados del ministerio de salud.  En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una nueva colección de prendas de vestir y calzado, puesto que se aproxima la mejor temporada del año. Su meta a futuro es mejorar su capital de inversión y nivel familiar está a la espera de la pensión de su cónyuge con la que mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a resident of the city of Bogotá, and an example of self-improvement for many women who are responsible for their family's support. She is the mother of two children and widowed. After her husband passed away and in the midst of this difficult life situation, she found an opportunity to explore new horizons in clothing sales, so she could continue to pay for her children's needs.

Thirty of Esperanza's 58 years have been devoted to this business, and she generally makes most of her sales on the weekends by visiting with her customers, who for the most part, are employees of the Department of Health.

Currently, she is applying for a loan, her first Kiva loan, financed through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a new collection of clothing items and shoes, because the best season of the year is approaching. Her goal for the future is to improve her capital investment and family status. She is waiting for her husband´s pension, which will help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothing items and shoes.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 49 years old, married, and has seven children. Five of her children are enrolled in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Vilma has a frozen food retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Vilma requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shirley is 39 years old and has two children who are presently in school.

Shirley has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks like body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Shirley has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like body lotion, perfume, beauty soap and oher personal care products

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 53 years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Nida has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe has been making knitted bamboo for many years. She's earning well from this activity. With this generated revenue, she was able to pay back her previous loan and support the needs of her 10 children. She is working hard in order to provide their household expenses.

Fe wants to improve her business. Recently she took a new loan to buy the materials needed such as bamboo. Fe's plan for the future is to save more money for the educational plan of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making knitted bamboo

location.town: P-2, SANTA ANA, ALORAN, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Sefako

texts.fr: Sefako est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère d’un enfant, Sefako prépare et vend du riz et s’approvisionne du nécessaire pour la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour commander des sacs de riz et le bidon d’huile, Sefako demande ce prêt pour en faire usage.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Sefako compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Sefako is a 28-year old married woman living in Tokoin. The mother of one child, Sefako prepares and sells rice. She obtains the necessary items for the preparation twice a month at the market and resells in front of her home. So as to order bags of rice and a barrel a oil, Sefako is requesting this loan for this use. With the resulting profit margin, Sefako intends to improve her sale offerings and promote her children's school education.

loans.use: to buy four bags of rice and one barrel of oil.

loans.name: Manuel Vicente

texts.es: Manuel es un emprendedor de 36 años de edad, habitante de Cartagena de Indias en donde reside con su familia en un popular barrio de esta ciudad y en su restaurante de comidas rápidas ha consolidado a una gran clientela que lo prefiere por las exquisiteces que prepara a buenos precios con la mejor calidad. Su principal motivación para iniciar este negocio fue la experiencia que tuvo al laborar durante seis años con un tío que tiene un negocio homologo al suyo y fue donde adquirió el conocimiento para su propio proyecto; conoció bases de datos de proveedores, cómo preparar las comidas rápidas y sobre todo el sazón, que incluye su toque secreto. El maneja una amplia gama de productos perros caliente, pizzas, hamburguesas, pollo asado y salchipapas, las cuales ofrece en su local todos los días de la semana, aunque los fines de semana se incrementa la demanda de clientes y son los mejores días de venta.  En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en mesas, sillas, una carpa e insumos para las comidas, inversión que mejorará la imagen de su negocio e incrementará su capacidad. Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio y continuar unido con su familia y velar por su bienestar.
texts.en: Manuel is a 36-year-old entrepreneur, who lives in Cartagena de Indias where he lives with his family in a popular neighborhood in this city, and his fast food restaurant has garnered a good customer base which prefers it for the delicacies that he makes at good prices with better quality.  His primary motivation to begin this business was the experience he had while working for six years with an uncle who had a similar business to his and it was there that he got the knowledge for his own project. He learned the provider databases, how to prepare fast food, and above all the flavorings, which includes his secret touch. He manages a wide range of products such as hot dogs, pizza, hamburgers, roasted chicken and sausage with french fries, which he sells in his eatery every day of the week, although on the weekends, the demand increases and those are the best sales days. Currently, he is applying for a loan, his first Kiva loan which he is doing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in tables, chairs, an awning and supplies for his food, an investment which will improve his business's image and will increase its capacity. His goal is to continue growing in his business and continue with his family and looking out for their well-being.

loans.use: to invest in tables, chairs an awning and supplies for the food.

loans.name: Njakasoa Voahirana

texts.fr:
Njakasoa a 35 ans, elle est mariée. Son mari exerce le métier de chauffeur. Le couple a un enfant de 6 ans et qui est en classe de 11ème.
Elle dirige un magasin général  depuis 2012. Suite à un problème rencontré par son mari, l’épargne dont disposait la famille a été  utilisée pour résoudre des difficultés  financières par conséquent le stock des marchandises a diminué. Avant, en raison de l’absence d’électricité, la famille utilise les bougies. Des efforts ont été réalisés dans l’objectif de redémarrer l’activité : constitution de stock de produits, installation d’électricité dans le local où vit la famille. Actuellement, elle prévoit de développer l’activité. Le lieu est propice à l’activité. Le prêt sert à acquérir un réfrigérateur. Cet équipement lui permettra de diversifier les produits et de les conserver en cette période de saison sèche.
texts.en:
Njakasoa is 35 years old, she is married. Her husband is a driver. The couple have a 6 year old child who is in Year 11 [equivalent to first year of primary school].

Njakasoa has been managing a general store since 2012. After her husband encountered a problem, the family's savings were used to resolve financial difficulties and as a result the stock of merchandise has reduced. Before, because of lack of electricity, the family used candles. Efforts were made with the goal of restarting the activity: building a stock of products, installing electricity in the building where the family lives. Currently, she is planning to develop the activity. The area is suitable for this activity.

The loan will serve to acquire a refrigerator. This equipment will allow her to diversify her products and to store them during the dry season period.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, de 62 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, estudió hasta sexto grado, está felizmente casado, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, vive junto con sus últimos 3 hijos, pues los otros ya han formado sus propios hogares. 

Carlos, desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar, cuando tenía 17 años de edad, ingresó al ejército, sobrevivió a la guerra civil y posteriormente estuvo trabajando como policía, en donde en un mercado conoció a su esposa, luego fue empleado en diferentes empresas privadas como motorista y fue hasta hace tres años después que decidió independizarse y dedicarse al comercio de pescado, el cual iba a comprar hasta las playas directamente a los pescadores. Actualmente se dedica al comercio de diferentes productos, como huevos, pescado y carne de cerdo, etc.

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para reactivar su negocio, que se había quedado estancado por unos problemas de salud que tuvo que solventar.

Carlos, sueña con llegar a comprar un camión, para poder llevar mayor cantidad de mercadería y poder satisfacer más la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos, 62, is a hardworking man who left school after the sixth grade. He is happily married, his wife is a homemaker, they live with three of their children since the rest of them have already formed their own households.

Carlos began working at an early age. When he turned 17 he joined the military, survived the civil war, and later worked as a policeman, meeting his wife at the market. He then found employment as a driver for different private enterprises. Three years later, he decided to work independently selling fish that he would buy directly from the fishermen on the beach.

These days he sells different food products such as eggs, fish, pork meat, and more. Carlos needs the loan to reactivate his business, which stalled during a period when he encountered some health problems he had to overcome. He dreams of buying a truck that would allow him to transport more merchandise and be able in this way to meet the increased demand from his clients.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in order to reactivate his business.

loans.name: Iván José

texts.es: Iván en compañía de su familia reside en Cartagena de indias, un municipio de Bolívar en el que el consumo de comidas rápidas es numeroso y mucho más cuando se trata de sus comidas típicas,  es por ello que Iván le propuso a su cónyuge emprender una venta de estos productos más conocidos en la región caribe como fritos a lo cual ella acepto con gran expectativa. Cuando se trasladaron a una urbanización de la ciudad y en esta vivienda comenzaron a funcionar con una gran variedad de fritos; arepas de queso, con huevo, rellenas con pollo, caramañolas, buñuelos y empanadas que diariamente comercializan entre los habitantes del lugar. Alternando esta actividad comercializan mercancías varias entre ellas prendas de vestir y artículos para el hogar: sabanas, toallas, entre otros. En la actualidad está aplicando una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en prendas de vestir, tendidos de cama y artículos para el hogar, de este modo su oferta de productos será mucho más vistosa e impactará directamente en las ventas.  Su meta a futuro es tener su propio local y casa propia que le garantice a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Iván, with his family, lives in Cartagena de Indias, a municipality of Bolívar, where the consumption of fast food is high and much more when considering traditional foods. For this reason, Iván proposed to his spouse to undertake the sale of these well-known products in the Caribbean region such as fried foods which she accepted with great expectations. When they moved to an residential area of the city, they began to function in this house with a great variety of fried foods, arepas with cheese, egg, filled with chicken, caramañolas, donuts, and empanadas which they sell daily to the people in that place. He alternates this work with selling a variety of merchandise from clothing to household goods: sheets, towels and more. Currently he is applying for a loan, his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in clothing, bedding and household items. In this way, his product offerings will be much more attractive and that will impact his sales directly. His goal for the future is to have his own sales location and his own house which will guarantee his child a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, bedding and household items.

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es: Flor de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con con su hijo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien siempre busca la manera de poder salir adelante, hace hace 5 años inicio con capital propio el negocio de venta de ropa y es asi como ha podido salir adelante en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para tener meas inventario y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Flor, 46 years old, lives in her own house with her son. She is a very hard-working woman who always seeks a way to be able to get ahead.  Five years ago, she began with her own capital the business selling clothing and in this way she has been able to get ahead in her household. She is asking for a loan to purchase more clothing in bulk to have more inventory and, so, get better earnings to give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Yonelis Patricia

texts.es: Yonelis es una joven madre que se encuentra vinculada a la comercialización masiva de productos por intermedio de catálogos especializados, los cuales promociona entre sus conocidos, amigos y referidos, ella tomó la determinación de ser comerciante después de recibir la propuesta de una amiga, actividad que le ha permitido brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella está muy feliz de poder ejercer esta labor sin necesidad de descuidar las labores en el hogar y estar muy entregada a la crianza de su hijo de apenas tres años a quien en compañía de su cónyuge enseñan valores y buenas costumbres. En la actualidad Yonelis desea contar con un inventario que satisfaga la demanda de sus clientes es por ello que está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar perfumes, cremas corporales, productos capilares, entre otra variedad de artículos del catálogo. Su meta a futuro es abrir un local comercial y construir su propio apartamento.
texts.en: Yonelis is a young mother who is involved in the massive selling of products through specialized catalogs, which she sells to her acquaintances, friends, and people referred to her. She decided to be a businesswoman after getting the suggestion from a friend, work that has allowed her to offer a better quality of life to her family. She is very happy to be able to do this work without having to neglect the household tasks and to be very involved in raising her child who is only three years old and to whom, along with her spouse, she teaches values and good habits. Currently, Yonelis wants to have an inventory that satisfies her customers' demand and for that she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase perfumes, body lotions, and hair products, among a variety of products from the catalog. Her goal for the future is to open a retail space and build her own apartment.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, body creams, and hair products, among a variety of products from the catalog.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de camisetas desde hace 4 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residenica su prodcuto es de alta demanda y lo vende durante todo el años tiene muchos clientes y gracias a las ventas que realiza es como ha podido salir adelnete, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fardos de camisetas para continuar con su trabajo y asi mejorar sus ingresos y su nivel de vida.
texts.en: The young man, whose face has been pixelated because he is 24 years old and lives in a high risk zone, has worked selling shirts for 4 years. His business is located in his home. His product is in high demand and he sells it all year long. He has many customers and thanks to his sales that he makes, he has been able to get ahead. The young man lives in his own house with his life partner and he is asking for a loan to purchase bundles of shirts to continue with his work and, so, to increase his income and his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of shirts.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée âgée de 30 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de quatre enfants, Akouvi est une revendeuse de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à domicile. Akouvi désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz et des paniers de tomates fraîches. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Akouvi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider sa famille à avoir un bon épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a married woman aged 30, living in Tokoin. The mother of four children, Akouvi is a retailer of foodstuffs who goes to stock up at the market four times a month and resells her goods under a shed roof outside her house.

Akouvi wants this loan to order sacks of rice and baskets of fresh tomatoes. With the profit she will make from a good turnover, Akouvi intends to improve her sales point and help her family to flourish and her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice and five baskets of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Djembereng Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été inauguré en juillet 2013. Il est composé de femmes qui exercent le commerce, prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps et sont très solidaires. Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de trente ans et mère de trois filles. Elle s'active depuis deux ans sur la vente de poisson séché. Elle compte acheter dix kilogramme de poissons séchés avec le prêt sollicité. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois of which this group is a part was inaugurated in July 2013. It is made up of women who are small-scale retailers, taking out loans that they reimburse in a timely manner. They are very supportive of each other.

Madame Mariama who is on the right in the photo, raising her hand, is the representative of the group. She is married, aged 30, and the mother of three children. For two years she has been selling dried fish. She intends to buy 10 kilos of dried fish with the loan she is requesting. The profit will serve to allow her to participate in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to buy dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 65 years old and a widow with five children. Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvacion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, diapers, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mabel is 40 years old, and her two children are still in school.

Mabel has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Mabel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, sausages, spices, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food-production business.

Mabel has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, sausages, spices, bamboo sticks and other materials for her food-production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manioc, beans, Cape peas, maize flour, sugar, salt, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Flaviana to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day, so she is very happy with her business, but she doesn't have good management to run her business. She is taking this loan because she wants to use it to improve her management for her business.

She will buy some additional supplies such as sugar, Aqua, cigarettes, biscuits, noodles, candies, notebooks, slippers, soft drinks and other things to sell.

She has been involving herself in business activities since a few years ago. With the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, Aqua, cigarettes, biscuits, noodles, candies, notebooks, slippers, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Analy

texts.en:
Analy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Analy dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 60 years old and married with two children. Ana works very hard to provide for them.

Ana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages and other groceries.

Ana has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Ana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages and other groceries.

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is 46 years old, married with three children.

Victorina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, drinks, milk, etc.

Victorina has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and vegetables.

Victorina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, drinks, milk, etc

loans.name: Edralyn

texts.en:
Edralyn is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edralyn is 47 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Edralyn has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Edralyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as fruits, vegetables, etc.

Edralyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, Edralyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business such as, fruits, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Mary June

texts.en:
Mary June is 41 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Mary June works very hard to provide for them.

Mary June runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Mary June has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, sugar, noodles and other groceries.

In the future, Mary June would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is 37 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are still in school, and Girlie works very hard to provide for them.

Girlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee, juice, snack foods, etc.

Girlie has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Girlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee, juice, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42 years old and single.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, shampoo, detergent, snack foods, spices, bread and other personal care products.

Lilibeth has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, shampoo, detergent, snack foods, spices, bread and other personal care products.

loans.name: Sinikiwe Group

texts.en:
It is said that a human being is a social animal that thrives in the company of others. It is in these social groups that people’s talents are nurtured and potential realised.  Jean did not anticipate that as the youngest member of Sinikiwe group she would be chosen as their leader. Her fellow group members - all mothers to her as they are the same age as her parents - look up to her and believe in her leadership abilities.  They saw in her a woman with strength of personality, vision and integrity. They saw a leader who had the potential to marshal them towards the attainment of their goals. Jean is in a group called Sinikiwe group which consists of four ladies based in Harare’s oldest township Mbare. The group joined the Thrive program in August 2015 and completed the trainings course coming out better business women.

Jean is happily married to a man who supports her in every possible way to achieve her dreams. This wonderful family support has managed to make her establish a good poultry business and be a zealous business woman. Her business has helped her manage to supplement her husband’s income providing food, clothes, and paying school fees for her children. She has helped raise their standard of living and they are emulated by people in her neighbourhood. 

One year while Jean was in Zambia buying clothing for her family an idea rang in her mind. She thought she could add another line to her business by buying clothing from neighbouring countries for resale in Zimbabwe.  She saved her profits from the chicken business to venture into a new market. She bought a few pairs of shoes and clothes for resale. She got quick returns from the sale of clothing and decided to fully venture into the cross border business so as to increase her income levels. She realised she can increase her profit from doing this. She has made several business cycles from buying and reselling clothes from Zambia and this has been working out well. She recently started experiencing capital constrains as the market for clothing is getting bigger. She can`t afford to sacrifice the working capital she has for the poultry business. This is what made her apply for a loan of $350 to help her increase her working capital from Thrive Microfinance.

loans.use: to supplement income from her poultry business with the sale of clothes & shoes.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is selling petrol and gasoline. She started to sell petrol and gasoline a year ago with her own working capital. She is earning a good income from this business. She lives near the main road, so many people come to buy her petrol and gasoline every day.

She wants open a bigger business, but her money is not enough, so she is taking this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to add with her working capital. After that, she will use it to buy more petrol and gasoline.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and petrol.

loans.name: Aroh

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Aroh, who is a 36-year-old married with two sons and two daughters. Aroh has been a housemaid for fiveteen years and her husband is a greengrocer for ten years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet and water sources but Aroh will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Sukhbat

texts.en:
Mr. Sukhbat, 47 years old, lives with his wife in Kherlen, easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as a sentry at a private firm for 25 years. On his day off, he renders taxi service to local people. His wife stays at home, taking care of domestic work.

Sukhbat is requesting a loan of 775 USD to install vacuum insulated windows in his house. By doing so, the house will no longer lose its heat through its windows, resulting in less coal usage.

loans.use: to install vacuum insulated windows in his house.

loans.name: Bello Kuxliquel Group

texts.en:
The women of “Bello Kuxliquel” trust bank live close to the city of Totonicapán in Western Guatemala, a mountainous area of rich land where plants flourish. A place of majority indigenous population, the common language is Spanish, though Maya K`iche is widely used. 

These 8 resourceful women run businesses in artisanry, tailoring, and agriculture, trading within and outside of their communities. With between 20 and 40 years of age, the members of Bello Kuxliquel are mothers of between 2 and 8 children who study in primary and secondary school. 

Hermelinda is a 26-year-old member of the trust bank who takes care of her family by herself while her husband works abroad. Hermelinda runs a business in artisanry, weaving cortes, traditional skirts, and selling them from her home. With the profit she has brought in with her weaving, she has also been able to raise animals, including chickens and pigs, and thus, double her income. With her Kiva loan, Hermelinda plans to invest in thread of different colors and styles and dyes for her product, improving its quality to maximize her sales. This strong and determined woman studied to 6th grade, and has a 7 year old son in first grade and a little girl who is 2 and a half years old at home. To provide for her family, 

These working mothers of Bello Kuxliquel trust bank feel very happy with the respect the receive from Friendship Bridge and with all they are learning about investment, saving and money-management in the workshops. All of this helps them grow and flourish, standing out in their communities and making their children proud.

loans.use: to invest in thread of different colors and styles and dyes for her product, improving its quality

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Anecita is 52 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Anecita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell at her local market.

Anecita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell at her local market.

loans.name: Mudrika

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Mudrika,  who is a 48-year-old married with one son and one daughter. Mudrika is a greengrocer for five years and her husband is a builder for six years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and  sanitation for their family.  Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Mudrika will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build water source at their home to improve access to clean water and  sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Kyankunyule Farmers Group

texts.en:
Martin a member of Kyankunyule Farmers Group is need of a loan from Hofokam He is 28 years old, very hardworking, learned and a married man living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He is a professional primary teacher earning a salary but due to high demands of the family, Martin decided to start a business of maize and beans selling to supplement his family income.

He has now an experience of four years trading in produce from where he has been able to sustain himself and the family at large. He dreams of buying a motor vehicle to aid him in transporting his produce to his customers. His challenges are the unpredictable weather changes and customers who don’t pay him on time. Martin intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Giản

texts.en:
Mrs. Giản is 45 years old, and she is married. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Giản lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to use. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to install a clean water system.

This is Giản's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Giản hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to install a clean water system.

loans.name: Buenafe

texts.en:
Buenafe is a mother of three children at the age of 53. She is widowed already, and as a single mother, she aims to give her children a good living.

For five years already she has been engaged in and manages an appliance repair shop. It is a successful business for the family because it provides them their daily needs.

Recently, Buenafe decided to borrow a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional tools for her repair shop so that she can provide good services to her customers.

Buenafe plans to expand her business so that she can increase her income and be able to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools for her repair shop.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 39 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, shampoo, detergent, snack foods, spices, bread and other personal care products.

Mercy has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, shampoo, detergent, snack foods, spices, bread and other personal care products.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad needs your support to achieve his dreams.‎ He is a simple guy who lives with his family in Irbid and he is 23 years old. Mohammad is ‎studying at the University, majoring in Civil Engineering. He chose this major because he ‎wishes to be a successful engineer in the future and to be able open his own ‎engineering company. ‎

The current goal that he will graduate from college and start a new life, but the ‎financial problems that are faced by his family is an obstacle standing in front of him. So he decided ‎to apply for an education loan to be able to cover her university fees and achieve his ‎dreams.‎

loans.use: to be able to cover his university fees for a BSc. in Civil Engineering and thus a good job in that field.

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en:
Yasemin is 44 years old living with her children and trying to support them with their education. Ten years ago she started making chocolate cakes at home. She made brochures and distributed them and waited for orders. She could not get the orders she expected so she delivered her cakes by herself. When her orders increased she increased the kinds of cakes. Now she is making börek, dolma, cakes and cookies and she sells then in her own shop. With the help of her fourth loan she bought all the things she needed in her store.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Yasemin hanım 44 yaşında tek başına çocuklarını okutmaya çalışan bir anne. Yasemin hanım 10 yıl önce evinde profiterol yapmaya başladı. Kart ve broşür bastırarak bunları dağıttı ve sipariş bekledi. Bu şekilde istediği talebi göremeyince yaptığı ürünleri müşterilere kendisi götürmeye başladı. Siparişleri artınca ürünlerini çeşitlendirdi. Şu an el açması börek, yaprak sarması, kek ve kurabiye yapan Yasemin hanım bu ürünlerini yeni açtığı dükkanında satıyor. Maya’dan 4. kredisini kullanan Yasemin hanım bu kredilerle dükkânının eksik olan ihtiyaçlarını karşıladı.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her successful cake making shop.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, de 56 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, estudió hasta tercer grado, está felizmente casado, su esposa se dedica a los cuidados del hogar, viven junto con dos de sus hijos, porque el mayor vive en U.S.A, y de los otros dos, uno trabaja junto a su padre en una hacienda ganadera cercana a su comunidad y la otra trabaja como vendedora en una tienda del pueblo.

Antonio, desde pequeño se dedica a la agricultura, trabajando arduamente y con pasión y hace 30 años entró a trabajar en una de las haciendas ganaderas de su comunidad, en donde habían recientemente adquirido un tractor para realizar las labores culturales correspondientes a los cultivos tradicionales de la zona, por lo tanto lo capacitaron y actualmente es un tractorista experimentado.

Antonio, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono para fertilizar su cultivo de maíz, pues ya está lo suficientemente grande para abonarla, pero no cuenta con el suficiente capital para adquirirlo.

El sueño más grande de Antonio, es que sus hijos lleguen a formar sus propios hogares y que sean personas de bien u que sirvan a la sociedad salvadoreña.
texts.en:
Antonio is 56 years old. He is a hardworking man and studied until third grade. He is happily married and his wife is engaged in the household activities. They live with two of their children, because the oldest lives in the USA, and the other two: one works together with his father on a cattle ranch near their community and the other works as a merchant in a store of the pueblo.

Since he was very young, Antonio has been engaged in agriculture. He works hard and with passion. For 30 years he went to work in one of the cattle ranches of the community, where he would eventually purchase a tractor to work with the traditional crops of the area. Therefore he is now a trained and experienced tractor driver.

Antonio needs the loan to purchase fertilizer for his corn crop, since it is already ready to be fertilized, but he does not have sufficient capital to purchase.

The biggest dream of Antonio is that his children build their own homes and that they are good people working in the Salvadoran society.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his corn crop.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a 40-years old married woman living in the area of Lahore Pakistan. She looks after her family including three children. She is very hardworking and punctual lady. Her husband is sole earner of the family. He works in laundry related items preparation. He buys necessary raw materials from market for the preparation of laundry related items like laundry soaps, detergents, etc.

He works hard and honestly for the better earning to support her family and he is providing better detergents and other necessary cleaning items to the launders as well as retailers.

Suriya wants to take a loan so that her husband would be able to get more raw items and prepare maximum and reliable laundry items. In this way Suriya's husband is able to provide better financial support to the family to maintain their lives standard.
Suriya is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw items such as laundry soaps, detergents, surfs etc. for her husband laundry services

loans.name: Sirio

texts.en:
Sirio is a married man and father. He has managed his own rice farm for many years. He is determined enough to sustain his business, which is his family's main source of income. He has been planting and harvesting rice to earn more profit. He wants to expand and begin other business activities.

He is asking for financial assistance. He recently joined GDMPC and took a new loan to buy fertilizer for his rice in order to produce a good quality of rice for the market. He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice farm.

loans.name: Ranilyn

texts.en:
Ranilyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ranilyn is 38 years old, and three of her children are currently in school.

Ranilyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Ranilyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

Ranilyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Dolores dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merle

texts.en:
Merle is 65 years old and married with five children.

Merle is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Merle requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Merle has been raising pigs for six years now, and she has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Merle would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Juliene

texts.en:
Juliene is 48 years old and has four children. Juliene is married and her four children are still in school.

Juliene is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Juliene requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Juliene has been in this business for eight years now, and she has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Juliene would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a 36-year-old married woman with four children, who all attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Analie has a rug-making business in the Philippines. Analie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business.

Analie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Analie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is 44 years old and has two children. She operates a small business of cooking rice and curry and selling them in her community, which she has been doing for more than a year.

Hana requested a loan from SPBD, which she will use to buy a sack of flour, box of curry, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, gas stove, sack of potatoes, sack of onions, plastics bags, and container to help her run her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2012. She will use her profits to build a small restaurant.
