loans.use: to purchase a sack of flour, box of curry, box of chicken, sack of rice, bottle of vegetable oil, gas stove, sack of potatoes, sack of onions, plastics bags, and container.

loans.name: Nikki Rose

texts.en:
Nikki Rose is 36 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Nikki Rose runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and groceries.

Nikki Rose has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nikki Rose successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Nikki Rose aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, home care products and groceries.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old, single, and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Agnes requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as bread, snack foods, juice, drinks, etc. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as bread, snack foods, juice, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El tiene 63 años de edad es viudo, padece de cataratas en su ojo izquierdo, hace un año le operaron su ojo derecho, en ese entonces no pudo tratarse el otro ojo debido a la falta de dinero.
Vive solo y es pensionado lo que recibe cada mes solo le alcanza para los gastos de su hogar. Sufre de muchas molestias como dolores intensos de cabeza y visión borrosa. Necesita una cirugía para poder recuperar su visión totalmente.
texts.en:
He is a 63 year old widower. He suffers from cataracts in his left eye. A year ago they operated on his right eye. At that time he was not able to get treatment for the other eye due to lack of money.

He lives alone and is retired. What he receives each month only covers the household expenses.

He suffers from many problems like intense headaches and blurred vision.

He needs surgery to be able to completely recover his vision.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en: Madalena is married and she lives in Maliana. She has been involved in business activities since a few years ago, with her own working capital. She started with a small store, and she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy additional items to keep in her store, including detergents, water, cooking oils, noodles, milk, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She was struggling, but she has high expectations for running her business, because she wants to improve it in the future.

loans.use: to buy detergents, water, cooking oils, noodles, milk, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven soltera  de 25 años de edad, trabaja como recepcionista en una comercializadora. Nació con una condición hereditaria llamada miopía, durante mucho tiempo ha utilizado anteojos, desde los 21 años de edad fue candidata a la cirugía refractiva  para mejorar su visión, por falta de recursos económicos no ha podido operarse.
texts.en:
She is a single young woman, age 25. She works as a receptionist for a marketing company.

She was born with an heriditary condition called myopia. She has used glasses for a long time.

Since the age of 21 she has been a candidate for refractive surgery to improve her vision. Due to the lack of financial resources, she has not been able to have the surgery.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Mugolodde Twimukire Savings Group

texts.en:
Anna aged forty six is a widow living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. She is a member of the above mentioned group where members come together, agree to guarantee each other and access credit. Her hard work cannot go unnoticed and she has not let fate ruin her future, but has been able to get back on her feet to ensure that her children get the basics, even though their father is deceased.

She is a teacher by profession but also sells bananas in order to raise school fees for her children. With her meager income, she has been able to educate her children, buy land and build a residential house. The seasonality nature of her business coupled with inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business, while her dream is to own a food store in town dealing in a variety of agricultural produce. Ann is in need of a loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Munkhbayasgalan

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhbaysgalan, 42 years old, lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician since 2012. His wife works at the university where their children study.

He is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so, his family will live in comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Angeline works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Angeline is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, spices, vegetables, cooking oil and other food production materials for her food-vending business.

Angeline has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, spices, vegetables, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Floramie

texts.en:
Floramie is a married woman, 57 years old, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Floramie has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Floramie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, bananas and other materials for her food production business.

Floramie has been in this business for 26 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, bananas and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Vaiomasina

texts.en: Vaiomasina is a 33 year old mother with 4 children. She runs a business of selling pork cake in her community to earn a living. Vaiomasina requested for a loan to buy sack of flour, box of chicken, yeast, sack of sugar, plastic bags, fry pan, wooden spoon, vegetable oil,  to run the business. She has been doing this for more than 2 years and she will use her profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy sack of flour, box of chicken, yeast, sack of sugar, plastic bags, fry pan, wooden spoon, vegetable oil,

loans.name: Jumel

texts.en: Jumel has settled in Balamban,Mahayag, ZDS with his family. Jumel owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting rice to earn a living. He earns better income from his farm and had repaid successfully his previous loan, which was used for farm inputs. He wants a greener farm to increase his income. For this reason, he is taking out a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer in order to restore farm nutrients. In the future, he plans to renovate her house for better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to restore farm nutrients

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Madame Juliette est membre de banc villageois. Elle est très dynamique et rembourse toujours ses prêts sans difficultés. Elle est mariée, âgée de quarante sept ans et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre filles. Depuis deux ans elle s'active dans la vente d'huile de palme et du citron. Elle compte acheter avec le prêt sollicité cinq bidons de vingt litres de citron et trois bidons de vingt litres d'huile de palme. Elle a une clientèle potentielle qui achète sa marchandise. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Juliette is a member of the local banc villageois. She is very enegertic and always repays her loans without issues. She is married, 40 years of age, and has five children, including four daughters. For two years she has been selling palm oil and lemon juice. 

Juliette plans to use her loan to buy five 20-liter [5 gallon] jugs of lemon juice and three 20-liter jugs of palm oil. She has a loyal customer base. Her revenues will be used to help provide for family needs.

loans.use: to buy lemon juice and palm oil.

loans.name: Gayrat

texts.ru: Гайрат 49 летный мужчина. Он родился в районе Файзабад. Гайрат женат и отец двоих детей. У него один сын и одна дочка. Жена дома занимается шитьем. Гайрат работает инженером в гидроэлектростанции. Гайрат образованный человек. Он 5 лет занимается инженером. Его  сын учится в университете. Гайрат хочет, чтобы его сын тоже стал образованным и большим человеком. Гайрату надо оплатит за годового обучения сына. К сожалению, у него нет денег, и он решил обратиться к Вам за кредитом. Ему нужно поддержка с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Gayrat is a 49-year-old man who was born in the Fayzabad region. He is married with two children, one son and one daughter. His wife works at home sewing and he works as an engineer in a hydroelectric station. Gayrat is an educated person who has been working as an engineer for five years. His son is a university student and Gayrat wants him to also become an educated and successful person. He needs to pay for his son's yearly tuition but doesn't have enough money, so he has decided to ask you for a loan. He needs your support.

loans.use: to pay his son's yearly tuition

loans.name: Modesto Gilberto

texts.es:
EL SR, GILBERTO ORIGINARIO DE LA LEON, CASADO CON HIJOS MAYORES DE EDAD, SE CARACTERIZA POR SER TRABAJADOR, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, DEDES MUY JOVEN SE DEDICA A DESEMPEÑAR SU NEGOCIO EL CUAL HA ADQUIRIDO MUCHA EXPERICIENCIA Y CRECIDO PROFESIONALMENTE Y PERSONAL, SUS HIJOS YA SON ADULTOS Y HA PODIDO BRINDARLES LOS ESTUDIOS QUE NECESITAN, ATRAVES DE SU NEGOCIO PUDO CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS DE FORMAR A SUS HIJOS, Y HACERLE MEJORAS A SU VIVIENDA.

GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE FLORES EN SU CASA DE HABITACION Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE, EL DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, YA SEAN POR ENCARGOS EN EVENTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO CON MATERIAL COMO: PAPEL CREPE, CINTAS, BOLSAS PLASTICAS, CANASTAS, FLORES, TARJETAS, RECORDATORIOS ETC. PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. GILBERTO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA.
texts.en:
Gilbert is from Leon. He is married with older children. He is known to be a good worker, responsible, with a desire for personal growth. From a very young age he began his business, in which he's acquired much experience, and personal and professional growth. His children are now adults, and he was able to provide them the schooling they needed. Through his business he was able to fulfill his dreams of shaping his children and making improvements to his house.

Thanks to his desire to get ahead, he works selling flowers from a room in his house and as a street vendor. He works ten hours a day offering his products either through orders or for events. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business with material such as crepe paper, ribbons, plastic bags, baskets, flowers, cards, commemorative cards, etc., so that in the not too distant future he can obtain increased earnings. Gilbert is thankful for the Kiva investors who support persons of limited means in poor countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy products such as crepe paper, cellophane, ribbons, baskets, cards, commemorative cards, etc.

loans.name: Faujana

texts.en:
Faujana is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She has a shop where she sells second-hand clothes. She started this business a few year ago, with her own working capital of 200 USD. Faujana earns a good income from selling second-hand clothes because many people like to buy them, they are cheap, and they are unique compared to new clothes.

She only sells pants and shorts for men and women. She is taking this to buy more men's trousers, men's shorts, girls' long pants, and girls' shorts.

loans.use: to buy men's trousers, men's shorts, girls' long pants, and girls' shorts.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is a mother of ten children, and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been in this business for over five years, which provides a good income for her family. She took a new loan recently from GDMPC to buy pig feed and to repair the pig fence to expand her piggery. She plans to expand the farm by having more pigs to raise in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and repair the pig fence

location.town: P-3, HASAAN, LOPEZ JAENA, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: Norberta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Norberta has been in this business for 11 years, and she earns more income from raising pigs. She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Norberta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 25 years old and has two children.  Mae is married and both of her children are attend in school.

She earns a living by her oyster culture business in the Philippines. Mae requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

Mae has been  for 15 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.en: As a parent Olimpia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Olimpia is borrowing 4000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients as meat and vegetables for her food vending business. Olimpia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Wati

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Wati, who is a 50-year-old married with three sons. Wati and her husband have been selling food, such as snacks or breakfast for five years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 6.700,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Wati will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Nyasio

texts.en:
Nyasio is a committed husband, married with children living in Kasese,Uganda. He operates a retail shop but also deals in the timber business. With the profits he has been able to pay school fees for his children and also increase stock in his business.

However given the current inflation in Uganda, customers are not as frequent as they used to be. A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification even though he never got a chance to further his studies, since his parents could not afford. Nyasio intends to use the loan facility to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay schoolfees

loans.name: Tzanjay Group

texts.en:
In the beautiful city of San Juan La Laguna, located beside lake Atitlán in the Western Highlands of Guatemala, live the 7 ladies who make up trust bank “Tzanjay”. The majority of San Juan’s population is indigenous, and the women of Tzanjay communicate in the Maya language Tz'utujil in addition to Spanish.

Several ladies have tortillerias, corn mills, and fruit and vegetable stands, as well. In the group, there is a range of ages, two women in their 60s, and the rest in their 40s, all of them mothers of 2-4 children who are in school. 

In her second cycle being supported by Kiva investors, Concepción is a 41-year-old member of the trust bank who studied to 6th grade and is married, with a husband who runs a tour bus. The couple has 4 children, the two youngest in school and the older ones already graduated. For her business, Concepción is an artisan, weaving hammocks, bags, and scarves and shawls, “chalinas”, as well as blouses and skirts, “huipiles” and “cortes” traditional to San Juan La Laguna, and much more. With her new loan, this intelligent businesswoman plans to buy good quality thread and other materials for her artisanry. 

She sells to order, working to the demand of her clients, and has 8 employees-- without these workers she could not but so much effort and time into each order, and the quality if her product would go down. 

Thanks Kiva for supporting ladies like Concepcion.

loans.use: to buy good quality thread and other materials for her artisanry

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby with her husband but she earn to make a living. At the age of 67 and married with two children, she keeps herself busy to sufficiently provide for the family. She became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2012 and she gains access to micro finance services of the coop. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Anecita wishes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Margin

texts.en:
Margin lives a simple life with her family in the town of Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has 17-year-old daughter. Her husband is a fisherman while Margin is engaged in buying and selling beauty products, personal care products and apparels. She has been doing this for 10 years to earn a living and to help her husband in providing the basic needs of the family.

Thus, she is asking for a bigger amount loans for additional capital to buy shirts, shoes, sandals, underwear, lotion, fragrances, cosmetics and other beauty products to increase her sales as to her profit. She will also need a capital to buy fishing nets for her husband that is used in fishing to help increase their catch. 40 years old Margin dreams to improve their livelihood to be able to have enough money to send her daughter to school. She dreams for her daughter to finished with degree and become professional.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shoes, sandals, underwear, lotion, fragrances, cosmetics and other beauty products; and fishing nets.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a Kiva borrower. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuation. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Mdzomba

texts.en: Mdzomba is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain season which affects business and low stock. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by her oyster culture business in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Salvacion dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Sakher

texts.en:
Sakher is 25 years old single and lives in Mafraq; he is student at university majoring ‎in Computer Sciences.‎

Sakher has a lot of dreams to achieve and plans after he graduates from university, but his ‎father cannot help him to cover his education fees, therefore he asked for an education loan ‎to help him cover his university fees.‎

loans.use: to pay for the next semester's fees  for his BSc. in Computer Sciences

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en:
Sevinç is married and a mother of three.  Her children are getting educated so she has to work.  She is making contribution to the family budget by selling cosmetics and cleaning products through a network system.  She used loan for three times.  With the help of the loans she bought bulks of products, sold them, gained money and expanded her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Sevinç hanım evli üç çocuk annesi.  Çocukları okuyor ekonomik olarak çalışması gerekiyor.  Netwörk sistemi ile kozmetik ve temizlik ürünleri satarak aile ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile kozmetik ve temizlik ürünlerini toptan alarak paralar kazandı ve işlerini geliştirdi.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and cleaning products

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 59 years old lady and a responsible mother of 9 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his bike repair shop for past 15 years. Razia's husband needs to purchase merchandises e.g tools, spare parts, and machinery etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these merchandises.

To fulfill the need of her husband Razia has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy these merchandises for business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for her husband's bike repair shop.

loans.name: Dúo Lirio De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
Dúo Lirio de los Valles
Este dúo formado por doña Irma Yolanda, quien tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, nos cuenta que desde hace 14 años se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, como arroz, sopas, jabón, jugos, aguas, golosinas etc. y choco frutas en su casa que está ubicado cerca del Mercado de San Juan Sacatepéquez, con esfuerzo ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos y lo necesario para su hogar, solicita el crédito porque necesita surtir su tienda para poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en: Dúo Lirio de los Valles: One member of this duo is Yolanda. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. She says that she has worked selling basic use products for 14 years. She sells rice, soup, soap, juice, water, candies and choco-fruits etc. at her house which is located close to the San Juan Sacatepéquez market. With her efforts she helps her husband with the expenses for her children and what is needed for the household. She is requesting the loan as she needs to stock her store in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Procerfina

texts.en: Procerfina is a married woman from Baybay, L eyte. She is 58 years old and earns a living by running a sari-sari store business. Aside from this, she also owns a small eatery that also helps her and her husband in their daily basic needs. Although her husband has a work in his own, her husband is an electrician. There are still times in their life that having no capital to run their business is their problem. That is why; Procerfina comes up into a decision of lending money to operate their business continuously.  She is asking a loan for additional capital to buy grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, toiletries, candies, chips and biscuits. She will also use the money to buy food ingredients such as flour, vegetables, meat and spices for her eatery business. In the future, she wants to expand her small eatery into a fabulous restaurant.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as noodles, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar, toiletries, candies, chips and biscuits; flour, vegetables, meat and spices

loans.name: Lupeumu

texts.en:
Lupeumu is a 25-year-old mother with one child. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year.

Lupeumu requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), chemicals, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, backpack sprayer, and banana tubes (seedlings), to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), chemicals, a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, backpack sprayer, and banana tubes (seedlings).

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a battery charging business. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are individuals.

He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy battery charging equipment and batteries. His business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable income. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid succcessfully.

loans.use: to buy more battery charging equipment and batteries.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo has previously received a loan through Kiva, which definitely helped fund the maintenance and registration of his jeepney. It ensured safe and efficient service and thus continuous income to help support his family's needs. Aside from his transport service, he also grows a small pineapple farm where he has a laborer.

He is again in need of funds in the amount of a PHP 40,000 loan to pay for new tires, an oil change, and tune-up of his jeepney. He will use part of the loan to buy fertilizers for a productive harvest. Both his jeepney and his farm mean a lot to him, for they help to adequately provide for their daily needs and fund the education of his child.

To improve his income, he plans to buy another jeepney. He desires for his child to get a college education to allow him a better life. He faithfully meets up every week with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and registration of his jeepney, and buy fertilizers for his farm as well.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 38 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marissa has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: tobuy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 52 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Helen has been in this business for 18 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Salvacion is 34 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Salvacion has a buy-and-sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containeers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is a hardworking entrepreneur. She operates a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Rufa requested another loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. She hopes to build her business and save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man living in Kyenjojo which is in the western part of  Uganda. He deals in produce business where he buys and sells a variety of agricultural produce like beans, rice and beans among others. To supplement his incomes, he does carpentry  work and makes very nice chairs, bed and tables and his clients are very happy with his sense of art. He is challenged by seasonality changes and price fluctuations while his dream is to become a leading produce dealer in his area and having a fully stocked produce store.James will use the loan to buy agricultural produce like maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth aged 45 is an inspiring divorced woman with five children living in Masindi, Uganda. After getting tired of her husband’s violence in the home, she finally decided to divorce him so that her children can have a better environment to grow in. She sells clothes to raise money to support her family but also does farming at a subsistence level and sells the surplus to get extra income.

She does not have a stationed shop but instead moves to different markets on different days and sets up stalls to sell her clothes. Her business is very lucrative given the high demand for clothing in Uganda. Rains can affect her operations but her dreams are to set up at least two boutiques in town. Elizabeth is need of a loan to buy clothes to sell as the festive season approaches.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky is 25 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Jinky requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Dolores

texts.es:
Ana, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, vive junto con sus hijos y con su madre a la cual cuida porque ya está bastante anciana.

Ana, tiene un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras, en donde también vende carnes y refrescos, el negocio lo inició hace 11 años, porque tenía que hacer algo para mantener a sus hijos; fue así como inició con la venta de cocos y un poco de frutas y verduras. Actualmente, le va muy bien porque sus hijas mayores se incorporaron al negocio y trabajan muy fuertemente.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar flores y materiales necesarios para elaborar coronas, pues ya se acerca el día de los difuntos y necesita estar preparada para cuando llegue ese día y aprovechar la venta de este producto tan demandado para esos días.

Ana, sueña con abrir un pequeño salón de belleza, para que una de sus hijas lo administre y así generar mayores ingresos para su familia y que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana, 42, is a very hardworking woman.  She is a single mother with 4 children, and she lives with her children and her mother.  She cares for her mother, because she is quite elderly.

Ana has a stall where she sells fruits and vegetables, and also meats and beverages.  She started this business 11 years ago, because she had to have a means of supporting her children.  So she started selling coconuts and a small amount of fruits and vegetables.  Now her business is doing very well, because her eldest daughters have joined the business and they work very hard.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy flowers and other materials needed to make wreaths, because the Day of the Dead is approaching, and she needs to be ready.  When this day arrives, she will be ready to benefit from the sale of this product, which is greatly in demand at this time of year.

Ana dreams of opening a small beauty salon that one of her daughters could manage.  This way, she could generate more income for her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flowers and other materials to make floral wreaths

loans.name: Sarmunah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Sarmunah,  who is a 35-year-old married with one son and one daughter. Sarmunah has a small shop  and her husband is a interpreneur. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family.  Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Sarmunah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build a toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, está casada, su esposo al igual que ella se dedican a la sastrería, viven junto a sus 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno trabaja y el otro aún se encuentra estudiando, fueran 3 hijos pero uno falleció por una enfermedad terminal.

María, cuando llegó a su comunidad un programa para aprender oficios como sastrería, repostería, bisutería, entre otros, por parte de la alcaldía, ella se entusiasmó y aprendió acerca de la sastería rápidamente, posteriormente le enseño a su esposo, quien para esa fecha era ayudante de albañil; pero también se interesó y aprendió rápidamente.- Actualmente trabajan juntos y tienen una clientela fiel que confían en su buen servicio.

El préstamo solicitado es para comprar otra máquina de coser tipo “Rana”, con la cual se les facilita el trabajo de hacer los ruedos de cada prenda, con ésto agilizaría más su trabajo y será de mejor calidad.

María, sueña con seguir trabajando fuertemente en su negocio y que vaya prosperando, de tal manera que en el futuro pudiera llegar a tener más máquinas y empleados trabajando para ellos.
texts.en:
María, who is 37 years old, is a very hardworking woman. She is married. Both she and her husband work as tailors. They live with their 2 children, one of whom works and the other still goes to school. They had 3 children but one died of a terminal illness. When a program came to her community through the mayor's office, teaching jobs such as tailoring, pastry making, and jewelry making, among others, María got excited and quickly learned about tailoring. She later taught it to her husband, who at that time was a mason's assistant. He too was interested, and learned quickly. Currently they work together and have a loyal customer base that relies on their good service.

The loan is to buy another "Rana" brand sewing machine, which will help in making the hems of each garment. This will streamline their work more, and make it of a higher quality. María dreams of continuing to work diligently in her business, and that it prosper in such a manner that in the future she will be able to have more machines and employees working for her.

loans.use: to buy another "Rana" brand sewing machine.

loans.name: Ramonito

texts.en: Ramonito is a resident of Carles, Iloilo where fishing is one of their main sources of income in most people in the community. He is married and has four children ages 23, 20, 10 and 4-year-old and he is raising them through this fishing business. He has been doing this for nine years and hoping to augment this livelihood because it is the only business that he can get an income to provide his family. Thus, he is asking for a loan to help her buy fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing weights and fishing knot (which serve as the main line of the fishing net). Ramonito dreams in the future to improve his business for his children’s education. He wants them to give good life and better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing weights and fishing knot

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de granos básicos (maíz, arroz, frijoles) en el mercado municipal desde hace 10 años, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas quintales de granos básicos ya que le va bien en sus ventas y asi podra seguir teniendo mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Rosa is 35 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked selling basic grains (corn, rice, beans) in the municipal market for ten years. With the profits she makes she manages to pay some of the household expenses. The client is requesting a new loan to buy more quintals of basic grains as her sales are doing well. Doing this she can continue to have greater economic income.

loans.use: to buy more quintals of basic grains.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 53 years old, married, and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years.

Bernardita requested a loan from NWTF for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 50-years old married woman and mother of four children. She is living in the area of Lahore Pakistan. After her marriage she has faced much tough time due to occupation of her husband. In the beginning her husband does not have permanent job to earn money. Now he is doing a business in which he provides the concrete mixer machine and labor for the construction of roofs. He has gotten enough experience and wants to conduct his own business. He wants to buy a roof lifting machine so he can provide services to lift the roofs but he does not have cash in hand to cover the cost of machine.

Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so her husband would be able to buy a roof lifting machine.
She hopes that this business will prove profitable for her family. Razia thanks to the kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a roof lifting machine for her husband's construction services.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario, es un agricultor de profesión muy honrado y trabajador, ha sacado adelante a sus hijos trabajando la tierra y por ello sus logros personales son dar un buen ejemplo para su familia, para que le recuerden como un hombre de lucha y empeño que dio su mejor esfuerzo por el bienestar de los suyos, su pasión es la agricultura y la crianza de ganado y cerdos, sus hijos le han apoyado en todo y le dan su ayuda para que él pueda comprar lo necesario.

Hilario, trabaja la tierra desde muy pequeño y fue su padre el que le enseñó este oficio, porque lo llevaba a la parcela todas las mañanas, para que aprendiera bien y además le heredo 5 cabezas de ganado, las cuales le reproducen y hoy tiene algunas más, las cuales le dan leche o las vende para destazo; igualmente cría cerdos en su porqueriza en donde siempre mantiene entre 8 y 10 cerdos para engorde y posteriormente el destazo.

El dinero lo necesita para comprar abono y pago de jornaleros, los cuales le ayudarán para abonar la milpa, porque ya necesita este fertilizante que es muy necesario para el desarrollo de la planta y posteriormente obtener una mejor cosecha.

Hilario, desea que Dios le de unos años más, para ver crecer a su nieto el cual tiene 3 años y es el único nieto que tiene.
texts.en:
Hilario is a farmer who is honest and hardworking.  He has provided for his children by working the land, and his personal achievement has been to serve as a good example for his family. He wants to be remembered as a man who strived to always give his best efforts for the well-being of his family.  His passion is agriculture and the raising of cattle and pigs.  His children have supported him in everything, and they help him so that he can buy everything he needs.

Hilario has worked the land since he was very young.  His father taught him to farm.  He would go to their plot of land every morning to learn.  In addition, he inherited 5 heads of cattle, which have reproduced, and now he has more.  He gets milk from them or sells them for meat.  He also raises pigs in his pigsty, where he always has between 8 and 10 pigs to fatten and later slaughter.

Hilario needs money to buy fertilizers and to pay for farmhands who will help him to fertilize his cornfield.  He needs these fertilizers to develop his plants so that he can later have a better harvest.

Hilario hopes that God will give him some additional years so that he can see his grandson grow.  His grandson is his only grandchild, and he is 3 years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for farmhands

loans.name: Jargalsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Jargalsaikhan, 49 years old, lives with his wife and children in Erdenet, third largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as an engineer at copper enrichment facility for 25 years. His wife is public servant at social insurance agency. Their children study at university.

He is requesting a loan of 1500 USD to buy an electric car for taxi service. He wants to render taxi service using his electric car for extra income. As his children are growing, his family's income doesn't meet the expenditure.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for taxi service.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.fr:
Créer depuis 25 Octobre,  ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame  Agnès, (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est  âgée 47 ans mariée  et mère de 04 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires (riz, huile, sucre, sel et d’autres condiments).

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 01 sac de riz à 13500f, 01 sac de sucre à 22500f, 01 bouteille de 20 litre d’huile raffiné à 20000f et d’autres condiments d’un montant de 14000f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et le paiement de la scolarité soins médicaux et habillements des enfants.
texts.en:
Created since the 25th of October, this group is made up of women with experience in the program. Their main activity is petty trade.

Mrs Agnès (seated on the extreme right with her hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of four children. She sells food products (rice, oil, sugar, salt and other condiments). With this new loan, she intends to purchase one bag of rice for 13500f, one bag of sugar for 22500f, one 20-litre bottle of refined oil for 20000f and other condiments for 14000f, to retail in her neighbourhood.

With her profits, she intends to help her husband with the daily expenses and paying the school fees, medical care and clothing of the children.

loans.use: to buy one bag of rice for 13500f, one bag of sugar for 22500f, one 20-litre bottle of refined oil for 20000f and other condiments for 14000f.

loans.name: Diariatou

texts.fr:
Membre depuis le 12 Novembre 2011, cette brave femme a une expérience en matière de crédit. Elle a comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diariatou est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente d’habillement, sac et de chaussures etc .

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus teintés des chaussures des sacs et d’autres habillements qu’elle met dans sa boutique pour le revendre en détails. Elle renouvelle son stock a chaque fois que la marchandise est sur le point d’épuisé.

 Les bénéfices lui serviront  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et d’aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
A member since 12th November 2011, this brave woman is experienced with loans. Her main activity is petty trade. Mrs Diariatou is married and the mother of 2 children. She works selling clothing, bags and shoes, etc.

With this loan, she intends to buy dyed cloth, shoes, bags and other items of clothing that she will put in her shop to retail. She renews her stock every time the merchandise is about to finish. The profits will help her to provide for her children's needs and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy dyed cloth, shoes, bags and other items of clothing to put in her shop for retail.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en: Virginia has been running a retail business in order to provide the needs of her family. She sells assorted groceries in their local community member to make a living. Her family helps her in operating the business. To increase her sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC  to buy additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Virginia wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 60 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuit, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Maribel has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuit, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a general store. Analyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables for her vegetable vending business to sell.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 42 years old and single with two children.

Lilibeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, spices, milk, shampoo, and noodles.

She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lilibeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, spices, milk, shampoo,  and noodles.

loans.name: Tupu

texts.en:
Tupu is a 56-year-old mother with eight children. Her business is selling taro at the market to earn a living. She has had this experience for more than a year.

Tupu requested a loan to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, and shovel, to help her run the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business. Tupu became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, and shovel.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina has been making and selling her charcoal to work for a profit, and this business becomes their main source of living. With the help of her husband, who is a farmer, they have been able to sustain the business and send her children to school.

Rosalina’s planning to engage in some other activities for the expansion of her business. Now that she has gained access to GDMPC, she has decided to avail a new loan to be used in buying a high volume of coconut shells for making charcoal. Then, she will be able to produce plenty of charcoal for her local customers.

Rosalina’s plan for the future is to save more money for the educational plans of her children when they get to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for making charcoal.

location.town: P-5, VILLAFLOR, OROQUIETA CITY, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Gen

texts.en:
Gen is 51 years old and a mother of two children. She has been farming for many years, and she earns better income from this.

With her previous loan used for buying pigs to raise, she was able to raise more and was financially prepared for the next cropping season.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now planning to take a new loan to buy feed to boost her pigs.

She is now happy to say that she is assured of a productive piggery in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her piglets.

location.town: P-3, VILLAFLOR, OROQUIETA CITY, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a hardworking woman, an entrepreneur with two children.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Riza dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 47 years old now.

Elizabeth has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of meats to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of meats to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Elena requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Elena has been in this business for 15 years now.

Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hennie

texts.en:
Hennie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Hennie is 36 years old, and her two children are in school.

Hennie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Hennie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Hennie has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Hennie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Exuperta

texts.en:
Exuperta is 58 years old and married with three children.

Exuperta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Exuperta has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Exuperta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Minh's Group

texts.en:
Minh is 25 years old and married. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a barber shop, which she has been doing for three years. Her family is a low-income household in the village. The income from her business is unstable because it depends on customer demand, which changes daily and can not be predicted. The main hardship that Minh faces is lack of capital.

Minh is requesting her third loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution, which she will use to purchase instruments to expand her barber shop and raise her income. She joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution in 2014 to improve her business. Her group consists of seven members. In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to expand her barber shop.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita con 51 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y dos hijos mayores de edad, en casa propia, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Margarita cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.

Margarita se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores.Solicita préstamo para compra de mayor número de animales y comida para estos, de esta forma le ayudará a poder tener mayores ventas. Las perspectivas del mercado son buenas ya que esos animales son vendidos de forma semanal en la parada de Cayaltí.

Socio nuevo en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Margarita con 51 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y dos hijos mayores de edad, en casa propia, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Margarita cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.

Margarita is 51 years old and lives with her partner and two grown children in their own home. They live in the district of Za
Margarita se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores.Solicita préstamo para compra de mayor número de animales y comida para estos, de esta forma le ayudará a poder tener mayores ventas. Las perspectivas del mercado son buenas ya que esos animales son vendidos de forma semanal en la parada de Cayaltí.

Socio nuevo en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 41 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Irene operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Irene requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 50 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amelita operates a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Amelita requested a loan from NWTF for 24,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional stocks of vegetables to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Dúo El Durazno Group

texts.es: Dúo el Durazno Wilma de 34 años, casada,  es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales son menores de edad y asisten a la escuela de su comunidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, ropa y obsequios para todo tipo de ocasión con otros accesorios de belleza. Wilma es conocida en su comunidad pues ya hace varios años tiene su negocio. Wilma solicita un crédito para la compra de más producto(Cosmeticos) para tener variedad para sus clientes. El sueño de Wilma es tener un local mas grande y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle la mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Durazno Duo
Wilma is 34 years old. She is married, and the mother of 4 minor children who attend school in their community. She works selling cosmetics, clothing, gifts for all occasions and beauty accessories. Wilma is well known in her community, because she has had this business for several years. Wilma is requesting a loan to buy more products (cosmetics) in order to provide variety for her customers. Her dream is to have a larger business premises and earn more income so that she can provide the best education for her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Siniva

texts.en:
Siniva is a 63-year-old mother with 5 children. She runs a small business of selling taro and bananas in her village to earn a living with the help of her children.

Siniva requested a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a strong-willed woman who pushes her abilities when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of providing support for her family. Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

Aside from her project of building concrete pig pens, she thinks of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee desde hace varios años una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia donde comercializa una variedad de productos, adicional a eso tambien vende tortillas cuenta con mas de 10 años de experiencia en la actividad y es asi como ha podido solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas mercaderia sopas, refrescos, gaseosas, golosinas, granos basicos, etc. para aumentar sus ganancias y asi seguir teniendo una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 53 years old and lives in her own home with her family. For several years she has had a store located in her home where she sells a variety of products. She also sells tortillas, and has 10 years of experience doing this. With these activities she has been able to pay some of her household expenses. She is requesting another loan to buy more merchandise such as soup, soft drinks, sodas, basic grains, etc. in order to increase her income and continue to have a better quality of life along with her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soup, soft drinks, sodas, candy, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora makes good earning on her hog raising activities in Kinamandagan, Lazi, Siquijor. This is how she supports her family and able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her yield especially that she has high cost of living when her children entered college. Flora approached Paglaum to loan an amount to buy additional bags of feeds. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this season.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feeds

loans.name: Viona

texts.en: Viona 36 years old and married with 7 children. She runs a business of selling cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, in her village to earn a living. Viona requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds (cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, to help her with the business. She joined SPBD in 2009. She will expand her business using her profit.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Fayzihon

texts.ru: Файзихон 50 летняя швея. Она с молодостью занимается швеей. Файзихон знает все навики швеи. Она дома занимается любимой делом. У Файзихон одна дочка. Файзихон семьей проживает в городе исфара.  Ее единственная дочка учится в университете в четвертым курсе. У нее последный курс учебы. Ее дочка еще не оплатила за учебы. Файзихон решила заплатит сама, за счет кредита. По этой причине Файзихон обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: Fayzihon is a 50-year-old seamstress. She has been working as a seamstress since her youth. Fayzihon knows all the skills of a seamstress. She carries out her her beloved work at home. Fayzihon has one daughter. Fayzihon's family lives in the city of Isfara. Her sole daughter is studying in the fourth year at university. Her daughter has not yet paid for her tuition. Fayzihon has decided that she will pay herself using a loan. For this reason Fayzihon has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La señora Marina vive en la población de Entre Ríos del trópico de Cochabamba, con su esposo y sus 5 hijos de las cuales cuidan y apoyan en sus estudios, doña Marina trabaja en el área agrícola tiene en producción yuca y cítricos, su esposo le colabora en el mantenimiento de la producción, estos productos los comercializan a las comerciantes de frutas y productores que compran en el lugar donde se cosechan, la señora Marina en una mujer muy trabajadora que tienen el anheló de seguir creciendo económicamente por el bienestar de sus hijos por que quiere que ellos estudien y que tengan profesión, es por el cual trabajan duramente con su marido, sus producciones les han generado buenos ingresos pero siempre es necesario realizar un buen manejo para mejorar o mantener los rendimientos y así vender a buenos precios, es por ello que requieren un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de sus producciones (yuca y cítricos), con los objetivos propuestos doña Marina mejorara los rendimientos y obtendrá buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Marina lives in the community of Entre Rios in the tropics of Cochabamba with her husband and their 5 children, who she takes care of and helps with their studies. Marina works in agriculture and has a production of yuca and citrus fruits. Her husband contributes to the maintenance of the produce and they sell them to merchants who buy them right from where they harvest. 

Marina is a hard worker who has the desire to continue growing economically for the well-being of her children. She wants them to study and have a profession, and this is why she works hard with her husband. 

Her products have generated good income for them, but it is still necessary to manage the business well to improve or maintain the output and to be able to sell at good prices. For this reason she needs a loan to conduct the maintenance of her productions (yuca and citrus fruits). With the proposed objectives Marina will improve output and obtain good income.

loans.use: to maintain and preserve her products (yuca and citrus fruits), to improve output and obtain good income for her family.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane runs a general store located inside the public market in the town of Talibon, Bohol.
She sold basic commodities like rice, soft drinks, household wares and plastic wares. She is 37-year-old married woman and has two young children.
Her husband has also an income that could help meet the family's daily needs.For almost 12 years, Mary Jane owns a general store , serving town dwellers.
She would like to maintain the inventory of merchandise on her store, that is why she would like to avail the loan.

She decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. Mary Jane would like to buy supplies like plastic wares, cellophane, edible oil and soy sauce. In these way, she could able to cope with the demands and she is very happy to serve her respective customers well.

She is hoping and do her best to improve the family's living condition and to be able to continue support the schooling if her children for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy supplies like plastic wares, cellophane, edible oil and soy sauce

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa María con 31 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge e hijas, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Rosa María cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Rosa María se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desde hace varios años en su propio domicilio.Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales y comida como es concentrado, lo cuál le generará mayor ingresos diarios a su unidad familiar y hacer unos arreglos en su corral.

Rosa María no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, para Edpyme Alternativa es su primer crédito.
texts.en:
Rosa María, age 30, is in a live-in relationship.  She lives in her own home, together with her partner and daughters, in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, in the department of Lambayeque, Peru. The residents of this area mainly work in agriculture, trade, and ranching.

Rosa María has very good references, personal and business alike, from the local residents.  

Rosa María has raised and sold animals for a number of years, working from her home.  She is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of animals and concentrated feed.  This will generate a higher daily income for her family and she will make some repairs on her corral.

Rosa María doesn’t have experience taking out loans.  This is her first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of animals and concentrated feed

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 52 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for 9 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Isabel tiene 45 años de edad, es una persona responsable con iniciativa para superarse y mejorar la situación económica de su familia ya que tiene 4 hijos dependientes quienes viven con ella y están en edad escolar.
Doña Isabel  es una mujer emprendedora, actualmente se dedica a la actividad agrícola ya que tiene sus propios terrenos en lugares aledaños a su vivienda y también se dedica a brindar el servicio de gomeria (parchado de llantas) esta ultima no es tan concurrente, sin embargo sabe que a veces los precios de sus productos no acompañan con buenos ingresos y la iniciativa de incursionar en otras actividades la llevo a recibir la capacitación a nivel técnico básico en confección textil en su misma comunidad, estos cursos se realizaron bajo el convenio de Fautapo y Cea Thaqu Thaqu, que son instituciones que brindan capacitación y apoyo a emprendimientos productivos en la región. Doña Isabel con la solcitu del préstamo realizara la compra de maquina recta, telas e hilos para empezar con la costura de algunas prendas de vestir. 
Doña Isabel iniciara el emprendimiento en producción textil para lo cual, está dispuesto a trabajar y realizar un aporte con la producción textil ya que ella tiene una maquina pero es antigua y necesita una que sea actual.
texts.en:
Isabel is 45 years old. She is a responsible person with initiative to better herself and improve her family's financial situation. She has 4 dependent school-aged children who live with her.

Isabel is an enterprising woman who currently works in agriculture, on the land that she has next to her home. She also provides tire-patching services, although this activity is not very regular. Because the prices for her products do not always provide her with a good income, she was motivated to try other activities, and took some basic sewing training in her community. These courses were provided by Fautapo and Cea Thaqu Thaqu, which are organizations that provide training and support for businesses in the region.

With the loan she is requesting Isabel will buy a sewing machine, fabric and thread to begin sewing articles of clothing. Isabel wants to begin work producing clothing. She has a sewing machine, but it is old, and she needs a more modern one.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabric and thread to sew clothing, so as to provide new products to her customers and earn more income.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es: Saul de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de mariscos y pescados desde hace 25 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelente, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y colocando puertas y ventanas pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no alcanza para realizarlo por esa razon solicita un credito para la compra de los materiales de contruccion necesarios y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Saul, 46 years old, lives in his own house with his son. He has worked selling shellfish and fish for 25 years and with what he gets from his sales, he manages to get ahead. He wants to improve his house replacing the roof and installing doors and windows but with what he earns from his work he doesn't have enough to do it. For this reason, he asks for a loan to purchase the necessary construction materials and, so, to be able to have a more secure house.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary construction materials to replace the roof and install doors and windows.

loans.name: Dúo Marianita Group

texts.es: Dúo Marianita Doña Cecilia de 41 años de edad, es  dueña de una tienda llamada juanita se llama asi por su mamá  tiene 1 hijo de 21 años de edad en su negocio ella necesita el crédito para comprar y surtir la tienda de granos básicos y embutidos ella inicio vendiendo verduras y de esa forma fue creciendo hasta que pudo poner tienda sus metas son mejorar la calidad de vida, mejorar los ingresos económicos, fortalecer el negocio, pagar los gastos de su casa. Es el primer crédito que solicita a fape, y espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The Marianita Duo
Cecilia is 41 years old. She owns a store that is called Juanita, after her mother. She has one son who is 21 years old. She needs a loan in order to supply her store with basic grains and meats. She began by selling vegetables, and grew her business until she had her own store. Her goals are to improve her quality of life, increase her income, strengthen her business, and pay her household expenses. This is the first loan that she has requested from FAPE, and she hopes that she can receive the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Elmeres

texts.es:
Elmeres con 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo, en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Elmeres se dedica al cultivo de café, dedicándose a este rubro hace 3 años. solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para su cultivo. De esta manera incrementará sus rendimientos.

Elmeres es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa,a manejado dos créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
27-year-old Elmeres lives together with his wife and child in the district of Callayuc, the province of Cutervo, the department of Cajamarca, in the country of Peru. The majority of this town's residents earn a living in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

Elmeres earns a living cultivating coffee, dedicating himself to this line for work for the past 3 years. He requests a loan in order to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops. In this way, he will increase his outputs.

Elmeres is a recurring borrower with Edpyme Alternativa. He has managed two loans which were paid off punctually.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Marybeth

texts.en:
Marybeth has been planting and harvesting bananas for many years, work that she has done since she was married. She gets up early and has to go to the fields where she oversees her bananas.

Marybeth successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for buying fertilizer. She is requesting a loan to pay replanting costs and to cover land preparation costs for this planting season. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to pay replanting costs and to cover land preparation costs for this planting season.

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
María Aracely con 29 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hija en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú, en una zona urbana. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican básicamente a la cría y posterior comercialización de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos...etc) y a la agricultura cultivo de café.

María Aracely se dedica a la cría y comercialización de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos...etc). María Aracely cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro hace más de cinco años, vende animales de cría en el distrito de Santo Tomás. Adicionalmente cultiva 3 hectáreas de café variedad Catimor. El destino del crédito será para invertir en capital de trabajo, compra de animales menores para cría y posterior comercialización, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

María Aracely es socia nueva para nuestra institución financiera Edpyme Alternativa.María Victoria firma con cónyuge.
texts.en:
Maria Aracely, 29, lives with her common-law husband and daughter in the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, The local people here work basically in raising and selling small animals (guinea pigs, hens, pigs, etc.) and in coffee cultivation.

Maria Aracely raises and sells small animals (guinea pigs, hens, pigs, etc.)

Maria Aracely has over five years' experience in the sector and sells animals in the district of Santo Tomas. She also cultivates three hectares of Catimor variety coffee. The loan will be used as work capital to buy small animals to raise and sell. This will give her more income to improve her family's quality of life.

Maria Aracely is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa. Maria Victoria signs along with her husband.

loans.use: to buy small animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy-and-sell accessories business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy accessories like ring, earrings, necklaces, hair clips, etc. to sell to her customers.

Lyn has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy accessories like rings, earrings, necklaces, hair clips, etc. to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling chips, biscuits, candies, sugar, coffee and mineral water. She is a hardworking, 44-year-old married woman, who has three children. Aside from running a sari-sari (variety) store, she also engages in selling purchase order (P.O.) cards. They can be purchased in a particular store or mall like a cash basis and payable when they are due.

Merlyn is requesting a loan with Kiva, from its field partner CEVI, to buy soft drinks, groceries and to purchase additional P.O. (purchase order), to continue improving her business. She used the previous loan to stock her shop and wants to continue doing so. Thus, her store will be filled again and attract customers to shop. She will start to expand and continue to manage her livelihood well. Merlyn is very thankful to KIVA and CEVI.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, groceries and to purchase additional P.O. (purchase order).

loans.name: Claudia Yasmina

texts.es: Claudia de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de antojitos como: tostadas de tajaditas de papas, yuca, platanitos, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas materia prima como: yuca, papa, plátanos, aceite, etc. todo por mayor para seguir con su trabajo y asi poder seguir teniendo mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Claudia, 46 years old, lives in her own house with her family.
