She works selling and making snacks such as tostadas with slices of potato, yucca, and plantains, and she sells as a street vendor in the different colonies and markets that are near where she lives. She is asking for another loan to purchase more raw materials such as: yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil, etc., all in bulk to continue with her work and, so, be able to continue having better income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as yucca, potatoes, plantains, oil, etc., all in bulk.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
La señorita Carla es una joven de 26 años de edad, se dedica a la administración y evaluación de proyectos en una empresa constructora, contando con buena experiencia y de conocimiento en el rubro ya Carla es de profesión Economista, la señorita cuenta con buenas expectativas ya que a ella lo que más le motiva es salir adelante y con varias metas por realizar ya que ella es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y quiere llegar a formar un capital de trabajo que le pueda brindar la apertura de su propia consultara para así independizarse, motivo por el cual solicita el préstamo.
La señorita Carla viene de una familia con buenos valores morales y sobre todo trabajadora la cual esta inculcada con los valores de humildad, buena administración de recursos, respeto, con una visión de emprendimiento y alcanzar los objetivos que ella misma se traza a lo largo de su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Carla is a 26-year-old young woman who works administering and evaluating projects in a construction business. She has good experience and knowledge in the field since Carla is an economist by profession. She has good prospects since she is most motivated by getting ahead and has several goals to achieve since she is a single mother. She has two children and wants to get working capital that can allow her to open her own office to become independent, which is the reason she is asking for a loan.

Carla comes from a family with good moral values and, above all, is very hard-working, so she was instilled with the values of humility, good resource management, respect, with an entrepreneurial vision to achieve the objectives that she has established over her professional career.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to build her office little by little and generate more sources of income for her family.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is a 22-year-old, mother with one child. She has a small business of selling vegetables (cabbage, eggplant, cucumbers) to earn a living. Ruta has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots, to assist her to run the business.

She will use her profits to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 57 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Merlinda has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sausage and other frozen foods to sell. Merlinda has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sausage and other frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 41 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. In the future, Juliet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ruth is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Abondia

texts.en:
Abondia lives in Misamis Occidental. She earns income through selling fish in their village, while her husband does fishing to support the needs of her family. She has been doing this for many years. She always wants to augment their situation to provide an improved living standard for her family.

Without hesitation, Abondia borrows an amount to buy new fishing nets. She is a member of GDMPC, and with her access to it, her goal of improving her business will become easier.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets to catch more fish to sell.

loans.name: Antidia

texts.en:
Antidia is a married woman with four children. She is 59 years old and resides in Aguada Extension, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Antidia owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living.

She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business. Antidia has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables, etc. to sell. Recently, she joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell in order to earn.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is a single woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 28 years old and has two children who are presently in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rochelle has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee, juice, snack foods, etc. She has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee, juice, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en:
Ivoga is 43 years old and married with two children. She lives in the island of Samoa. Ivoga owns and operates a convenience store in her village (location of the store, e.g. her village). She has been running her business for four years now.

Ivoga has requested for a loan to buy a freezer, box of twisties , box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausages etc., to assist her run the business. She became a member of SPBD in 2009.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, box of twisties , box of chicken, sack of flour, sack of sugar, sack of rice, box of tinned fish, box of vegetable oil, box of milk, box of sausages, etc.

loans.name: Seanguy

texts.en:
Seanguy is a 23-year-old single student. She is from Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Currently, she is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Business Management in her fourth year at university in the city. Her family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming as revenue, which makes it hard to pay for her tuition fees.

Seanguy is lacking the money to pay her fourth-year tuition fees, therefore she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to go through the fourth year successfully. After graduation, she hopes to find a good job with a decent salary to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to pay her fourth-year tuition fees in Business Management.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José Luis con 45 años de edad, de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia, junto a su esposa e hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. José Luis cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

José Luis se dedica a la actividad de servicio de transporte público en mototaxi, dedicándose a este rubro desde hace más de 10 años. Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de sus 2 mototaxis. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

José Luis a tenido préstamos para Edpyme Alternativa, el último fue de S/.2,500.00 el cuál lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
José Luis, age 45, is married. He lives in his own house with his wife and children in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in Peru.

José Luis has very good personal and work references from the residents of the area. José Luis provides public transportation services by mototaxi. He has been engaged in this line of work for over ten years.

He is requesting a loan for the maintenance and repair of his two mototaxis. This way he will make his business grow more, obtain more income, and be able to improve his quality of life.

José Luis has had loans with Edpyme Alternativa. The last was for S/.2,500.00, which he punctually repaid.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance and repair on his two 'mototaxis' [three wheeled motorized vehicles].

loans.name: July

texts.es:
July con 37 años de edad, de estado civil madre soltera,vive junto a sus hijos, en el distrito de Bolívar,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural.

July se dedica a la venta de ropa, prendas de vestir y calzado;cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio.Solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo-compra de mercadería; dicha inversión le servirá para amplear su negocio, para poder así incrementar sus ventas. July piensa mejorar y ampliar su stock para poder atender las necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

July es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
July, age 37, is a single mother. She lives with her children in a rural area in the district of Bolívar, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru.

July sells clothes and shoes, and she has over five years of experience in the business. The business is located at her house.

She is requesting a loan for working capital to buy merchandise. This investment will serve to expand her business in order to be able to increase her sales. July plans on improving and expanding her stock in order to be able to tend to the needs of the residents of the area.

July is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to have working capital in order to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 52 years old and a married woman with seven children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lilia has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. Lilia has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking, woman entrepreneur with seven children. She earns a living by fishing in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fish selling. Delia dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en: A local resident living in a rural village in Kratie province, Sinat is 26 years old and a mother of a young child. She has been growing cassava to earn an income for nine years. She also earns additional money by growing and selling black pepper as well. Her cassava plot has not been fertilized well, so it has grown not well and she has to sell it for a lower price. Sinat took out and successfully repaid two prior loans through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia. She is now leading a group of two to apply for a new Kiva loan. She plans to spend her portion on pesticides so as to protect her farm from threatening by insect. Sinat says her living conditions have improved since receiving her past loans. She hopes this protection of her crops against insects will result in better profits and living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her cassava fields to protect her farm from threatening by insect.

loans.name: Zedekia

texts.en: Zedekia is married and operates a retail shop in Kasese-Uganda. He also does farming to supplement his income. He is a very hardworking man who is knowledgeable about this business.  He now wants to add sacks of sugar, millet, and cassava flour among others to increase his sales. However he lacks adequate capital to meet his dream. Zedekia would be very grateful to borrow that money and would willingly pay back without any hassle.

loans.use: To buy sacks of sugar, cassava, and millet flour for selling

loans.name: Lizzel Ann

texts.en:
Lizzel Ann is 22 years of age and single. She finished a vocational course, but she chose to engage herself in managing a small business. Lizzel Ann owns a sari-sari store business in their village. Her wish is to have another business to have an additional source of income.

At present, Lizzel Ann utilizes her profits to help her parents provide for their daily needs. With regards to her wish, Lizzel Ann asks for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy drinks, condiments, biscuits, etc. She will also use her loan to buy piglets to raise as a stepping stone to attain her wish.

loans.use: to buy drinks, condiments, biscuits, etc., and also to buy piglets.

loans.name: Adelito

texts.en:
Adelito has been selling boiled eggs to make a living. For the past ten years, the business has been doing well and it gives better cash inflows to his family. So to improve the business, he took a new loan to purchase volume of eggs to sell. He plans to expand his business in order to gain more income for his family's needs.

Adelito’s plan for his future is to expand the business to sustain their daily needs and to save money for the bright future of his children.

loans.use: buy eggs to sell.

loans.name: Mycel

texts.en:
Mycel is 27 years old and a mother of one child. Mycel found a better way of living with her manufacturing business. She sells knitted bamboo and this business helps a lot to sustain their living. Her previous loan was successfully repaid. She was able to go to the neighboring villages to promote her business.

Recently, Mycel took a new loan to buy materials needed for making knitted bamboo. In the future, Mycel wants to improve her business as well as the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to knit bamboo.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marissa is 35 years old and four of her children are in school.

Marissa has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 29 years old and has two children. Jenelyn is married and one of her children is currently in school.

Jenelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business.

Jenelyn has been in pig fattening for 3 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Jenelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed & supplies.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 27 years old and single with two children. With one child still in school, Aiza works very hard to provide for her family.

Aiza runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, spices, milk, shampoo, noodles, etc. Aiza has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Aiza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old and married with five children. With two children in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home product care, and other groceries. Yolanda has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 55 years old and married with four children.

Elda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Elda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling school supplies.

Elda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is 31 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Bebelyn has been in pig fattening for three years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned good, noodles, shampoo and other personal care products.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 48 years old and married with three children. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Zenaida has been in this business for 11 years and also earns additional income from gasoline retailing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed & supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en: Neang is 32 years old and living in a small house located in Kandal province. He is a married father of two dependent children, one of whom is still in school while the other one is too young to attend school. To make a living, he has been growing rice for 13 years as his single main source of income. Because of the drought, he couldn’t get good yield as before. Recently, his current business allow him to save from the daily income about 5 USD per day for the emergency needs. This is the first time for him to get a loan with VisionFund. In a group of two members, he is the group leader. Neang will use his entire portion of loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to increase productivity of the crop yield. He hopes to get more output so that he can sell it in a good price, and he can upgrade his family’s living as well as his child's studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds to increase the productivity of the crop so that he can sell it in a good price to upgrade his family’s living as well as his child's studying.

loans.name: Sonia Ester

texts.es: Sonia de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella se dedica a la elaboración de ricas tortillas desde hace 11 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes ya que es un alimento muy vendible, este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Sonia is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her mother. She has made her living making delicious tortillas for the past 11 years. Her business is located in her place of residence and she has many customers since her food is very marketable. 

This business is her principal source of income and that's why she made the decision to ask for this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of corn by the 100 lb bag and lime to augment her sales and improve her economic income.

loans.use: to purchase corn by the 100 lb bag and lime.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Navy is a widowed woman living in Battambang province. She is 56 years old and a mother of two children. To make a living, she has worked as a construction worker to support herself for 36 years. Her current job earns her about 10 USD per day and she can save around 5 USD each day after her expenses. This is Navy's first loan with VisionFund. She is seeking this loan to buy land for building house to stay. She hopes she can provide her children a proper house so as to protect them in safety place and healthy.

loans.use: To buy land for building a proper house to stay so as to protect her children in safety place and healthy.

loans.name: Conrrado

texts.es:
Conrrado con 41 años de edad,de estado civil padre soltero, vive en casa propia junto a su hijo, en el distrito de Nueva Arica, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú, en una zona rural. Conrrado cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.

Conrrado se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería; con experiencia en el rubro hace más de 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de un par de mochilas fumigadoras, palanas, picos y otras herramientas que son utilizadas en la agricultura, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios.

Conrrado es socio reactivado en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Conrrado is 41 years old. He is a single father who lives with his son in his own home in the district of Nueva Arica, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Province, in a rural area of the country of Peru. Conrrado has very good personal and professional references from people who live in the area.

Conrrado works as a laborer. He has over 10 years of experience in this profession and his business is located in his home. He is requesting a loan to invest in fixed assets: a pair of fumigating backpacks, shovels, picks, and other tools that are used in farming. This will help him keep his tools in better shape and make him look better so he can offer better service.

Conrrado is a reactivated member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets; to buy a pair of fumigating backpacks, shovels, picks, and other tools that are using in farming.

loans.name: Sendy Pamela

texts.es:
Sendy Pamela con 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive en casa familiar, en el distrito de Nueva Arica,provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú. Sendy Pamela cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Sendy Pamela se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales como cerdos,gallinas, patos, cuyes,entre otros,cuenta con experiencia en el rubro hace más de 02 años aproximadamente. Solicita préstamo para invertir en compra de animales para venta,alimentos balanceados, y otros gastos diversos.

Sendy Pamela socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa. Cuenta con experiencia crediticia en otras instituciones.
texts.en:
Sendy Pamela, 20 years old, is single and lives in a family home in the district of New Arica, province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque, in the country of Peru. She has both very good personal and work references by the inhabitants of the area. The people of this town are mostly in agriculture, trade, and cattle raising.

Sendy Pamela makes a living breeding and selling animals such as pigs, chickens, ducks, guinea pigs, among others. She has had experience in this line of work for approximately more than two years now. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of animals for sale, formulated feed, and other miscellaneous expenses.

Sendy Pamela, a new partner to Edpyme Alternativa, has credit experience in other institutions.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of animals for sale, formulated feed, and other miscellaneous expenses.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: La señora Justa, vive en la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, zona típica de producción lechera y cuenta con un terreno y vaquitas para su actividad, tiene 62 años de edad y toda su vida ha trabajado con actividad agrícola de subsistencia y sus vacas producen leche, para este fin está habilitando parte de su terreno, donde está preparando la tierra para sembrar maíz, pasto y alfa que da de comer a su ganado, para ello necesita un préstamo para pagar al tractor, comprar semillas pagar al ayudante que es el que ayuda en esta labor agrícola que le servirá de respaldo para todo el año como forrajes para alimentación en el cuidado de sus vacas que están a punto de preñarse y poder de acá a doce meses producir la leche que le ayudara para sus ingresos, ella quiere además mejorar sus condiciones de vida porque le falta puerta de ingreso a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Justa lives in the south zone of Cochabamba city, which is an area typically known for milk production, and she counts on her land and cows for her living. She is 62 years old and has worked all her life in agriculture, and her livelihood is the milk that her cows produce. Because of this she is preparing part of her land to plant corn, grass, and alfalfa with which she will feed her cattle. 

For this she will need a loan to pay for the tractor, to purchase seeds, to pay an assistant who will help with agricultural labor. This will support fodder all year to feed the cows that are about to conceive and 12 months from now will produce milk that will help with her income. 

She would also like to improve her living conditions because she is lacking an entryway door for her house.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor, seeds, to pay assistant to improve milk production that she has and to improve her income.

loans.name: Leah Mae

texts.en:
Leah Mae is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leah Mae is 25 years old and both of her children are still in school.

Leah Mae has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leah Mae has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is 27 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Remalyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Remalyn has been in pig fattening for three years and earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
La siembra de arroz y frijoles, ha sido el principal sustento a lo largo de veinte años de la familia de José, un agricultor de cuarenta y tres años quien está actualmente casado y es padre de tres hijos, los cuales dependen de él económicamente.
José obtuvo un préstamo anteriormente, el cual utilizó para comprar abono y semillas de arroz, y explica que, este nuevo préstamo que solicita lo necesita para pagarle a un par de trabajadores y compra de insumos para la cosecha, de esta manera pordra terminar de cavar el pozo de su casa, el cual le servirá para hacer un cultivo de riego por goteo, además de, comprar insumos para sembrar el frijol y maíz de ciclo postrera, lo que le permitirá aumentar su cosecha y por ende sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José is a 43 year old farmer, he is married and father of three children who are financially dependent on him. For more than twenty years the principal livelihood of José's family has been sowing rice and beans.

José has had a loan before, which he used to buy fertilizer, seeds and rice. He explains that the new loan he has asked for is to pay for a pair of labourers and to buy materials for the harvest. This will allow him to finish digging a well for his home, enabling the creation of a field with trickle irrigation. He wants to buy supplies to sow end of season rice and beans, which will allow him to increase his harvest and hence his earnings.

loans.use: to pay for a pair of labourers and materials for the harvest.

loans.name: Ramona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Durante veinte años la principal fuente de ingresos de doña Ramona, ha sido su pulpería, a la cual le ha invertido todo su tiempo, dinero y esfuerzo, actualmente a sus cincuenta y ocho años, doña Ramona planea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio el cual quiere seguir viendo crecer.
Anteriormente doña Ramona había solicitado un préstamo, el cual fue aprobado y le sirvió para poder surtir su pulpería de diversos productos, tales como: pantalones, camisas, trajes de niños y un freezer, los cuales le dejaron un amplio margen de ganancias. Con este nuevo crédito que doña Ramona está solicitando, planea comprar diversos juguetes, ropa interior, platos y vasos plásticos, arroz, azúcar y aceite para seguir ampliando la gama de productos que ofrece.
texts.en:
For 20 years the main source of income for Ramona has been her grocery store. She has invested all of her time, money and effort into it. She is currently 58 years old and she plans to continue investing in her business and she wants to see it grow.

She has applied for a loan previously. It was approved and she was able to stock her grocery store with various products such as trousers, shirts, children's outfits and a freezer. These gave her a wide earnings margin. With this new loan that Ramona is applying for she plans to buy various toys, underwear, plastic plates and glasses, rice, sugar and oil to continue increasing the range of products that she offers.

loans.use: to buy various toys, underwear, plastic plates and glasses, rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Jemaimaofa

texts.en: Jemaimaofa is a 25-year-old mother with three children. She owns and operates a small business  selling BBQ in her community to earn a living. Jemaimaofa requested a loan to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, and aluminum foil to help her run the business. She has been doing this for more than two years and she hopes to build a restaurant in the near future using her business profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy a box of chicken, box of sausage, bottle of mushroom soy sauce, sack of onions, plates, tomato sauce, and aluminum foil,.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials for making sports clothing in order to support her family.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Reina de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, esta solicitando nuevamente otro credito ya que le esta yendo bien en sus ventas y gracias a sus ganancias es como ha podido salir adelante, ella quiere comprar la materia prima necesaria como maiz por quintales y cal y asi continuar con su trabajo para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Reina is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She has been making and selling tortillas for 4 years, from a business located in her home. She is requesting a new loan, because her sales are going well and thanks to her income she is able to get ahead. She would like to buy necessary basic materials such as corn by the quintal and lime, so that she can continue with her work for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal, and lime.

loans.name: Enkhtuul

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtuul, 32 years old, lives with her mother, sister and child in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling clothes for 8 years. She divorced her husband and raises her son on her own.

She is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy clothes in large amounts, in order to increase her working capital. By doing so will increase her business revenue and improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: La Amistad De Ollantaytambo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia Karen, la socia continua con su negocio de restaurant, la socia lleva años dedicándose al negocio a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua elaborando  diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite, carnes entre otros insumos.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank called “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”. This bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Sofia Karen, who continues her restaurant business. She has spent the last two years working this business which has been going well for her. Thanks to the effort she puts daily into her business, Sofia Karen continues to prepare different dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and various meat stir-frys, among others. Sofia Karen wishes to continue working in this way to keep supporting her family.

She requests a loan to buy rice, oil, meats, among other consumable goods. The member that appears in the attached picture requested for permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work-related reasons. The members in general are appreciative to those who form a part of this dream, and they promise to meet the payments in the set time-frame.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and meats, among other consumable goods.

loans.name: Verlie

texts.en: Verlie is married and a mother of four children. Verlie has been earning well by selling her bananas in the market. For more than four years, the business covers their daily expenditures, and she considers it as their main source of income. Verlie successfully repaid her previous loan for she is earning well from these activities. Recently, she took a new loan for the purpose of buying an organic fertilizer to have a more productive harvest. She wants to improve her banana farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana production

loans.name: Henedine

texts.en:
Henedine is 48 years old and married with seven children.

Henedine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Henedine has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Henedine aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marcelina is 37 years old and all of her children are still in school.

Marcelina has a buy and sell of spices business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more spices to sell.

Marcelina has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices to sell

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 45 years old and married with seven children. With four of her children currently in school, Marisa works very hard to provide for them.

Marisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Marisa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, detergent soap, shampoo, fabric conditioners, toothpaste, cooking oil, etc.

In the future, Marisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dúo Candelaria De Antigua Group

texts.es: Dúo Candelaria de Antigua Este dúo está formado por doña Irma Consuelo, ella tiene 53 años de edad y desde hace ya varios años se dedica a la venta de consumo Diario como azúcar, aguas gaseosas, papel higiénico,golocinas, detergente, en su domicilio, ubicado en la colonia el Carmen de Antigua Guatemala, ella está solicitando  el crédito para la compra de abarrotes para surtir su tienda y tener los productos básicos para la satisfacción de sus clientes,  su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo  el negocio, y sobre todo satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
The Candelaria Duo from Antigua

This duo includes Irma Consuelo, who is 53 years old. She has worked for several years selling basic grocery items such as sugar, carbonated drinks, toilet paper, candy and detergent from her home located in the Carmen district of Antigua Guatemala. She is requesting a loan to buy groceries to stock her store and to have basic products to satisfy her customers. Her greatest wish is to continue to grow her business, and above all to meet the needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Roubyatou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12  Novembre 2011, à l’inauguration du dit banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Roubyatou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée ; mère de 06 enfants. Son activité consiste à acheter des produits alimentaires pour les revendre en détails chez elle.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter des condiments (riz sucre huile raffiné huile de palme...) d’un montant de 80000f  payer un transport de 15000f 

Les bénéfices, elle compte aider son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne et s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Established November 12, 2011 at the inception of the village bank, this group is made up of women who have experience with banc villageois-style programs. They all come from the same village and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their primary [income-generating] activity is small business.

Mrs. Roubyatou (seated at far right [in the photo] with one hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of six children. Her business consists of purchasing foodstuffs to sell at retail prices from her home.

With her new loan, Mrs. Roubyatou plans to purchase staples (rice, sugar, refined oil, palm oil, etc.) for a total of 80,000 CFA francs and to pay for transportation costs totaling 15,000 CFA francs.

[With] the profits, she plans to help her husband manage the day-to-day expenses and care for her children.

loans.use: to purchase staples (rice, sugar, refined oil, palm oil, etc.) for a total of 80,000 CFA francs and to pay transportation costs of 15,000 CFA francs.

loans.name: Sountou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12  Novembre 2011, à l’inauguration du dit banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une bonne expérience en matière de crédit. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Sountou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée ; mère de 09 enfants. Son activité consiste à acheter de l’huile de palme et des légumes dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour les revendre en détails dans les autres régions.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter 27 bouteilles de 20 litres d’huile de palme à 16000f et des légumes d’un montant de 20000f et payer un transport de 40000f pour le revendre en détails chez elle. 

Les bénéfices, elle compte augmenter son activité aider son mari dans la dépense quotidienne et s’occuper de ses enfants soins médicaux scolarité et habillement.
texts.en:
Established November 12, 2011 at the inception of the banc villageois, this group is made up of women who are experienced with credit. They all come from the same village and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their primary [income-generating] activity is small business.

Mrs. Sountou (seated at far right [in the photo] with a hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of nine children. Her business consists of purchasing palm oil and vegetables in the weekly markets to sell at retail prices in other areas.

With her new loan, Mrs. Sountou plans to purchase 27 20-liter bottles of palm oil for 16,000 CFA francs and 20,000 CFA francs' worth of vegetables, as well as to pay 40,000 CFA francs in transportation costs in order to resell the[se products] at retail prices from her home.

[With] the profits, she plans to expand her business, help her husband with the day-to-day expenses, and see to her children's medical care, education, and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase 27 20-liter bottles of palm oil for 16,000 CFA francs and 20,000 CFA francs' worth of vegetables, and to pay transportation costs of 40,000 CFA francs.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a married woman who has three children to provide for. She owns and operates a transportation business, providing service to local community members. She has been in the business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP per month.

Eliza successfully repaid her previous loan. She is now taking a new loan to buy new tires and brake pads for her motorcycle for safe travel with customers. Eliza plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and brake pads

location.town: P-1, LAYAWAN, OROQUIETA CITY, MIS. OCC.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol. She owns a rice paddy and grows rice. Her husband is a farmer and also a carpenter. She is a 54 years old and has five children. Her youngest is 11 and still attending school.

Leonida has decided to take out a loan from CEVI to improve the yield of her farm. She has requested a loan to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and medicine. This will enable her to sell high-quality rice and slowly make an impact on her earnings.

Leonida successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her rice farming livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers and medicine

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelia is 49 years old and four of her children are currently in school.

Emelia has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. She has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her equipment.

Emelia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business equipment.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is a hardworking female entrepreneur with two children. She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 26,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Suzette dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Estrella is 55 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Estrella has a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store.

Estrella has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marietou's Group

texts.fr:
Créé le 12  Novembre 2011, à l’inauguration du dit banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mariétou (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée ; mère de 05 enfants. Son activité consiste à acheter des poussins, les engraissés pour les revendre en détails.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter des poussins, des aliments d’un montant de 150000f et payer un transport de 25000f payer l’eau et l’électricité d’un montant de 25000f aller retour pour le revendre en détails dans le marché local.

Les bénéfices, elle compte augmenter son activité et s’occuper de ses enfants scolarité, soins médicaux etc.…
texts.en:
Established November 12, 2011 at the inception of this banc villageois, this group is made up of women who have experience with banc villageois-style programs. They all come from the same village and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their primary [income-generating] activity is small business.

Mrs. Mariétou (seated at far right [in the photo] with one hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of five children. Her business consists of purchasing chicks and fattening them to sell at retail prices.

With her new loan, Mrs. Mariétou plans to purchase chicks and [chicken] feed totaling 150,000 CFA francs, as well as to pay 25,000 CFA francs toward water and electricity and 25,000 CFA francs for the round-trip [cost of traveling] to sell [the fattened chicks] at the local market.

[With] the profits, she plans to expand her business and see to her children's education, health care costs, etc.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and [chicken] feed for a total of 150,000 CFA francs, as well as to pay 25,000 CFA francs in transportation costs and 25,000 CFA francs toward water and electricity.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora  Sonia vive en el área rural con su pareja, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda es rustica de adobe con techo de teja española, que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su esposo para obtener ingresos económicos para el sustento de su hijos y de ella misma. Se dedica primordialmente a la agricultura, en esta actividad lleva 5 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa sus productos, lo que obtiene lo lleva a la venta en ferias provinciales de la región y pueblos aledaños, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, habas, cebada y otros en menor cantidad generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Sonia se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza), de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y obtener ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia lives in a rural area with her spouse. She was able to go to school as far as the primary level. Her home is made of rustic adobe with a Spanish tile roof, and lacks basic services. She is a hard-working person with a lot of enthusiasm, who works day to day along with her spouse to earn income to support herself and her children. For about 5 years she has worked mainly in agriculture, growing and selling her products. She takes what she grows to sell at fairs in the region and in surrounding towns. The main products that she grows are large quantities of potatoes, broad beans, barley, and other crops in small quantities for her own consumption. Sonia needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer (chicken droppings), in order to increase her production, continue her sales and earn more income to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (chicken droppings), in order to increase her production, continue her sales and earn more income to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora, a pesar de haber quedado sola cuando sus hijos eran pequeños, ella está orgullosa de haber podido sacarlos adelante, su hijo mayor emigro para el extranjero y su hija se graduó como secretaria y hoy trabaja en un despacho jurídico. 

Elena, se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales, ella vende todo tipo de medicinas naturales como pastillas hechas a base de plantas, shampoos, tratamientos para la piel y todo a base de botánica, tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a ello logro sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

Elena, necesita el préstamo para comprar productos medicinales naturales, porque ella trabaja con un proveedor que le facilita los productos, ella los vende a sus clientes, es por eso que necesita invertir en su negocio y también rentará un local para establecer su negocio, porque actualmente no lo tiene. 

Los sueños de Elena, son continuar con su trabajo y en un momento poder tener su propio local para establecerlo mejor.
texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old, and a very hardworking, enterprising woman. In spite of being on her own while her children were young, she is proud of their success. Her older son emigrated abroad, and her daughter graduated as a secretary and works in a law office. Elena works selling natural medicinal products. She sells all types of natural medicines, such as pills made from plants, shampoos, skin treatments, and all things botanical. She has over 10 years in this business, and thanks to it she was able to move her children forward.

Elena needs the loan to buy natural medicinal products, because she works with a provider who supplies the products, which she sells to her customers. That's why she needs to invest in her business. She will also rent a locale for her business, because she currently doesn't have one. The dreams of Elena are to continue with her work, and to have her own locale soon, to better establish herself.

loans.use: to buy natural medicinal products.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Morena de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 37 años a la elaboración y venta de pupusas su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, con lo que obtienen de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz y demás ingredientes y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos.
texts.en: Morena is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. She has worked for 37 years making and selling pupusas. Her business is located near her home, in a busy zone. With the income she earns from her sales she has been able to pay some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy pork cracklings, cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients so that she can continue with her work which generates a good income for her.

loans.use: to buy pork cracklings, cheese, beans, corn and other ingredients.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Don Gilberto de 66 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 30 años su esposa le ayuda con el negocio, adicional a eso tambien se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajo es como puede solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia por mayor como: sopas, granos basicos, macarrones, jabon, detergente, etc. y asi poder obtener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Don Gilberto is 66 years old. He lives in his own home with his wife and child. He has had a store located in his home for the last 30 years. His wife helps him with the business.

In addition to this he also grows basic grains. He is able to cover his household expenses with what he makes.

He is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as soups, basic grains, pasta, soap, detergent, etc. and as a result have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise at wholesale such as soups, basic grains, pasta, soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Molina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Molina works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Molina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients for her food production business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Робия, 48 лет, вдова, воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Робии - среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки скота на 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Робии, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, она продает экологически чистое домашнее молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). Робия старается накопленные средства вкладывать в развитие бизнеса. В этом году она решила сделать ремонт дома, поэтому и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов. Свои доходы Робия планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Robiya is 48 years old, widowed, raising three children, and also runs her own farm. Robiya has secondary education, and in order to bring in income for her family, she breeds livestock, having started with the purchase of livestock with 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Robiya's persistent hard work, today her farm has two cows, and she sells organic milk. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). 

Robiya tries to invest her savings in the development of her business. This year, she has decided to carry out renovations on her home, thus she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) in order to buy construction materials. Robiya plans to invest her funds in the further increase of her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to make some improvements in her house.

loans.name: Marlon Geovanny

texts.es:
Marlon, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, no pudo seguir debido a la falta de recursos económicos y solo creció con su abuela y tenia que trabajar cultivando granos básicos como maíz y frijoles; es padre de un niño de tres años de edad y su pareja está estudiando.

Marlon, desde temprana edad trabajó en el campo, cuidando los cultivos de maíz y de frijoles para asegurar la alimentación de la familia y de su abuela.- Pero demás de eso, cuando tenía ochos años de edad aprendió a tejer hamacas y a trabajar de esa manera, la elaboración de artesanías se lo enseño su abuela.- Ahora, elabora hamacas de seda y de poli-seda, trabaja todos los días después que viene de las labores agrícolas y le ayuda su esposa también cuando regresa de estudiar.

Marlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para abonar su cultivo de maíz y de frijoles y para comprar una caja de hilo de seda e hilo para hacer los manguillos de hamacas; asi podrá contar con materia prima que le permita la elaboración de las hamacas, para tener los ingresos suficientes para su familia. 

Marlon, suMueña con apoyar a su pareja en los estudios y que ella pueda superarse academicamente para encontrar un  trabajo digno.- Además, desea seguir siempre trabajando arduamente en la elaboración de hamacas, pues es un trabajo que le es rentable y deja buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Marlon, 23 years old, studied up to the ninth grade. He could not continue his education due to the lack of economic resources. He grew up with only his grandmother and had to work by growing basic grains such as corn and beans. He is the father of a three-year-old boy and his partner is studying.

Marlon began working in the fields at an early age, taking care of the corn and bean crops to make sure that his family and his grandmother had enough food. When he was eight years old, he learned how to weave hammocks and began to work in this way as well. The art of making handicrafts was taught to him by his grandmother. Now he makes hammocks out of silk and poly-silk. He works every day after he comes back from working on his crops. His wife helps him when she comes home from studying.

Marlon needs this loan to buy fertilizers for his crops of corn and beans, and to buy a box of silk yarn to make muffs for hammocks. With this, he will be able to have good-quality material that will allow him to make hammocks so that he can earn a sufficient income to support his family.

Marlon dreams of helping his partner with her studies and for her to succeed academically so that she can find a decent job. He also wants to continue working hard at making hammocks because it allows him to make good profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crop of corn and beans, and to buy a box of silk yarn to make muffs for hammocks.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo con 60 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive junto a su esposa e hija,en casa propia,en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Justo cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Justo se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte con ruta de Mocupe a Chiclayo, se dedica a este rubro hace más de 08 años.Solicita préstamo para la el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular. De esta manera podrá terne en buen estado su vehículo lo que le brindará mayor comodidad a los pasajeros.

Justo socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.Justo si a contado con historial crediticio en otras instituciones.
texts.en:
Justo, 60 years old, is married, and lives with his wife and daughter in his own house in the district of Lagunas, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru. Justo has many good personal and work references from the people in the zone. The people in this area work primarily in agriculture, trade and raising animals.

Justo works offering transportation services on the Mocupe-Chiclayo route. He has worked in this field for more than 8 years. He asks for a loan to maintain his vehicle. In this way he will be able to have his vehicle in good condition which will offer better comfort to his customers.

Justo is a new borrower for Edpyme Alternative. Justo has had a credit history with other institutions.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Jose Diego

texts.es:
José Diego con 52 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente ,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú,en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

José Diego se dedica a brindar servicio de jornaleria, hace 10 años dedicándose a este rubro,su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de una mochila para fumigar; esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios.

Socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José Diego is 52 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his spouse and children in a rural area of the district of Oyotún, Chiclayo province, in the department of Lambayeque, Perú, The inhabitants of this district works mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

José Diego works offering his services as a laborer. He has done this for ten years. His business is located at his house. He is requesting a loan to invest in fixed assets; like the purchase of a backpack sprayer for fumigating. This will help him to have his equipment in better condition and improve his appearance in being able to provide better services.

He is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets; to buy a backpack sprayer for fumigating.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, de 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijo, el niño está pequeño y aún no va a la escuela y su esposa es ama de casa. 

Antonio, se dedica a trabajar como motorista haciendo viajes particulares, pues él tiene un micro bus donde hace viajes a las personas que lo conocen.- Pero también se dedica a la venta de utensilios de aluminio de manera ambulante e informal; él sale a las comunidades cercanas a vender sus productos tales como ollas, comales, peroles y otras variedades de trastos. 

Antonio, necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para salir vender y generar más ganancias para él y su familia.

Los sueños de Antonio, son poder conseguir un local donde pueda establecer su negocio de manera formal.
texts.en:
Antonio is 33 years old, and lives with his wife and son. His son is small and doesn't yet attend school. His wife takes care of the home. Antonio works as a driver for individuals. He has a microbus which he uses to drive people he knows. But he also works selling aluminum utensils as an informal street vendor. He goes to the nearby communities to sell products such as pots, hotplates, bowls, and other types of cooking items.

Antonio needs the loan to buy merchandise to go out and sell and generate more earnings for him and his family. Antonio's dreams are to be able to acquire a locale where he can establish his business in a more formal manner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to go out and sell and generate more earnings for him and his family.

loans.name: Lusmila

texts.es:
Lusmila con 56 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive junto a sus padres y un hermano, en el distrito de Zaña, provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Lusmila se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, desde hace 15 años de experiencia en el rubro. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y aves de corral. Solicita préstamo para la compra de víveres para su negocio que el servirá para un ingreso adicional en el hogar.

Lusmila socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa, con anteriores préstamos invirtió en el mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Lusmila, 56 years old, is single and lives with her parents and a brother, in the district of Zaña, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru. The people in this area work primarily in agriculture, trade, and raising animals.

Lusmila works selling basic products and groceries, she has 15 years of experience in this field. In addition, she works raising and selling pigs and poultry. She asks for the loan to purchase groceries for her business which will serve her to bring additional income to the home.

Lusmilia is a repeat borrower with Edpyme Alternativa, with previous loans she invested in the same business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for her business.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane Group

texts.en:
Felicien is 32 years old and is married with four children who are between 1 and 8 years old. He is well-known in the business of selling various goods such as lotions, cooking oil, soap, rice, sugar, etc. which he has been doing for about nine years.

Felicien is the president of this group Dushyigikirane; he is holding a yellow school bag on his lap. There are 12 members in total with two people missing, who were far from where this group has taken their picture.

Felicien's hours of selling goods are from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day except on Sunday sometimes. He wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods such as lotions, cooking oil, soap, rice, sugar, etc. for resale.

With the profit from this loan, Felicien will be able to purchase enough food for the family, to buy new clothes for the children, to pay school fees for his children, to buy medical insurance for his family, and to expand his business by selling more and various goods in a different area. Explanation: The gentleman in light blue (who has his forehead partially cropped from the picture) is a member in the group. Thank you.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as lotions, cooking oil, soap, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sheruby

texts.en:
Sheruby is 27 years old and single. She works very hard to provide for herself.

Sheruby runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Sheruby has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, noodles, coffee, soap and other groceries.

In the future, Sheruby would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, rice, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 49 years old and married with three children; two children are presently in school. Sofia works very hard to provide for them.

Sofia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell in her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Sofia has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Sofia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of groceries to sell in her stall such as milk, coffee, drinks, bread, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Cheryll

texts.en:
Cheryll is 34 years old and married with three children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cheryll is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Cheryll has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, ellos viven solos en su casa, ya que sus hijos emigraron al extranjero en busca de mejores oportunidades para ayudar a sus padres.

Miguel, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol, hoy su producción ha bajado porque el invierno ha sido malo y la mayor parte de las cosechas se secaron, pero ese trabajo lo ha realizado desde que era joven y quiere intentar recuperar esa perdida. 

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar semilla, fertilizantes y pesticidas para sembrar nuevamente y así poder recuperar su cosecha y obtener ganancias para pagar el crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Los sueños de Miguel, son seguir trabajando y asi poder salir adelante con su esposa y tambien quiere ver a sus hijos muy pronto.
texts.en:
Miguel is 66 years old. He lives with his wife. They live alone in their house as their children emigrated abroad in search of better opportunities to help their parents. Miguel works in agriculture, growing corn and beans. Lately his production has decreased because the winter has been bad, and most of the crops dried out. But he has had this job since he was young, and wants to try to recoup that loss.

The loan will be used to buy seed, fertilizers and pesticides to plant again, in order to be able to recover his harvest, and obtain income to pay off the loan and improve his quality of life. Miguel's dreams are to continue working so that he can move forward with his wife. He would also like to see his children soon.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Charline

texts.fr:
Charline a 52 ans, elle s’est mariée à l’âge de 18 ans. Trois de ses quatre enfants suivent leurs études dans une école privée, l’aîné de 18 ans suit une formation professionnelle. Son mari est chauffeur.
Avant elle avait géré une petite unité de gargote ( 2003 à 2010). En raison des effets néfastes de l’utilisation du charbon, elle a abandonné cette première activité. De 2010 à 1012, elle s’adonnait à l’élevage de poulets de chair et à l’élevage porcin, mais en raison de la saturation du marché dans la zone, elle a ajouté d’autre activité. Actuellement, elle est aussi grossiste en produits locaux , elle approvisionne les détaillants dans la zone. C’est une activité rentable et viable. Le prêt sert à acheter divers produits  en sacs : riz de différentes variétés, haricot sec, café , farine de riz. L’objectif est d’augmenter des produits en quantité, qualité et variété.
Le rêve du couple est la réussite de leurs enfants dans leurs études et qu’ils soient à l’avenir autonomes.
texts.en:
Charline is 52 years old. She got married at the age of 18. Three of her four children are studying in a private school. The eldest, aged 18, is attending professional training. Her husband is a driver.

Earlier, Charline ran a little snack bar (from 2003 to 2010). Because of the harm she suffered from charcoal fumes, she gave up this first business. From 2010 to 2012, she worked at raising broiler chickens and pigs, but since so many entrepreneurs are in that field and the market is saturated, Charline added another business.

Presently she has become a wholesale supplier of local produce, supplying retailers in the area. This is a lucrative and viable business. The loan will allow her to buy various produce in sacks: various different types of rice, dried beans, coffee, and rice flour. Her objective is to increase the quantity, quality, and variety of produce.

The couple's dream is to see their children succeed in their studies and become independent in future.

loans.use: to buy different sorts of local produce to resell wholesale, supplying local retailers.

loans.name: Faifili

texts.en: Faifili is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling ice cake in her village to earn a living. Faifili requested for a loan to buy ice bag, sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, containers, freezer, to assist her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy ice bag, sack of sugar, coolio, plastic bags, containers, freezer,

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 34 years old and single with four children.

Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal product care, home product care, and other groceries.

Julie has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buy and sell frozen foods.

Julie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal product care, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman, 57 years old with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lucia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business.

Lucia has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 52 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Genevieve works very hard to provide for them.

Genevieve runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell.

Genevieve has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Genevieve would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, candies, biscuits, noodles, coffee, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is 39 years old and has seven children. Ma. Liza is married and has five children who are currently in school.

Ma. Liza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Liza requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Liza has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Liza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Melrose

texts.en:
Melrose is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Melrose has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF nine times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Feliciana is 56 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Feliciana has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Feliciana has been in this business for 36 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 39 years old and has seven children. Melanie is married and has four children are presently in school.

Melanie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melanie has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 60-year-old hardworking married man and the dedicated father of four children aged 9, 12, 14, and 17 years old. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also takes care of two other children who are his relatives. He used his previous loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. He deals in the selling of secondhand clothes, which he supplements with farming to earn extra income and has improved the standard of living for his family. James works for eight hours each of the seven days worked in the week. His dream is to stop moving to different markets and have a boutique so as to earn more profit in order to educate all his children and equip them with skills that can also help them earn a living and income to sustain themselves. His main challenges are competition and the high rate of debtors.

He wishes to use the loan facility to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Santos Marivel

texts.es:
Santos, de 39 años de edad, creció junto a sus padres cultivando maíz, frijoles y maicillo en la comunidad donde creció; cuando tenía 19 años se acompaño y su pareja trabaja en la agricultura, ella es madre de dos hijos varones. 

Santos, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde que tiene 15 años de edad y fue por iniciativa propia que decidió dedicarse a este negocio, desde entonces trabaja todos los días de la semana y se levanta muy temprano para ir a moler el maíz y luego hacer las tortillas a sus clientes; su pareja y uno de sus hijos le ayudan a ir a dejarlas al pueblo a donde los clientes que ella tiene. 

Santos, necesita el préstamo para comprar seis quintales de maíz, cal y dos comales artesanales más,  para tener la materia prima y su equipo completo para hacer las tortillas.- Esto le será de mucha ayuda, pues de esa manera asegurara las ventas en los meses próximos.

Santos, sueña con hacer su hogar de adobe para vivir en mejores condiciones y más segura para su familia, porque su casa es de bahareque y se mete mucho el agua cuando llueve.- Además, espera en el futuro poder comprar una cocina industrial, para tener un equipo en mejores condiciones que le permitan hacer más tortillas en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Santos is 39 years old. She grew up working with her parents to grow corn, beans and sorghum in her community. When she was 19 she began a relationship with her spouse, who works in agriculture. She is the mother of two boys.

Santos has worked selling tortillas since she was 15. She began this activity on her own initiative, and since then has worked at it every day of the week. She gets up very early to go and grind the corn and then make the tortillas for her customers. Her spouse and one of her sons help her take them to her clients in the town.

Santos needs a loan to buy six quintals of corn, lime, and two more traditional griddles to make the tortillas. This will help her a lot, because it will ensure her sales for the coming months.

Santos dreams of making her house better and safer for her family, because her house is made of adobe and allows a lot of water in when it rains. She also hopes in future to buy an industrial stove, so that she will have equipment in better conditions that will allow her to make tortillas faster.

loans.use: to buy six quintals of corn, lime, and two  more traditional griddles.

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina live in Liquisa, she is married and her husband is in agriculture. She was also one of the entrepreneurs and her business is selling pigs. Her husband is very supportive for her to sell pigs. She started to sell pigs a few years ago, with own working capital of $ 1,000.00.

She is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add with their capital to buy more pigs, Because It's become their activity. She is very happy with the loan that offered by the Tuba Rai Metin, because she could use this loan for improving her management.

loans.use: to buy pigs.
